02941 ! 20020502  Corrected declarations in descriptions of user routines.
02942 ! 20031105  Restored 'own' variables to Common blocks, to enable
02943 !           interrupt/restart feature.
02944 ! 20031112  Added SAVE statements for data-loaded constants.
02945 !
02946 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
02947 ! Other routines in the DLSODES package.
02948 !
02949 ! In addition to Subroutine DLSODES, the DLSODES package includes the
02950 ! following subroutines and function routines:
02951 !  DIPREP   acts as an iterface between DLSODES and DPREP, and also does
02952 !           adjusting of work space pointers and work arrays.
02953 !  DPREP    is called by DIPREP to compute sparsity and do sparse matrix
02954 !           preprocessing if MITER = 1 or 2.
02955 !  JGROUP   is called by DPREP to compute groups of Jacobian column
02956 !           indices for use when MITER = 2.
02957 !  ADJLR    adjusts the length of required sparse matrix work space.
02958 !           It is called by DPREP.
02959 !  CNTNZU   is called by DPREP and counts the nonzero elements in the
02960 !           strict upper triangle of J + J-transpose, where J = df/dy.
02961 !  DINTDY   computes an interpolated value of the y vector at t = TOUT.
02962 !  DSTODE   is the core integrator, which does one step of the
02963 !           integration and the associated error control.
02964 !  DCFODE   sets all method coefficients and test constants.
02965 !  DPRJS    computes and preprocesses the Jacobian matrix J = df/dy
02966 !           and the Newton iteration matrix P = I - h*l0*J.
02967 !  DSOLSS   manages solution of linear system in chord iteration.
02968 !  DEWSET   sets the error weight vector EWT before each step.
02969 !  DVNORM   computes the weighted RMS-norm of a vector.
02970 !  DSRCMS   is a user-callable routine to save and restore
02971 !           the contents of the internal Common blocks.
02972 !  ODRV     constructs a reordering of the rows and columns of
02973 !           a matrix by the minimum degree algorithm.  ODRV is a
02974 !           driver routine which calls Subroutines MD, MDI, MDM,
02975 !           MDP, MDU, and SRO.  See Ref. 2 for details.  (The ODRV
02976 !           module has been modified since Ref. 2, however.)
02977 !  CDRV     performs reordering, symbolic factorization, numerical
02978 !           factorization, or linear system solution operations,
02979 !           depending on a path argument ipath.  CDRV is a
02980 !           driver routine which calls Subroutines NROC, NSFC,
02981 !           NNFC, NNSC, and NNTC.  See Ref. 3 for details.
02982 !           DLSODES uses CDRV to solve linear systems in which the
02983 !           coefficient matrix is  P = I - con*J, where I is the
02984 !           identity, con is a scalar, and J is an approximation to
02985 !           the Jacobian df/dy.  Because CDRV deals with rowwise
02986 !           sparsity descriptions, CDRV works with P-transpose, not P.
02987 !  DUMACH   computes the unit roundoff in a machine-independent manner.
02988 !  XERRWD, XSETUN, XSETF, IXSAV, and IUMACH  handle the printing of all
02989 !           error messages and warnings.  XERRWD is machine-dependent.
02990 ! Note:  DVNORM, DUMACH, IXSAV, and IUMACH are function routines.
02991 ! All the others are subroutines.
02992 !
02993 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
02994 EXTERNAL DPRJS, DSOLSS
02995 DOUBLE PRECISION DUMACH, DVNORM
02996 INTEGER INIT, MXSTEP, MXHNIL, NHNIL, NSLAST, NYH, IOWNS, ICF, IERPJ, IERSL, JCUR, JSTART, KFLAG, L, LYH, LEWT
02997 INTEGER LACOR, LSAVF, LWM, LIWM, METH, MITER, MAXORD, MAXCOR, MSBP, MXNCF, N, NQ, NST, NFE, NJE, NQU
02998 INTEGER IPLOST, IESP, ISTATC, IYS, IBA, IBIAN, IBJAN, IBJGP, IPIAN, IPJAN, IPJGP, IPIGP, IPR, IPC, IPIC, IPISP
02999 INTEGER IPRSP, IPA, LENYH, LENYHM, LENWK, LREQ, LRAT, LREST, LWMIN, MOSS, MSBJ, NSLJ, NGP, NLU, NNZ, NSP, NZL, NZU
03000 INTEGER I, I1, I2, IFLAG, IMAX, IMUL, IMXER, IPFLAG, IPGO, IREM, J, KGO, LENRAT, LENYHT, LENIW, LENRW, LF0, LIA
03001 INTEGER LJA, LRTEM, LWTEM, LYHD, LYHN, MF1, MORD, MXHNL0, MXSTP0, NCOLM
03002 DOUBLE PRECISION ROWNS, CCMAX, EL0, H, HMIN, HMXI, HU, RC, TN, UROUND
03003 DOUBLE PRECISION CON0, CONMIN, CCMXJ, PSMALL, RBIG, SETH
03004 DOUBLE PRECISION ATOLI, AYI, BIG, EWTI, H0, HMAX, HMX, RH, RTOLI, TCRIT, TDIST, TNEXT, TOL, TOLSF, TP, SIZE, SUM, W0
03005 DIMENSION MORD(2)
03006 LOGICAL IHIT
03007 character(len=60) MSG
03008 SAVE LENRAT, MORD, MXSTP0, MXHNL0
03009 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
03010 ! The following two internal Common blocks contain
03011 ! (a) variables which are local to any subroutine but whose values must
03012 !     be preserved between calls to the routine ("own" variables), and
03013 ! (b) variables which are communicated between subroutines.
03014 ! The block DLS001 is declared in subroutines DLSODES, DIPREP, DPREP,
03015 ! DINTDY, DSTODE, DPRJS, and DSOLSS.
03016 ! The block DLSS01 is declared in subroutines DLSODES, DIPREP, DPREP,
03017 ! DPRJS, and DSOLSS.
03018 ! Groups of variables are replaced by dummy arrays in the Common
03019 ! declarations in routines where those variables are not used.
03020 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
03021 COMMON /DLS001/ ROWNS(209), CCMAX, EL0, H, HMIN, HMXI, HU, RC, TN, UROUND, INIT, MXSTEP, MXHNIL, NHNIL, NSLAST, NYH, & 
03022 IOWNS( 6), ICF, IERPJ, IERSL, JCUR, JSTART, KFLAG, L, LYH, LEWT, LACOR, LSAVF, LWM, LIWM, METH, MITER, MAXORD, MAXCOR, & 
03023 MSBP, MXNCF , N, NQ, NST, NFE, NJE, NQU
03024 !
03025 COMMON /DLSS01/ CON0, CONMIN, CCMXJ, PSMALL, RBIG, SETH, IPLOST, IESP, ISTATC, IYS, IBA, IBIAN, IBJAN, IBJGP, IPIAN, IPJAN, &
03026 IPJGP, IPIGP, IPR, IPC, IPIC, IPISP, IPRSP, IPA, LENYH, LENYHM, LENWK, LREQ, LRAT, LREST, LWMIN, MOSS, MSBJ, NSLJ, NGP, &
03027 NLU, NNZ, NSP, NZL, NZU
03028 !
03029 DATA MORD(1),MORD(2)/12,5/, MXSTP0/500/, MXHNL0/10/
03030 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
03031 ! In the Data statement below, set LENRAT equal to the ratio of
03032 ! the wordlength for a real number to that for an integer.  Usually,
03033 ! LENRAT = 1 for single precision and 2 for double precision.  If the
03034 ! true ratio is not an integer, use the next smaller integer (.ge. 1).
03035 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
03036 DATA LENRAT/2/
03037 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
03038 ! Block A.
03039 ! This code block is executed on every call.
03040 ! It tests ISTATE and ITASK for legality and branches appropriately.
03041 ! If ISTATE .gt. 1 but the flag INIT shows that initialization has
03042 ! not yet been done, an error return occurs.
03043 ! If ISTATE = 1 and TOUT = T, return immediately.
03044 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
03045 IF (ISTATE .LT. 1 .OR. ISTATE .GT. 3) GOTO 601
03046 IF (ITASK .LT. 1 .OR. ITASK .GT. 5) GOTO 602
03047 IF (ISTATE .EQ. 1) GOTO 10
03048 IF (INIT .EQ. 0) GOTO 603
03049 IF (ISTATE .EQ. 2) GOTO 200
03050 GOTO 20
03051 10   INIT = 0
03052 IF (TOUT .EQ. T) RETURN
03053 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
03054 ! Block B.
03055 ! The next code block is executed for the initial call (ISTATE = 1),
03056 ! or for a continuation call with parameter changes (ISTATE = 3).
03057 ! It contains checking of all inputs and various initializations.
03058 ! If ISTATE = 1, the final setting of work space pointers, the matrix
03059 ! preprocessing, and other initializations are done in Block C.
03060 !
03061 ! First check legality of the non-optional inputs NEQ, ITOL, IOPT,
03062 ! MF, ML, and MU.
03063 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
03064 20   IF (NEQ(1) .LE. 0) GOTO 604
03065 IF (ISTATE .EQ. 1) GOTO 25
03066 IF (NEQ(1) .GT. N) GOTO 605
03067 25   N = NEQ(1)
03068 IF (ITOL .LT. 1 .OR. ITOL .GT. 4) GOTO 606
03069 IF (IOPT .LT. 0 .OR. IOPT .GT. 1) GOTO 607
03070 MOSS = MF/100
03071 MF1 = MF - 100*MOSS
03072 METH = MF1/10
03073 MITER = MF1 - 10*METH
03074 IF (MOSS .LT. 0 .OR. MOSS .GT. 2) GOTO 608
03075 IF (METH .LT. 1 .OR. METH .GT. 2) GOTO 608
03076 IF (MITER .LT. 0 .OR. MITER .GT. 3) GOTO 608
03077 IF (MITER .EQ. 0 .OR. MITER .EQ. 3) MOSS = 0
03078 ! Next process and check the optional inputs. --------------------------
03079 IF (IOPT .EQ. 1) GOTO 40
03080 MAXORD = MORD(METH)
03081 MXSTEP = MXSTP0
03082 MXHNIL = MXHNL0
03083 IF (ISTATE .EQ. 1) H0 = 0.0D0
03084 HMXI = 0.0D0
03085 HMIN = 0.0D0
03086 SETH = 0.0D0
03087 GOTO 60
03088 40   MAXORD = IWORK(5)
03089 IF (MAXORD .LT. 0) GOTO 611
03090 IF (MAXORD .EQ. 0) MAXORD = 100
03091 MAXORD = MIN(MAXORD,MORD(METH))
03092 MXSTEP = IWORK(6)
03093 IF (MXSTEP .LT. 0) GOTO 612
03094 IF (MXSTEP .EQ. 0) MXSTEP = MXSTP0
03095 MXHNIL = IWORK(7)
03096 IF (MXHNIL .LT. 0) GOTO 613
03097 IF (MXHNIL .EQ. 0) MXHNIL = MXHNL0
03098 IF (ISTATE .NE. 1) GOTO 50
03099 H0 = RWORK(5)
03100 IF ((TOUT - T)*H0 .LT. 0.0D0) GOTO 614
03101 50   HMAX = RWORK(6)
03102 IF (HMAX .LT. 0.0D0) GOTO 615
03103 HMXI = 0.0D0
03104 IF (HMAX .GT. 0.0D0) HMXI = 1.0D0/HMAX
03105 HMIN = RWORK(7)
03106 IF (HMIN .LT. 0.0D0) GOTO 616
03107 SETH = RWORK(8)
03108 IF (SETH .LT. 0.0D0) GOTO 609
03109 ! Check RTOL and ATOL for legality. ------------------------------------
03110 60   RTOLI = RTOL(1)
03111 ATOLI = ATOL(1)
03112 DO 65 I = 1,N
03113 IF (ITOL .GE. 3) RTOLI = RTOL(I)
03114 IF (ITOL .EQ. 2 .OR. ITOL .EQ. 4) ATOLI = ATOL(I)
03115 IF (RTOLI .LT. 0.0D0) GOTO 619
03116 IF (ATOLI .LT. 0.0D0) GOTO 620
03117 65     CONTINUE
03118 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
03119 ! Compute required work array lengths, as far as possible, and test
03120 ! these against LRW and LIW.  Then set tentative pointers for work
03121 ! arrays.  Pointers to RWORK/IWORK segments are named by prefixing L to
03122 ! the name of the segment.  E.g., the segment YH starts at RWORK(LYH).
03123 ! Segments of RWORK (in order) are denoted  WM, YH, SAVF, EWT, ACOR.
03124 ! If MITER = 1 or 2, the required length of the matrix work space WM
03125 ! is not yet known, and so a crude minimum value is used for the
03126 ! initial tests of LRW and LIW, and YH is temporarily stored as far
03127 ! to the right in RWORK as possible, to leave the maximum amount
03128 ! of space for WM for matrix preprocessing.  Thus if MITER = 1 or 2
03129 ! and MOSS .ne. 2, some of the segments of RWORK are temporarily
03130 ! omitted, as they are not needed in the preprocessing.  These
03131 ! omitted segments are: ACOR if ISTATE = 1, EWT and ACOR if ISTATE = 3
03132 ! and MOSS = 1, and SAVF, EWT, and ACOR if ISTATE = 3 and MOSS = 0.
03133 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
03134 LRAT = LENRAT
03135 IF (ISTATE .EQ. 1) NYH = N
03136 LWMIN = 0
03137 IF (MITER .EQ. 1) LWMIN = 4*N + 10*N/LRAT
03138 IF (MITER .EQ. 2) LWMIN = 4*N + 11*N/LRAT
03139 IF (MITER .EQ. 3) LWMIN = N + 2
03140 LENYH = (MAXORD+1)*NYH
03141 LREST = LENYH + 3*N
03142 LENRW = 20 + LWMIN + LREST
03143 IWORK(17) = LENRW
03144 LENIW = 30
03145 IF (MOSS .EQ. 0 .AND. MITER .NE. 0 .AND. MITER .NE. 3) LENIW = LENIW + N + 1
03146 IWORK(18) = LENIW
03147 IF (LENRW .GT. LRW) GOTO 617
03148 IF (LENIW .GT. LIW) GOTO 618
03149 LIA = 31
03150 IF (MOSS .EQ. 0 .AND. MITER .NE. 0 .AND. MITER .NE. 3) LENIW = LENIW + IWORK(LIA+N) - 1
03151 IWORK(18) = LENIW
03152 IF (LENIW .GT. LIW) GOTO 618
03153 LJA = LIA + N + 1
03154 LIA = MIN(LIA,LIW)
03155 LJA = MIN(LJA,LIW)
03156 LWM = 21
03157 IF (ISTATE .EQ. 1) NQ = 1
03158 NCOLM = MIN(NQ+1,MAXORD+2)
03159 LENYHM = NCOLM*NYH
03160 LENYHT = LENYH
03161 IF (MITER .EQ. 1 .OR. MITER .EQ. 2) LENYHT = LENYHM
03162 IMUL = 2
03163 IF (ISTATE .EQ. 3) IMUL = MOSS
03164 IF (MOSS .EQ. 2) IMUL = 3
03165 LRTEM = LENYHT + IMUL*N
03166 LWTEM = LWMIN
03167 IF (MITER .EQ. 1 .OR. MITER .EQ. 2) LWTEM = LRW - 20 - LRTEM
03168 LENWK = LWTEM
03169 LYHN = LWM + LWTEM
03170 LSAVF = LYHN + LENYHT
03171 LEWT = LSAVF + N
03172 LACOR = LEWT + N
03173 ISTATC = ISTATE
03174 IF (ISTATE .EQ. 1) GOTO 100
03175 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
03176 ! ISTATE = 3.  Move YH to its new location.
03177 ! Note that only the part of YH needed for the next step, namely
03178 ! MIN(NQ+1,MAXORD+2) columns, is actually moved.
03179 ! A temporary error weight array EWT is loaded if MOSS = 2.
03180 ! Sparse matrix processing is done in DIPREP/DPREP if MITER = 1 or 2.
03181 ! If MAXORD was reduced below NQ, then the pointers are finally set
03182 ! so that SAVF is identical to YH(*,MAXORD+2).
03183 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
03184 LYHD = LYH - LYHN
03185 IMAX = LYHN - 1 + LENYHM
03186 ! Move YH.  Move right if LYHD < 0; move left if LYHD > 0. -------------
03187 IF (LYHD .LT. 0) THEN
03188 DO 72 I = LYHN,IMAX
03189 J = IMAX + LYHN - I
03190 72       RWORK(J) = RWORK(J+LYHD)
03191 ENDIF
03192 IF (LYHD .GT. 0) THEN
03193 DO 76 I = LYHN,IMAX
03194 76       RWORK(I) = RWORK(I+LYHD)
03195 ENDIF
03196 80   LYH = LYHN
03197 IWORK(22) = LYH
03198 IF (MITER .EQ. 0 .OR. MITER .EQ. 3) GOTO 92
03199 IF (MOSS .NE. 2) GOTO 85
03200 ! Temporarily load EWT if MITER = 1 or 2 and MOSS = 2. -----------------
03201 CALL DEWSET (N, ITOL, RTOL, ATOL, RWORK(LYH), RWORK(LEWT))
03202 DO 82 I = 1,N
03203 IF (RWORK(I+LEWT-1) .LE. 0.0D0) GOTO 621
03204 82     RWORK(I+LEWT-1) = 1.0D0/RWORK(I+LEWT-1)
03205 85   CONTINUE
03206 ! DIPREP and DPREP do sparse matrix preprocessing if MITER = 1 or 2. ---
03207 LSAVF = MIN(LSAVF,LRW)
03208 LEWT = MIN(LEWT,LRW)
03209 LACOR = MIN(LACOR,LRW)
03210 CALL DIPREP (NEQ, Y, RWORK, IWORK(LIA),IWORK(LJA), IPFLAG, F, JAC)
03211 LENRW = LWM - 1 + LENWK + LREST
03212 IWORK(17) = LENRW
03213 IF (IPFLAG .NE. -1) IWORK(23) = IPIAN
03214 IF (IPFLAG .NE. -1) IWORK(24) = IPJAN
03215 IPGO = -IPFLAG + 1
03216 GOTO (90, 628, 629, 630, 631, 632, 633), IPGO
03217 90   IWORK(22) = LYH
03218 IF (LENRW .GT. LRW) GOTO 617
03219 ! Set flag to signal parameter changes to DSTODE. ----------------------
03220 92   JSTART = -1
03221 IF (N .EQ. NYH) GOTO 200
03222 ! NEQ was reduced.  Zero part of YH to avoid undefined references. -----
03223 I1 = LYH + L*NYH
03224 I2 = LYH + (MAXORD + 1)*NYH - 1
03225 IF (I1 .GT. I2) GOTO 200
03226 DO 95 I = I1,I2
03227 95     RWORK(I) = 0.0D0
03228 GOTO 200
03229 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
03230 ! Block C.
03231 ! The next block is for the initial call only (ISTATE = 1).
03232 ! It contains all remaining initializations, the initial call to F,
03233 ! the sparse matrix preprocessing (MITER = 1 or 2), and the
03234 ! calculation of the initial step size.
03235 ! The error weights in EWT are inverted after being loaded.
03236 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
03237 100  CONTINUE
03238 LYH = LYHN
03239 IWORK(22) = LYH
03240 TN = T
03241 NST = 0
03242 H = 1.0D0
03243 NNZ = 0
03244 NGP = 0
03245 NZL = 0
03246 NZU = 0
03247 ! Load the initial value vector in YH. ---------------------------------
03248 DO 105 I = 1,N
03249 105    RWORK(I+LYH-1) = Y(I)
03250 ! Initial call to F.  (LF0 points to YH(*,2).) -------------------------
03251 LF0 = LYH + NYH
03252 CALL F (NEQ, T, Y, RWORK(LF0))
03253 NFE = 1
03254 ! Load and invert the EWT array.  (H is temporarily set to 1.0.) -------
03255 CALL DEWSET (N, ITOL, RTOL, ATOL, RWORK(LYH), RWORK(LEWT))
03256 DO 110 I = 1,N
03257 IF (RWORK(I+LEWT-1) .LE. 0.0D0) GOTO 621
03258 110    RWORK(I+LEWT-1) = 1.0D0/RWORK(I+LEWT-1)
03259 IF (MITER .EQ. 0 .OR. MITER .EQ. 3) GOTO 120
03260 ! DIPREP and DPREP do sparse matrix preprocessing if MITER = 1 or 2. ---
03261 LACOR = MIN(LACOR,LRW)
03262 CALL DIPREP (NEQ, Y, RWORK, IWORK(LIA),IWORK(LJA), IPFLAG, F, JAC)
03263 LENRW = LWM - 1 + LENWK + LREST
03264 IWORK(17) = LENRW
03265 IF (IPFLAG .NE. -1) IWORK(23) = IPIAN
03266 IF (IPFLAG .NE. -1) IWORK(24) = IPJAN
03267 IPGO = -IPFLAG + 1
03268 GOTO (115, 628, 629, 630, 631, 632, 633), IPGO
03269 115  IWORK(22) = LYH
03270 IF (LENRW .GT. LRW) GOTO 617
03271 ! Check TCRIT for legality (ITASK = 4 or 5). ---------------------------
03272 120  CONTINUE
03273 IF (ITASK .NE. 4 .AND. ITASK .NE. 5) GOTO 125
03274 TCRIT = RWORK(1)
03275 IF ((TCRIT - TOUT)*(TOUT - T) .LT. 0.0D0) GOTO 625
03276 IF (H0 .NE. 0.0D0 .AND. (T + H0 - TCRIT)*H0 .GT. 0.0D0) H0 = TCRIT - T
03277 ! Initialize all remaining parameters. ---------------------------------
03278 125  UROUND = DUMACH()
03279 JSTART = 0
03280 IF (MITER .NE. 0) RWORK(LWM) = SQRT(UROUND)
03281 MSBJ = 50
03282 NSLJ = 0
03283 CCMXJ = 0.2D0
03284 PSMALL = 1000.0D0*UROUND
03285 RBIG = 0.01D0/PSMALL
03286 NHNIL = 0
03287 NJE = 0
03288 NLU = 0
03289 NSLAST = 0
03290 HU = 0.0D0
03291 NQU = 0
03292 CCMAX = 0.3D0
03293 MAXCOR = 3
03294 MSBP = 20
03295 MXNCF = 10
03296 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
03297 ! The coding below computes the step size, H0, to be attempted on the
03298 ! first step, unless the user has supplied a value for this.
03299 ! First check that TOUT - T differs significantly from zero.
03300 ! A scalar tolerance quantity TOL is computed, as MAX(RTOL(i))
03301 ! if this is positive, or MAX(ATOL(i)/ABS(Y(i))) otherwise, adjusted
03302 ! so as to be between 100*UROUND and 1.0E-3.
03303 ! Then the computed value H0 is given by..
03304 !                                      NEQ
03305 !   H0**2 = TOL / ( w0**-2 + (1/NEQ) * Sum ( f(i)/ywt(i) )**2  )
03306 !                                       1
03307 ! where   w0     = MAX ( ABS(T), ABS(TOUT) ),
03308 !         f(i)   = i-th component of initial value of f,
03309 !         ywt(i) = EWT(i)/TOL  (a weight for y(i)).
03310 ! The sign of H0 is inferred from the initial values of TOUT and T.
03311 ! ABS(H0) is made .le. ABS(TOUT-T) in any case.
03312 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
03313 LF0 = LYH + NYH
03314 IF (H0 .NE. 0.0D0) GOTO 180
03315 TDIST = ABS(TOUT - T)
03316 W0 = MAX(ABS(T),ABS(TOUT))
03317 IF (TDIST .LT. 2.0D0*UROUND*W0) GOTO 622
03318 TOL = RTOL(1)
03319 IF (ITOL .LE. 2) GOTO 140
03320 DO 130 I = 1,N
03321 130    TOL = MAX(TOL,RTOL(I))
03322 140  IF (TOL .GT. 0.0D0) GOTO 160
03323 ATOLI = ATOL(1)
03324 DO 150 I = 1,N
03325 IF (ITOL .EQ. 2 .OR. ITOL .EQ. 4) ATOLI = ATOL(I)
03326 AYI = ABS(Y(I))
03327 IF (AYI .NE. 0.0D0) TOL = MAX(TOL,ATOLI/AYI)
03328 150    CONTINUE
03329 160  TOL = MAX(TOL,100.0D0*UROUND)
03330 TOL = MIN(TOL,0.001D0)
03331 SUM = DVNORM (N, RWORK(LF0), RWORK(LEWT))
03332 SUM = 1.0D0/(TOL*W0*W0) + TOL*SUM**2
03333 H0 = 1.0D0/SQRT(SUM)
03334 H0 = MIN(H0,TDIST)
03335 H0 = SIGN(H0,TOUT-T)
03336 ! Adjust H0 if necessary to meet HMAX bound. ---------------------------
03337 180  RH = ABS(H0)*HMXI
03338 IF (RH .GT. 1.0D0) H0 = H0/RH
03339 ! Load H with H0 and scale YH(*,2) by H0. ------------------------------
03340 H = H0
03341 DO 190 I = 1,N
03342 190    RWORK(I+LF0-1) = H0*RWORK(I+LF0-1)
03343 GOTO 270
03344 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
03345 ! Block D.
03346 ! The next code block is for continuation calls only (ISTATE = 2 or 3)
03347 ! and is to check stop conditions before taking a step.
03348 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
03349 200  NSLAST = NST
03350 GOTO (210, 250, 220, 230, 240), ITASK
03351 210  IF ((TN - TOUT)*H .LT. 0.0D0) GOTO 250
03352 CALL DINTDY (TOUT, 0, RWORK(LYH), NYH, Y, IFLAG)
03353 IF (IFLAG .NE. 0) GOTO 627
03354 T = TOUT
03355 GOTO 420
03356 220  TP = TN - HU*(1.0D0 + 100.0D0*UROUND)
03357 IF ((TP - TOUT)*H .GT. 0.0D0) GOTO 623
03358 IF ((TN - TOUT)*H .LT. 0.0D0) GOTO 250
03359 GOTO 400
03360 230  TCRIT = RWORK(1)
03361 IF ((TN - TCRIT)*H .GT. 0.0D0) GOTO 624
03362 IF ((TCRIT - TOUT)*H .LT. 0.0D0) GOTO 625
03363 IF ((TN - TOUT)*H .LT. 0.0D0) GOTO 245
03364 CALL DINTDY (TOUT, 0, RWORK(LYH), NYH, Y, IFLAG)
03365 IF (IFLAG .NE. 0) GOTO 627
03366 T = TOUT
03367 GOTO 420
03368 240  TCRIT = RWORK(1)
03369 IF ((TN - TCRIT)*H .GT. 0.0D0) GOTO 624
03370 245  HMX = ABS(TN) + ABS(H)
03371 IHIT = ABS(TN - TCRIT) .LE. 100.0D0*UROUND*HMX
03372 IF (IHIT) GOTO 400
03373 TNEXT = TN + H*(1.0D0 + 4.0D0*UROUND)
03374 IF ((TNEXT - TCRIT)*H .LE. 0.0D0) GOTO 250
03375 H = (TCRIT - TN)*(1.0D0 - 4.0D0*UROUND)
03376 IF (ISTATE .EQ. 2) JSTART = -2
03377 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
03378 ! Block E.
03379 ! The next block is normally executed for all calls and contains
03380 ! the call to the one-step core integrator DSTODE.
03381 !
03382 ! This is a looping point for the integration steps.
03383 !
03384 ! First check for too many steps being taken, update EWT (if not at
03385 ! start of problem), check for too much accuracy being requested, and
03386 ! check for H below the roundoff level in T.
03387 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
03388 250  CONTINUE
03389 IF ((NST-NSLAST) .GE. MXSTEP) GOTO 500
03390 CALL DEWSET (N, ITOL, RTOL, ATOL, RWORK(LYH), RWORK(LEWT))
03391 DO 260 I = 1,N
03392 IF (RWORK(I+LEWT-1) .LE. 0.0D0) GOTO 510
03393 260    RWORK(I+LEWT-1) = 1.0D0/RWORK(I+LEWT-1)
03394 270  TOLSF = UROUND*DVNORM (N, RWORK(LYH), RWORK(LEWT))
03395 IF (TOLSF .LE. 1.0D0) GOTO 280
03396 TOLSF = TOLSF*2.0D0
03397 IF (NST .EQ. 0) GOTO 626
03398 GOTO 520
03399 280  IF ((TN + H) .NE. TN) GOTO 290
03400 NHNIL = NHNIL + 1
03401 IF (NHNIL .GT. MXHNIL) GOTO 290
03402 MSG = 'DLSODES- Warning..Internal T (=R1) and H (=R2) are'
03403 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 101, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
03404 MSG='      such that in the machine, T + H = T on the next step  '
03405 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 101, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
03406 MSG = '     (H = step size). Solver will continue anyway.'
03407 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 101, 0, 0, 0, 0, 2, TN, H)
03408 IF (NHNIL .LT. MXHNIL) GOTO 290
03409 MSG = 'DLSODES- Above warning has been issued I1 times.  '
03410 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 102, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
03411 MSG = '     It will not be issued again for this problem.'
03412 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 102, 0, 1, MXHNIL, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
03413 290  CONTINUE
03414 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
03415 !    CALL DSTODE(NEQ,Y,YH,NYH,YH,EWT,SAVF,ACOR,WM,WM,F,JAC,DPRJS,DSOLSS)
03416 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
03417 CALL DSTODE (NEQ, Y, RWORK(LYH), NYH, RWORK(LYH), RWORK(LEWT), RWORK(LSAVF), RWORK(LACOR), RWORK(LWM), &
03418 RWORK(LWM), F, JAC, DPRJS, DSOLSS)
03419 KGO = 1 - KFLAG
03420 GOTO (300, 530, 540, 550), KGO
03421 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
03422 ! Block F.
03423 ! The following block handles the case of a successful return from the
03424 ! core integrator (KFLAG = 0).  Test for stop conditions.
03425 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
03426 300  INIT = 1
03427 GOTO (310, 400, 330, 340, 350), ITASK
03428 ! ITASK = 1.  if TOUT has been reached, interpolate. -------------------
03429 310  IF ((TN - TOUT)*H .LT. 0.0D0) GOTO 250
03430 CALL DINTDY (TOUT, 0, RWORK(LYH), NYH, Y, IFLAG)
03431 T = TOUT
03432 GOTO 420
03433 ! ITASK = 3.  Jump to exit if TOUT was reached. ------------------------
03434 330  IF ((TN - TOUT)*H .GE. 0.0D0) GOTO 400
03435 GOTO 250
03436 ! ITASK = 4.  See if TOUT or TCRIT was reached.  Adjust H if necessary.
03437 340  IF ((TN - TOUT)*H .LT. 0.0D0) GOTO 345
03438 CALL DINTDY (TOUT, 0, RWORK(LYH), NYH, Y, IFLAG)
03439 T = TOUT
03440 GOTO 420
03441 345  HMX = ABS(TN) + ABS(H)
03442 IHIT = ABS(TN - TCRIT) .LE. 100.0D0*UROUND*HMX
03443 IF (IHIT) GOTO 400
03444 TNEXT = TN + H*(1.0D0 + 4.0D0*UROUND)
03445 IF ((TNEXT - TCRIT)*H .LE. 0.0D0) GOTO 250
03446 H = (TCRIT - TN)*(1.0D0 - 4.0D0*UROUND)
03447 JSTART = -2
03448 GOTO 250
03449 ! ITASK = 5.  See if TCRIT was reached and jump to exit. ---------------
03450 350  HMX = ABS(TN) + ABS(H)
03451 IHIT = ABS(TN - TCRIT) .LE. 100.0D0*UROUND*HMX
03452 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
03453 ! Block G.
03454 ! The following block handles all successful returns from DLSODES.
03455 ! If ITASK .ne. 1, Y is loaded from YH and T is set accordingly.
03456 ! ISTATE is set to 2, and the optional outputs are loaded into the
03457 ! work arrays before returning.
03458 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
03459 400  DO 410 I = 1,N
03460 410    Y(I) = RWORK(I+LYH-1)
03461 T = TN
03462 IF (ITASK .NE. 4 .AND. ITASK .NE. 5) GOTO 420
03463 IF (IHIT) T = TCRIT
03464 420  ISTATE = 2
03465 RWORK(11) = HU
03466 RWORK(12) = H
03467 RWORK(13) = TN
03468 IWORK(11) = NST
03469 IWORK(12) = NFE
03470 IWORK(13) = NJE
03471 IWORK(14) = NQU
03472 IWORK(15) = NQ
03473 IWORK(19) = NNZ
03474 IWORK(20) = NGP
03475 IWORK(21) = NLU
03476 IWORK(25) = NZL
03477 IWORK(26) = NZU
03478 RETURN
03479 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
03480 ! Block H.
03481 ! The following block handles all unsuccessful returns other than
03482 ! those for illegal input.  First the error message routine is called.
03483 ! If there was an error test or convergence test failure, IMXER is set.
03484 ! Then Y is loaded from YH and T is set to TN.
03485 ! The optional outputs are loaded into the work arrays before returning.
03486 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
03487 ! The maximum number of steps was taken before reaching TOUT. ----------
03488 500  MSG = 'DLSODES- At current T (=R1), MXSTEP (=I1) steps   '
03489 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 201, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
03490 MSG = '      taken on this call before reaching TOUT     '
03491 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 201, 0, 1, MXSTEP, 0, 1, TN, 0.0D0)
03492 ISTATE = -1
03493 GOTO 580
03494 ! EWT(i) .le. 0.0 for some i (not at start of problem). ----------------
03495 510  EWTI = RWORK(LEWT+I-1)
03496 MSG = 'DLSODES- At T (=R1), EWT(I1) has become R2 .le. 0.'
03497 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 202, 0, 1, I, 0, 2, TN, EWTI)
03498 ISTATE = -6
03499 GOTO 580
03500 ! Too much accuracy requested for machine precision. -------------------
03501 520  MSG = 'DLSODES- At T (=R1), too much accuracy requested  '
03502 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 203, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
03503 MSG = '      for precision of machine..  See TOLSF (=R2) '
03504 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 203, 0, 0, 0, 0, 2, TN, TOLSF)
03505 RWORK(14) = TOLSF
03506 ISTATE = -2
03507 GOTO 580
03508 ! KFLAG = -1.  Error test failed repeatedly or with ABS(H) = HMIN. -----
03509 530  MSG = 'DLSODES- At T(=R1) and step size H(=R2), the error'
03510 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 204, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
03511 MSG = '      test failed repeatedly or with ABS(H) = HMIN'
03512 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 204, 0, 0, 0, 0, 2, TN, H)
03513 ISTATE = -4
03514 GOTO 560
03515 ! KFLAG = -2.  Convergence failed repeatedly or with ABS(H) = HMIN. ----
03516 540  MSG = 'DLSODES- At T (=R1) and step size H (=R2), the    '
03517 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 205, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
03518 MSG = '      corrector convergence failed repeatedly     '
03519 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 205, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
03520 MSG = '      or with ABS(H) = HMIN   '
03521 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 205, 0, 0, 0, 0, 2, TN, H)
03522 ISTATE = -5
03523 GOTO 560
03524 ! KFLAG = -3.  Fatal error flag returned by DPRJS or DSOLSS (CDRV). ----
03525 550  MSG = 'DLSODES- At T (=R1) and step size H (=R2), a fatal'
03526 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 207, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
03527 MSG = '      error flag was returned by CDRV (by way of  '
03528 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 207, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
03529 MSG = '      Subroutine DPRJS or DSOLSS)       '
03530 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 40, 207, 0, 0, 0, 0, 2, TN, H)
03531 ISTATE = -7
03532 GOTO 580
03533 ! Compute IMXER if relevant. -------------------------------------------
03534 560  BIG = 0.0D0
03535 IMXER = 1
03536 DO 570 I = 1,N
03537 SIZE = ABS(RWORK(I+LACOR-1)*RWORK(I+LEWT-1))
03538 IF (BIG .GE. SIZE) GOTO 570
03539 BIG = SIZE
03540 IMXER = I
03541 570    CONTINUE
03542 IWORK(16) = IMXER
03543 ! Set Y vector, T, and optional outputs. -------------------------------
03544 580  DO 590 I = 1,N
03545 590    Y(I) = RWORK(I+LYH-1)
03546 T = TN
03547 RWORK(11) = HU
03548 RWORK(12) = H
03549 RWORK(13) = TN
03550 IWORK(11) = NST
03551 IWORK(12) = NFE
03552 IWORK(13) = NJE
03553 IWORK(14) = NQU
03554 IWORK(15) = NQ
03555 IWORK(19) = NNZ
03556 IWORK(20) = NGP
03557 IWORK(21) = NLU
03558 IWORK(25) = NZL
03559 IWORK(26) = NZU
03560 RETURN
03561 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
03562 ! Block I.
03563 ! The following block handles all error returns due to illegal input
03564 ! (ISTATE = -3), as detected before calling the core integrator.
03565 ! First the error message routine is called.  If the illegal input
03566 ! is a negative ISTATE, the run is aborted (apparent infinite loop).
03567 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
03568 601  MSG = 'DLSODES- ISTATE (=I1) illegal.'
03569 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 1, 0, 1, ISTATE, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
03570 IF (ISTATE .LT. 0) GOTO 800
03571 GOTO 700
03572 602  MSG = 'DLSODES- ITASK (=I1) illegal. '
03573 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 2, 0, 1, ITASK, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
03574 GOTO 700
03575 603  MSG = 'DLSODES- ISTATE.gt.1 but DLSODES not initialized. '
03576 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 3, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
03577 GOTO 700
03578 604  MSG = 'DLSODES- NEQ (=I1) .lt. 1     '
03579 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 4, 0, 1, NEQ(1), 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
03580 GOTO 700
03581 605  MSG = 'DLSODES- ISTATE = 3 and NEQ increased (I1 to I2). '
03582 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 5, 0, 2, N, NEQ(1), 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
03583 GOTO 700
03584 606  MSG = 'DLSODES- ITOL (=I1) illegal.  '
03585 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 6, 0, 1, ITOL, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
03586 GOTO 700
03587 607  MSG = 'DLSODES- IOPT (=I1) illegal.  '
03588 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 7, 0, 1, IOPT, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
03589 GOTO 700
03590 608  MSG = 'DLSODES- MF (=I1) illegal.    '
03591 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 8, 0, 1, MF, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
03592 GOTO 700
03593 609  MSG = 'DLSODES- SETH (=R1) .lt. 0.0  '
03594 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 9, 0, 0, 0, 0, 1, SETH, 0.0D0)
03595 GOTO 700
03596 611  MSG = 'DLSODES- MAXORD (=I1) .lt. 0  '
03597 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 11, 0, 1, MAXORD, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
03598 GOTO 700
03599 612  MSG = 'DLSODES- MXSTEP (=I1) .lt. 0  '
03600 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 12, 0, 1, MXSTEP, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
03601 GOTO 700
03602 613  MSG = 'DLSODES- MXHNIL (=I1) .lt. 0  '
03603 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 13, 0, 1, MXHNIL, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
03604 GOTO 700
03605 614  MSG = 'DLSODES- TOUT (=R1) behind T (=R2)      '
03606 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 40, 14, 0, 0, 0, 0, 2, TOUT, T)
03607 MSG = '      Integration direction is given by H0 (=R1)  '
03608 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 14, 0, 0, 0, 0, 1, H0, 0.0D0)
03609 GOTO 700
03610 615  MSG = 'DLSODES- HMAX (=R1) .lt. 0.0  '
03611 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 15, 0, 0, 0, 0, 1, HMAX, 0.0D0)
03612 GOTO 700
03613 616  MSG = 'DLSODES- HMIN (=R1) .lt. 0.0  '
03614 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 16, 0, 0, 0, 0, 1, HMIN, 0.0D0)
03615 GOTO 700
03616 617  MSG = 'DLSODES- RWORK length is insufficient to proceed. '
03617 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 17, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
03618 MSG='        Length needed is .ge. LENRW (=I1), exceeds LRW (=I2)'
03619 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 17, 0, 2, LENRW, LRW, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
03620 GOTO 700
03621 618  MSG = 'DLSODES- IWORK length is insufficient to proceed. '
03622 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 18, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
03623 MSG='        Length needed is .ge. LENIW (=I1), exceeds LIW (=I2)'
03624 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 18, 0, 2, LENIW, LIW, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
03625 GOTO 700
03626 619  MSG = 'DLSODES- RTOL(I1) is R1 .lt. 0.0        '
03627 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 40, 19, 0, 1, I, 0, 1, RTOLI, 0.0D0)
03628 GOTO 700
03629 620  MSG = 'DLSODES- ATOL(I1) is R1 .lt. 0.0        '
03630 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 40, 20, 0, 1, I, 0, 1, ATOLI, 0.0D0)
03631 GOTO 700
03632 621  EWTI = RWORK(LEWT+I-1)
03633 MSG = 'DLSODES- EWT(I1) is R1 .le. 0.0         '
03634 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 40, 21, 0, 1, I, 0, 1, EWTI, 0.0D0)
03635 GOTO 700
03636 622  MSG='DLSODES- TOUT(=R1) too close to T(=R2) to start integration.'
03637 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 22, 0, 0, 0, 0, 2, TOUT, T)
03638 GOTO 700
03639 623  MSG='DLSODES- ITASK = I1 and TOUT (=R1) behind TCUR - HU (= R2)  '
03640 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 23, 0, 1, ITASK, 0, 2, TOUT, TP)
03641 GOTO 700
03642 624  MSG='DLSODES- ITASK = 4 or 5 and TCRIT (=R1) behind TCUR (=R2)   '
03643 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 24, 0, 0, 0, 0, 2, TCRIT, TN)
03644 GOTO 700
03645 625  MSG='DLSODES- ITASK = 4 or 5 and TCRIT (=R1) behind TOUT (=R2)   '
03646 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 25, 0, 0, 0, 0, 2, TCRIT, TOUT)
03647 GOTO 700
03648 626  MSG = 'DLSODES- At start of problem, too much accuracy   '
03649 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 26, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
03650 MSG='      requested for precision of machine..  See TOLSF (=R1) '
03651 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 26, 0, 0, 0, 0, 1, TOLSF, 0.0D0)
03652 RWORK(14) = TOLSF
03653 GOTO 700
03654 627  MSG = 'DLSODES- Trouble in DINTDY.  ITASK = I1, TOUT = R1'
03655 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 27, 0, 1, ITASK, 0, 1, TOUT, 0.0D0)
03656 GOTO 700
03657 628  MSG='DLSODES- RWORK length insufficient (for Subroutine DPREP).  '
03658 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 28, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
03659 MSG='        Length needed is .ge. LENRW (=I1), exceeds LRW (=I2)'
03660 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 28, 0, 2, LENRW, LRW, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
03661 GOTO 700
03662 629  MSG='DLSODES- RWORK length insufficient (for Subroutine JGROUP). '
03663 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 29, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
03664 MSG='        Length needed is .ge. LENRW (=I1), exceeds LRW (=I2)'
03665 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 29, 0, 2, LENRW, LRW, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
03666 GOTO 700
03667 630  MSG='DLSODES- RWORK length insufficient (for Subroutine ODRV).   '
03668 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 30, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
03669 MSG='        Length needed is .ge. LENRW (=I1), exceeds LRW (=I2)'
03670 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 30, 0, 2, LENRW, LRW, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
03671 GOTO 700
03672 631  MSG='DLSODES- Error from ODRV in Yale Sparse Matrix Package.     '
03673 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 31, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
03674 IMUL = (IYS - 1)/N
03675 IREM = IYS - IMUL*N
03676 MSG='      At T (=R1), ODRV returned error flag = I1*NEQ + I2.   '
03677 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 31, 0, 2, IMUL, IREM, 1, TN, 0.0D0)
03678 GOTO 700
03679 632  MSG='DLSODES- RWORK length insufficient (for Subroutine CDRV).   '
03680 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 32, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
03681 MSG='        Length needed is .ge. LENRW (=I1), exceeds LRW (=I2)'
03682 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 32, 0, 2, LENRW, LRW, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
03683 GOTO 700
03684 633  MSG='DLSODES- Error from CDRV in Yale Sparse Matrix Package.     '
03685 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 33, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
03686 IMUL = (IYS - 1)/N
03687 IREM = IYS - IMUL*N
03688 MSG='      At T (=R1), CDRV returned error flag = I1*NEQ + I2.   '
03689 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 33, 0, 2, IMUL, IREM, 1, TN, 0.0D0)
03690 IF (IMUL .EQ. 2) THEN
03691 MSG='        Duplicate entry in sparsity structure descriptors.  '
03692 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 33, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
03693 ENDIF
03694 IF (IMUL .EQ. 3 .OR. IMUL .EQ. 6) THEN
03695 MSG='        Insufficient storage for NSFC (called by CDRV).     '
03696 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 33, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
03697 ENDIF
03698 !
03699 700  ISTATE = -3
03700 RETURN
03701 !
03702 800  MSG = 'DLSODES- Run aborted.. apparent infinite loop.    '
03703 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 303, 2, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
03704 RETURN
03705 !----------------------- End of Subroutine DLSODES ---------------------
03706 END
03707 
03708 SUBROUTINE DLSODA (F, NEQ, Y, T, TOUT, ITOL, RTOL, ATOL, ITASK, ISTATE, IOPT, RWORK, LRW, IWORK, LIW, JAC, JT)
03709 EXTERNAL F, JAC
03710 INTEGER NEQ, ITOL, ITASK, ISTATE, IOPT, LRW, IWORK, LIW, JT
03711 DOUBLE PRECISION Y, T, TOUT, RTOL, ATOL, RWORK
03712 DIMENSION NEQ(*), Y(*), RTOL(*), ATOL(*), RWORK(LRW), IWORK(LIW)
03713 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
03714 ! This is the 12 November 2003 version of
03715 ! DLSODA: Livermore Solver for Ordinary Differential Equations, with
03716 !         Automatic method switching for stiff and nonstiff problems.
03717 !
03718 ! This version is in double precision.
03719 !
03720 ! DLSODA solves the initial value problem for stiff or nonstiff
03721 ! systems of first order ODEs,
03722 !     dy/dt = f(t,y) ,  or, in component form,
03723 !     dy(i)/dt = f(i) = f(i,t,y(1),y(2),...,y(NEQ)) (i = 1,...,NEQ).
03724 !
03725 ! This a variant version of the DLSODE package.
03726 ! It switches automatically between stiff and nonstiff methods.
03727 ! This means that the user does not have to determine whether the
03728 ! problem is stiff or not, and the solver will automatically choose the
03729 ! appropriate method.  It always starts with the nonstiff method.
03730 !
03731 ! Authors:       Alan C. Hindmarsh
03732 !                Center for Applied Scientific Computing, L-561
03733 !                Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory
03734 !                Livermore, CA 94551
03735 ! and
03736 !                Linda R. Petzold
03737 !                Univ. of California at Santa Barbara
03738 !                Dept. of Computer Science
03739 !                Santa Barbara, CA 93106
03740 !
03741 ! References:
03742 ! 1.  Alan C. Hindmarsh,  ODEPACK, A Systematized Collection of ODE
03743 !     Solvers, in Scientific Computing, R. S. Stepleman et al. (Eds.),
03744 !     North-Holland, Amsterdam, 1983, pp. 55-64.
03745 ! 2.  Linda R. Petzold, Automatic Selection of Methods for Solving
03746 !     Stiff and Nonstiff Systems of Ordinary Differential Equations,
03747 !     Siam J. Sci. Stat. Comput. 4 (1983), pp. 136-148.
03748 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
03749 ! Summary of Usage.
03750 !
03751 ! Communication between the user and the DLSODA package, for normal
03752 ! situations, is summarized here.  This summary describes only a subset
03753 ! of the full set of options available.  See the full description for
03754 ! details, including alternative treatment of the Jacobian matrix,
03755 ! optional inputs and outputs, nonstandard options, and
03756 ! instructions for special situations.  See also the example
03757 ! problem (with program and output) following this summary.
03758 !
03759 ! A. First provide a subroutine of the form:
03760 !               SUBROUTINE F (NEQ, T, Y, YDOT)
03761 !               DOUBLE PRECISION T, Y(*), YDOT(*)
03762 ! which supplies the vector function f by loading YDOT(i) with f(i).
03763 !
03764 ! B. Write a main program which calls Subroutine DLSODA once for
03765 ! each point at which answers are desired.  This should also provide
03766 ! for possible use of logical unit 6 for output of error messages
03767 ! by DLSODA.  On the first call to DLSODA, supply arguments as follows:
03768 ! F      = name of subroutine for right-hand side vector f.
03769 !          This name must be declared External in calling program.
03770 ! NEQ    = number of first order ODEs.
03771 ! Y      = array of initial values, of length NEQ.
03772 ! T      = the initial value of the independent variable.
03773 ! TOUT   = first point where output is desired (.ne. T).
03774 ! ITOL   = 1 or 2 according as ATOL (below) is a scalar or array.
03775 ! RTOL   = relative tolerance parameter (scalar).
03776 ! ATOL   = absolute tolerance parameter (scalar or array).
03777 !          the estimated local error in y(i) will be controlled so as
03778 !          to be less than
03779 !             EWT(i) = RTOL*ABS(Y(i)) + ATOL     if ITOL = 1, or
03780 !             EWT(i) = RTOL*ABS(Y(i)) + ATOL(i)  if ITOL = 2.
03781 !          Thus the local error test passes if, in each component,
03782 !          either the absolute error is less than ATOL (or ATOL(i)),
03783 !          or the relative error is less than RTOL.
03784 !          Use RTOL = 0.0 for pure absolute error control, and
03785 !          use ATOL = 0.0 (or ATOL(i) = 0.0) for pure relative error
03786 !          control.  Caution: actual (global) errors may exceed these
03787 !          local tolerances, so choose them conservatively.
03788 ! ITASK  = 1 for normal computation of output values of y at t = TOUT.
03789 ! ISTATE = integer flag (input and output).  Set ISTATE = 1.
03790 ! IOPT   = 0 to indicate no optional inputs used.
03791 ! RWORK  = real work array of length at least:
03792 !             22 + NEQ * MAX(16, NEQ + 9).
03793 !          See also Paragraph E below.
03794 ! LRW    = declared length of RWORK (in user's dimension).
03795 ! IWORK  = integer work array of length at least  20 + NEQ.
03796 ! LIW    = declared length of IWORK (in user's dimension).
03797 ! JAC    = name of subroutine for Jacobian matrix.
03798 !          Use a dummy name.  See also Paragraph E below.
03799 ! JT     = Jacobian type indicator.  Set JT = 2.
03800 !          See also Paragraph E below.
03801 ! Note that the main program must declare arrays Y, RWORK, IWORK,
03802 ! and possibly ATOL.
03803 !
03804 ! C. The output from the first call (or any call) is:
03805 !      Y = array of computed values of y(t) vector.
03806 !      T = corresponding value of independent variable (normally TOUT).
03807 ! ISTATE = 2  if DLSODA was successful, negative otherwise.
03808 !          -1 means excess work done on this call (perhaps wrong JT).
03809 !          -2 means excess accuracy requested (tolerances too small).
03810 !          -3 means illegal input detected (see printed message).
03811 !          -4 means repeated error test failures (check all inputs).
03812 !          -5 means repeated convergence failures (perhaps bad Jacobian
03813 !             supplied or wrong choice of JT or tolerances).
03814 !          -6 means error weight became zero during problem. (Solution
03815 !             component i vanished, and ATOL or ATOL(i) = 0.)
03816 !          -7 means work space insufficient to finish (see messages).
03817 !
03818 ! D. To continue the integration after a successful return, simply
03819 ! reset TOUT and call DLSODA again.  No other parameters need be reset.
03820 !
03821 ! E. Note: If and when DLSODA regards the problem as stiff, and
03822 ! switches methods accordingly, it must make use of the NEQ by NEQ
03823 ! Jacobian matrix, J = df/dy.  For the sake of simplicity, the
03824 ! inputs to DLSODA recommended in Paragraph B above cause DLSODA to
03825 ! treat J as a full matrix, and to approximate it internally by
03826 ! difference quotients.  Alternatively, J can be treated as a band
03827 ! matrix (with great potential reduction in the size of the RWORK
03828 ! array).  Also, in either the full or banded case, the user can supply
03829 ! J in closed form, with a routine whose name is passed as the JAC
03830 ! argument.  These alternatives are described in the paragraphs on
03831 ! RWORK, JAC, and JT in the full description of the call sequence below.
03832 !
03833 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
03834 ! Example Problem.
03835 !
03836 ! The following is a simple example problem, with the coding
03837 ! needed for its solution by DLSODA.  The problem is from chemical
03838 ! kinetics, and consists of the following three rate equations:
03839 !     dy1/dt = -.04*y1 + 1.e4*y2*y3
03840 !     dy2/dt = .04*y1 - 1.e4*y2*y3 - 3.e7*y2**2
03841 !     dy3/dt = 3.e7*y2**2
03842 ! on the interval from t = 0.0 to t = 4.e10, with initial conditions
03843 ! y1 = 1.0, y2 = y3 = 0.  The problem is stiff.
03844 !
03845 ! The following coding solves this problem with DLSODA,
03846 ! printing results at t = .4, 4., ..., 4.e10.  It uses
03847 ! ITOL = 2 and ATOL much smaller for y2 than y1 or y3 because
03848 ! y2 has much smaller values.
03849 ! At the end of the run, statistical quantities of interest are
03850 ! printed (see optional outputs in the full description below).
03851 !
03852 !     EXTERNAL FEX
03853 !     DOUBLE PRECISION ATOL, RTOL, RWORK, T, TOUT, Y
03854 !     DIMENSION Y(3), ATOL(3), RWORK(70), IWORK(23)
03855 !     NEQ = 3
03856 !     Y(1) = 1.
03857 !     Y(2) = 0.
03858 !     Y(3) = 0.
03859 !     T = 0.
03860 !     TOUT = .4
03861 !     ITOL = 2
03862 !     RTOL = 1.D-4
03863 !     ATOL(1) = 1.D-6
03864 !     ATOL(2) = 1.D-10
03865 !     ATOL(3) = 1.D-6
03866 !     ITASK = 1
03867 !     ISTATE = 1
03868 !     IOPT = 0
03869 !     LRW = 70
03870 !     LIW = 23
03871 !     JT = 2
03872 !     DO 40 IOUT = 1,12
03873 !       CALL DLSODA(FEX,NEQ,Y,T,TOUT,ITOL,RTOL,ATOL,ITASK,ISTATE,
03874 !    1     IOPT,RWORK,LRW,IWORK,LIW,JDUM,JT)
03875 !       WRITE(6,20)T,Y(1),Y(2),Y(3)
03876 ! 20    FORMAT(' At t =',D12.4,'   Y =',3D14.6)
03877 !       IF (ISTATE .LT. 0) GOTO 80
03878 ! 40    TOUT = TOUT*10.
03879 !     WRITE(6,60)IWORK(11),IWORK(12),IWORK(13),IWORK(19),RWORK(15)
03880 ! 60  FORMAT(/' No. steps =',I4,'  No. f-s =',I4,'  No. J-s =',I4/
03881 !    1   ' Method last used =',I2,'   Last switch was at t =',D12.4)
03882 !     STOP
03883 ! 80  WRITE(6,90)ISTATE
03884 ! 90  FORMAT(///' Error halt.. ISTATE =',I3)
03885 !     STOP
03886 !     END
03887 !
03888 !     SUBROUTINE FEX (NEQ, T, Y, YDOT)
03889 !     DOUBLE PRECISION T, Y, YDOT
03890 !     DIMENSION Y(3), YDOT(3)
03891 !     YDOT(1) = -.04*Y(1) + 1.D4*Y(2)*Y(3)
03892 !     YDOT(3) = 3.D7*Y(2)*Y(2)
03893 !     YDOT(2) = -YDOT(1) - YDOT(3)
03894 !     RETURN
03895 !     END
03896 !
03897 ! The output of this program (on a CDC-7600 in single precision)
03898 ! is as follows:
03899 !
03900 !   At t =  4.0000e-01   y =  9.851712e-01  3.386380e-05  1.479493e-02
03901 !   At t =  4.0000e+00   Y =  9.055333e-01  2.240655e-05  9.444430e-02
03902 !   At t =  4.0000e+01   Y =  7.158403e-01  9.186334e-06  2.841505e-01
03903 !   At t =  4.0000e+02   Y =  4.505250e-01  3.222964e-06  5.494717e-01
03904 !   At t =  4.0000e+03   Y =  1.831975e-01  8.941774e-07  8.168016e-01
03905 !   At t =  4.0000e+04   Y =  3.898730e-02  1.621940e-07  9.610125e-01
03906 !   At t =  4.0000e+05   Y =  4.936363e-03  1.984221e-08  9.950636e-01
03907 !   At t =  4.0000e+06   Y =  5.161831e-04  2.065786e-09  9.994838e-01
03908 !   At t =  4.0000e+07   Y =  5.179817e-05  2.072032e-10  9.999482e-01
03909 !   At t =  4.0000e+08   Y =  5.283401e-06  2.113371e-11  9.999947e-01
03910 !   At t =  4.0000e+09   Y =  4.659031e-07  1.863613e-12  9.999995e-01
03911 !   At t =  4.0000e+10   Y =  1.404280e-08  5.617126e-14  1.000000e+00
03912 !
03913 !   No. steps = 361  No. f-s = 693  No. J-s =  64
03914 !   Method last used = 2   Last switch was at t =  6.0092e-03
03915 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
03916 ! Full description of user interface to DLSODA.
03917 !
03918 ! The user interface to DLSODA consists of the following parts.
03919 !
03920 ! 1.   The call sequence to Subroutine DLSODA, which is a driver
03921 !      routine for the solver.  This includes descriptions of both
03922 !      the call sequence arguments and of user-supplied routines.
03923 !      following these descriptions is a description of
03924 !      optional inputs available through the call sequence, and then
03925 !      a description of optional outputs (in the work arrays).
03926 !
03927 ! 2.   Descriptions of other routines in the DLSODA package that may be
03928 !      (optionally) called by the user.  These provide the ability to
03929 !      alter error message handling, save and restore the internal
03930 !      Common, and obtain specified derivatives of the solution y(t).
03931 !
03932 ! 3.   Descriptions of Common blocks to be declared in overlay
03933 !      or similar environments, or to be saved when doing an interrupt
03934 !      of the problem and continued solution later.
03935 !
03936 ! 4.   Description of a subroutine in the DLSODA package,
03937 !      which the user may replace with his/her own version, if desired.
03938 !      this relates to the measurement of errors.
03939 !
03940 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
03941 ! Part 1.  Call Sequence.
03942 !
03943 ! The call sequence parameters used for input only are
03944 !     F, NEQ, TOUT, ITOL, RTOL, ATOL, ITASK, IOPT, LRW, LIW, JAC, JT,
03945 ! and those used for both input and output are
03946 !     Y, T, ISTATE.
03947 ! The work arrays RWORK and IWORK are also used for conditional and
03948 ! optional inputs and optional outputs.  (The term output here refers
03949 ! to the return from Subroutine DLSODA to the user's calling program.)
03950 !
03951 ! The legality of input parameters will be thoroughly checked on the
03952 ! initial call for the problem, but not checked thereafter unless a
03953 ! change in input parameters is flagged by ISTATE = 3 on input.
03954 !
03955 ! The descriptions of the call arguments are as follows.
03956 !
03957 ! F      = the name of the user-supplied subroutine defining the
03958 !          ODE system.  The system must be put in the first-order
03959 !          form dy/dt = f(t,y), where f is a vector-valued function
03960 !          of the scalar t and the vector y.  Subroutine F is to
03961 !          compute the function f.  It is to have the form
03962 !               SUBROUTINE F (NEQ, T, Y, YDOT)
03963 !               DOUBLE PRECISION T, Y(*), YDOT(*)
03964 !          where NEQ, T, and Y are input, and the array YDOT = f(t,y)
03965 !          is output.  Y and YDOT are arrays of length NEQ.
03966 !          Subroutine F should not alter Y(1),...,Y(NEQ).
03967 !          F must be declared External in the calling program.
03968 !
03969 !          Subroutine F may access user-defined quantities in
03970 !          NEQ(2),... and/or in Y(NEQ(1)+1),... if NEQ is an array
03971 !          (dimensioned in F) and/or Y has length exceeding NEQ(1).
03972 !          See the descriptions of NEQ and Y below.
03973 !
03974 !          If quantities computed in the F routine are needed
03975 !          externally to DLSODA, an extra call to F should be made
03976 !          for this purpose, for consistent and accurate results.
03977 !          If only the derivative dy/dt is needed, use DINTDY instead.
03978 !
03979 ! NEQ    = the size of the ODE system (number of first order
03980 !          ordinary differential equations).  Used only for input.
03981 !          NEQ may be decreased, but not increased, during the problem.
03982 !          If NEQ is decreased (with ISTATE = 3 on input), the
03983 !          remaining components of Y should be left undisturbed, if
03984 !          these are to be accessed in F and/or JAC.
03985 !
03986 !          Normally, NEQ is a scalar, and it is generally referred to
03987 !          as a scalar in this user interface description.  However,
03988 !          NEQ may be an array, with NEQ(1) set to the system size.
03989 !          (The DLSODA package accesses only NEQ(1).)  In either case,
03990 !          this parameter is passed as the NEQ argument in all calls
03991 !          to F and JAC.  Hence, if it is an array, locations
03992 !          NEQ(2),... may be used to store other integer data and pass
03993 !          it to F and/or JAC.  Subroutines F and/or JAC must include
03994 !          NEQ in a Dimension statement in that case.
03995 !
03996 ! Y      = a real array for the vector of dependent variables, of
03997 !          length NEQ or more.  Used for both input and output on the
03998 !          first call (ISTATE = 1), and only for output on other calls.
03999 !          On the first call, Y must contain the vector of initial
04000 !          values.  On output, Y contains the computed solution vector,
04001 !          evaluated at T.  If desired, the Y array may be used
04002 !          for other purposes between calls to the solver.
04003 !
04004 !          This array is passed as the Y argument in all calls to
04005 !          F and JAC.  Hence its length may exceed NEQ, and locations
04006 !          Y(NEQ+1),... may be used to store other real data and
04007 !          pass it to F and/or JAC.  (The DLSODA package accesses only
04008 !          Y(1),...,Y(NEQ).)
04009 !
04010 ! T      = the independent variable.  On input, T is used only on the
04011 !          first call, as the initial point of the integration.
04012 !          on output, after each call, T is the value at which a
04013 !          computed solution Y is evaluated (usually the same as TOUT).
04014 !          on an error return, T is the farthest point reached.
04015 !
04016 ! TOUT   = the next value of t at which a computed solution is desired.
04017 !          Used only for input.
04018 !
04019 !          When starting the problem (ISTATE = 1), TOUT may be equal
04020 !          to T for one call, then should .ne. T for the next call.
04021 !          For the initial t, an input value of TOUT .ne. T is used
04022 !          in order to determine the direction of the integration
04023 !          (i.e. the algebraic sign of the step sizes) and the rough
04024 !          scale of the problem.  Integration in either direction
04025 !          (forward or backward in t) is permitted.
04026 !
04027 !          If ITASK = 2 or 5 (one-step modes), TOUT is ignored after
04028 !          the first call (i.e. the first call with TOUT .ne. T).
04029 !          Otherwise, TOUT is required on every call.
04030 !
04031 !          If ITASK = 1, 3, or 4, the values of TOUT need not be
04032 !          monotone, but a value of TOUT which backs up is limited
04033 !          to the current internal T interval, whose endpoints are
04034 !          TCUR - HU and TCUR (see optional outputs, below, for
04035 !          TCUR and HU).
04036 !
04037 ! ITOL   = an indicator for the type of error control.  See
04038 !          description below under ATOL.  Used only for input.
04039 !
04040 ! RTOL   = a relative error tolerance parameter, either a scalar or
04041 !          an array of length NEQ.  See description below under ATOL.
04042 !          Input only.
04043 !
04044 ! ATOL   = an absolute error tolerance parameter, either a scalar or
04045 !          an array of length NEQ.  Input only.
04046 !
04047 !             The input parameters ITOL, RTOL, and ATOL determine
04048 !          the error control performed by the solver.  The solver will
04049 !          control the vector E = (E(i)) of estimated local errors
04050 !          in y, according to an inequality of the form
04051 !                      max-norm of ( E(i)/EWT(i) )   .le.   1,
04052 !          where EWT = (EWT(i)) is a vector of positive error weights.
04053 !          The values of RTOL and ATOL should all be non-negative.
04054 !          The following table gives the types (scalar/array) of
04055 !          RTOL and ATOL, and the corresponding form of EWT(i).
04056 !
04057 !             ITOL    RTOL       ATOL          EWT(i)
04058 !              1     scalar     scalar     RTOL*ABS(Y(i)) + ATOL
04059 !              2     scalar     array      RTOL*ABS(Y(i)) + ATOL(i)
04060 !              3     array      scalar     RTOL(i)*ABS(Y(i)) + ATOL
04061 !              4     array      array      RTOL(i)*ABS(Y(i)) + ATOL(i)
04062 !
04063 !          When either of these parameters is a scalar, it need not
04064 !          be dimensioned in the user's calling program.
04065 !
04066 !          If none of the above choices (with ITOL, RTOL, and ATOL
04067 !          fixed throughout the problem) is suitable, more general
04068 !          error controls can be obtained by substituting a
04069 !          user-supplied routine for the setting of EWT.
04070 !          See Part 4 below.
04071 !
04072 !          If global errors are to be estimated by making a repeated
04073 !          run on the same problem with smaller tolerances, then all
04074 !          components of RTOL and ATOL (i.e. of EWT) should be scaled
04075 !          down uniformly.
04076 !
04077 ! ITASK  = an index specifying the task to be performed.
04078 !          Input only.  ITASK has the following values and meanings.
04079 !          1  means normal computation of output values of y(t) at
04080 !             t = TOUT (by overshooting and interpolating).
04081 !          2  means take one step only and return.
04082 !          3  means stop at the first internal mesh point at or
04083 !             beyond t = TOUT and return.
04084 !          4  means normal computation of output values of y(t) at
04085 !             t = TOUT but without overshooting t = TCRIT.
04086 !             TCRIT must be input as RWORK(1).  TCRIT may be equal to
04087 !             or beyond TOUT, but not behind it in the direction of
04088 !             integration.  This option is useful if the problem
04089 !             has a singularity at or beyond t = TCRIT.
04090 !          5  means take one step, without passing TCRIT, and return.
04091 !             TCRIT must be input as RWORK(1).
04092 !
04093 !          Note:  If ITASK = 4 or 5 and the solver reaches TCRIT
04094 !          (within roundoff), it will return T = TCRIT (exactly) to
04095 !          indicate this (unless ITASK = 4 and TOUT comes before TCRIT,
04096 !          in which case answers at t = TOUT are returned first).
04097 !
04098 ! ISTATE = an index used for input and output to specify the
04099 !          the state of the calculation.
04100 !
04101 !          On input, the values of ISTATE are as follows.
04102 !          1  means this is the first call for the problem
04103 !             (initializations will be done).  See note below.
04104 !          2  means this is not the first call, and the calculation
04105 !             is to continue normally, with no change in any input
04106 !             parameters except possibly TOUT and ITASK.
04107 !             (If ITOL, RTOL, and/or ATOL are changed between calls
04108 !             with ISTATE = 2, the new values will be used but not
04109 !             tested for legality.)
04110 !          3  means this is not the first call, and the
04111 !             calculation is to continue normally, but with
04112 !             a change in input parameters other than
04113 !             TOUT and ITASK.  Changes are allowed in
04114 !             NEQ, ITOL, RTOL, ATOL, IOPT, LRW, LIW, JT, ML, MU,
04115 !             and any optional inputs except H0, MXORDN, and MXORDS.
04116 !             (See IWORK description for ML and MU.)
04117 !          Note:  A preliminary call with TOUT = T is not counted
04118 !          as a first call here, as no initialization or checking of
04119 !          input is done.  (Such a call is sometimes useful for the
04120 !          purpose of outputting the initial conditions.)
04121 !          Thus the first call for which TOUT .ne. T requires
04122 !          ISTATE = 1 on input.
04123 !
04124 !          On output, ISTATE has the following values and meanings.
04125 !           1  means nothing was done; TOUT = T and ISTATE = 1 on input.
04126 !           2  means the integration was performed successfully.
04127 !          -1  means an excessive amount of work (more than MXSTEP
04128 !              steps) was done on this call, before completing the
04129 !              requested task, but the integration was otherwise
04130 !              successful as far as T.  (MXSTEP is an optional input
04131 !              and is normally 500.)  To continue, the user may
04132 !              simply reset ISTATE to a value .gt. 1 and call again
04133 !              (the excess work step counter will be reset to 0).
04134 !              In addition, the user may increase MXSTEP to avoid
04135 !              this error return (see below on optional inputs).
04136 !          -2  means too much accuracy was requested for the precision
04137 !              of the machine being used.  This was detected before
04138 !              completing the requested task, but the integration
04139 !              was successful as far as T.  To continue, the tolerance
04140 !              parameters must be reset, and ISTATE must be set
04141 !              to 3.  The optional output TOLSF may be used for this
04142 !              purpose.  (Note: If this condition is detected before
04143 !              taking any steps, then an illegal input return
04144 !              (ISTATE = -3) occurs instead.)
04145 !          -3  means illegal input was detected, before taking any
04146 !              integration steps.  See written message for details.
04147 !              Note:  If the solver detects an infinite loop of calls
04148 !              to the solver with illegal input, it will cause
04149 !              the run to stop.
04150 !          -4  means there were repeated error test failures on
04151 !              one attempted step, before completing the requested
04152 !              task, but the integration was successful as far as T.
04153 !              The problem may have a singularity, or the input
04154 !              may be inappropriate.
04155 !          -5  means there were repeated convergence test failures on
04156 !              one attempted step, before completing the requested
04157 !              task, but the integration was successful as far as T.
04158 !              This may be caused by an inaccurate Jacobian matrix,
04159 !              if one is being used.
04160 !          -6  means EWT(i) became zero for some i during the
04161 !              integration.  Pure relative error control (ATOL(i)=0.0)
04162 !              was requested on a variable which has now vanished.
04163 !              The integration was successful as far as T.
04164 !          -7  means the length of RWORK and/or IWORK was too small to
04165 !              proceed, but the integration was successful as far as T.
04166 !              This happens when DLSODA chooses to switch methods
04167 !              but LRW and/or LIW is too small for the new method.
04168 !
04169 !          Note:  Since the normal output value of ISTATE is 2,
04170 !          it does not need to be reset for normal continuation.
04171 !          Also, since a negative input value of ISTATE will be
04172 !          regarded as illegal, a negative output value requires the
04173 !          user to change it, and possibly other inputs, before
04174 !          calling the solver again.
04175 !
04176 ! IOPT   = an integer flag to specify whether or not any optional
04177 !          inputs are being used on this call.  Input only.
04178 !          The optional inputs are listed separately below.
04179 !          IOPT = 0 means no optional inputs are being used.
04180 !                   default values will be used in all cases.
04181 !          IOPT = 1 means one or more optional inputs are being used.
04182 !
04183 ! RWORK  = a real array (double precision) for work space, and (in the
04184 !          first 20 words) for conditional and optional inputs and
04185 !          optional outputs.
04186 !          As DLSODA switches automatically between stiff and nonstiff
04187 !          methods, the required length of RWORK can change during the
04188 !          problem.  Thus the RWORK array passed to DLSODA can either
04189 !          have a static (fixed) length large enough for both methods,
04190 !          or have a dynamic (changing) length altered by the calling
04191 !          program in response to output from DLSODA.
04192 !
04193 !                       --- Fixed Length Case ---
04194 !          If the RWORK length is to be fixed, it should be at least
04195 !               MAX (LRN, LRS),
04196 !          where LRN and LRS are the RWORK lengths required when the
04197 !          current method is nonstiff or stiff, respectively.
04198 !
04199 !          The separate RWORK length requirements LRN and LRS are
04200 !          as follows:
04201 !          IF NEQ is constant and the maximum method orders have
04202 !          their default values, then
04203 !             LRN = 20 + 16*NEQ,
04204 !             LRS = 22 + 9*NEQ + NEQ**2           if JT = 1 or 2,
04205 !             LRS = 22 + 10*NEQ + (2*ML+MU)*NEQ   if JT = 4 or 5.
04206 !          Under any other conditions, LRN and LRS are given by:
04207 !             LRN = 20 + NYH*(MXORDN+1) + 3*NEQ,
04208 !             LRS = 20 + NYH*(MXORDS+1) + 3*NEQ + LMAT,
04209 !          where
04210 !             NYH    = the initial value of NEQ,
04211 !             MXORDN = 12, unless a smaller value is given as an
04212 !                      optional input,
04213 !             MXORDS = 5, unless a smaller value is given as an
04214 !                      optional input,
04215 !             LMAT   = length of matrix work space:
04216 !             LMAT   = NEQ**2 + 2              if JT = 1 or 2,
04217 !             LMAT   = (2*ML + MU + 1)*NEQ + 2 if JT = 4 or 5.
04218 !
04219 !                       --- Dynamic Length Case ---
04220 !          If the length of RWORK is to be dynamic, then it should
04221 !          be at least LRN or LRS, as defined above, depending on the
04222 !          current method.  Initially, it must be at least LRN (since
04223 !          DLSODA starts with the nonstiff method).  On any return
04224 !          from DLSODA, the optional output MCUR indicates the current
04225 !          method.  If MCUR differs from the value it had on the
04226 !          previous return, or if there has only been one call to
04227 !          DLSODA and MCUR is now 2, then DLSODA has switched
04228 !          methods during the last call, and the length of RWORK
04229 !          should be reset (to LRN if MCUR = 1, or to LRS if
04230 !          MCUR = 2).  (An increase in the RWORK length is required
04231 !          if DLSODA returned ISTATE = -7, but not otherwise.)
04232 !          After resetting the length, call DLSODA with ISTATE = 3
04233 !          to signal that change.
04234 !
04235 ! LRW    = the length of the array RWORK, as declared by the user.
04236 !          (This will be checked by the solver.)
04237 !
04238 ! IWORK  = an integer array for work space.
04239 !          As DLSODA switches automatically between stiff and nonstiff
04240 !          methods, the required length of IWORK can change during
04241 !          problem, between
04242 !             LIS = 20 + NEQ   and   LIN = 20,
04243 !          respectively.  Thus the IWORK array passed to DLSODA can
04244 !          either have a fixed length of at least 20 + NEQ, or have a
04245 !          dynamic length of at least LIN or LIS, depending on the
04246 !          current method.  The comments on dynamic length under
04247 !          RWORK above apply here.  Initially, this length need
04248 !          only be at least LIN = 20.
04249 !
04250 !          The first few words of IWORK are used for conditional and
04251 !          optional inputs and optional outputs.
04252 !
04253 !          The following 2 words in IWORK are conditional inputs:
04254 !            IWORK(1) = ML     these are the lower and upper
04255 !            IWORK(2) = MU     half-bandwidths, respectively, of the
04256 !                       banded Jacobian, excluding the main diagonal.
04257 !                       The band is defined by the matrix locations
04258 !                       (i,j) with i-ML .le. j .le. i+MU.  ML and MU
04259 !                       must satisfy  0 .le.  ML,MU  .le. NEQ-1.
04260 !                       These are required if JT is 4 or 5, and
04261 !                       ignored otherwise.  ML and MU may in fact be
04262 !                       the band parameters for a matrix to which
04263 !                       df/dy is only approximately equal.
04264 !
04265 ! LIW    = the length of the array IWORK, as declared by the user.
04266 !          (This will be checked by the solver.)
04267 !
04268 ! Note: The base addresses of the work arrays must not be
04269 ! altered between calls to DLSODA for the same problem.
04270 ! The contents of the work arrays must not be altered
04271 ! between calls, except possibly for the conditional and
04272 ! optional inputs, and except for the last 3*NEQ words of RWORK.
04273 ! The latter space is used for internal scratch space, and so is
04274 ! available for use by the user outside DLSODA between calls, if
04275 ! desired (but not for use by F or JAC).
04276 !
04277 ! JAC    = the name of the user-supplied routine to compute the
04278 !          Jacobian matrix, df/dy, if JT = 1 or 4.  The JAC routine
04279 !          is optional, but if the problem is expected to be stiff much
04280 !          of the time, you are encouraged to supply JAC, for the sake
04281 !          of efficiency.  (Alternatively, set JT = 2 or 5 to have
04282 !          DLSODA compute df/dy internally by difference quotients.)
04283 !          If and when DLSODA uses df/dy, it treats this NEQ by NEQ
04284 !          matrix either as full (JT = 1 or 2), or as banded (JT =
04285 !          4 or 5) with half-bandwidths ML and MU (discussed under
04286 !          IWORK above).  In either case, if JT = 1 or 4, the JAC
04287 !          routine must compute df/dy as a function of the scalar t
04288 !          and the vector y.  It is to have the form
04289 !               SUBROUTINE JAC (NEQ, T, Y, ML, MU, PD, NROWPD)
04290 !               DOUBLE PRECISION T, Y(*), PD(NROWPD,*)
04291 !          where NEQ, T, Y, ML, MU, and NROWPD are input and the array
04292 !          PD is to be loaded with partial derivatives (elements of
04293 !          the Jacobian matrix) on output.  PD must be given a first
04294 !          dimension of NROWPD.  T and Y have the same meaning as in
04295 !          Subroutine F.
04296 !               In the full matrix case (JT = 1), ML and MU are
04297 !          ignored, and the Jacobian is to be loaded into PD in
04298 !          columnwise manner, with df(i)/dy(j) loaded into PD(i,j).
04299 !               In the band matrix case (JT = 4), the elements
04300 !          within the band are to be loaded into PD in columnwise
04301 !          manner, with diagonal lines of df/dy loaded into the rows
04302 !          of PD.  Thus df(i)/dy(j) is to be loaded into PD(i-j+MU+1,j).
04303 !          ML and MU are the half-bandwidth parameters (see IWORK).
04304 !          The locations in PD in the two triangular areas which
04305 !          correspond to nonexistent matrix elements can be ignored
04306 !          or loaded arbitrarily, as they are overwritten by DLSODA.
04307 !               JAC need not provide df/dy exactly.  A crude
04308 !          approximation (possibly with a smaller bandwidth) will do.
04309 !               In either case, PD is preset to zero by the solver,
04310 !          so that only the nonzero elements need be loaded by JAC.
04311 !          Each call to JAC is preceded by a call to F with the same
04312 !          arguments NEQ, T, and Y.  Thus to gain some efficiency,
04313 !          intermediate quantities shared by both calculations may be
04314 !          saved in a user Common block by F and not recomputed by JAC,
04315 !          if desired.  Also, JAC may alter the Y array, if desired.
04316 !          JAC must be declared External in the calling program.
04317 !               Subroutine JAC may access user-defined quantities in
04318 !          NEQ(2),... and/or in Y(NEQ(1)+1),... if NEQ is an array
04319 !          (dimensioned in JAC) and/or Y has length exceeding NEQ(1).
04320 !          See the descriptions of NEQ and Y above.
04321 !
04322 ! JT     = Jacobian type indicator.  Used only for input.
04323 !          JT specifies how the Jacobian matrix df/dy will be
04324 !          treated, if and when DLSODA requires this matrix.
04325 !          JT has the following values and meanings:
04326 !           1 means a user-supplied full (NEQ by NEQ) Jacobian.
04327 !           2 means an internally generated (difference quotient) full
04328 !             Jacobian (using NEQ extra calls to F per df/dy value).
04329 !           4 means a user-supplied banded Jacobian.
04330 !           5 means an internally generated banded Jacobian (using
04331 !             ML+MU+1 extra calls to F per df/dy evaluation).
04332 !          If JT = 1 or 4, the user must supply a Subroutine JAC
04333 !          (the name is arbitrary) as described above under JAC.
04334 !          If JT = 2 or 5, a dummy argument can be used.
04335 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
04336 ! Optional Inputs.
04337 !
04338 ! The following is a list of the optional inputs provided for in the
04339 ! call sequence.  (See also Part 2.)  For each such input variable,
04340 ! this table lists its name as used in this documentation, its
04341 ! location in the call sequence, its meaning, and the default value.
04342 ! The use of any of these inputs requires IOPT = 1, and in that
04343 ! case all of these inputs are examined.  A value of zero for any
04344 ! of these optional inputs will cause the default value to be used.
04345 ! Thus to use a subset of the optional inputs, simply preload
04346 ! locations 5 to 10 in RWORK and IWORK to 0.0 and 0 respectively, and
04347 ! then set those of interest to nonzero values.
04348 !
04349 ! Name    Location      Meaning and Default Value
04350 !
04351 ! H0      RWORK(5)  the step size to be attempted on the first step.
04352 !                   The default value is determined by the solver.
04353 !
04354 ! HMAX    RWORK(6)  the maximum absolute step size allowed.
04355 !                   The default value is infinite.
04356 !
04357 ! HMIN    RWORK(7)  the minimum absolute step size allowed.
04358 !                   The default value is 0.  (This lower bound is not
04359 !                   enforced on the final step before reaching TCRIT
04360 !                   when ITASK = 4 or 5.)
04361 !
04362 ! IXPR    IWORK(5)  flag to generate extra printing at method switches.
04363 !                   IXPR = 0 means no extra printing (the default).
04364 !                   IXPR = 1 means print data on each switch.
04365 !                   T, H, and NST will be printed on the same logical
04366 !                   unit as used for error messages.
04367 !
04368 ! MXSTEP  IWORK(6)  maximum number of (internally defined) steps
04369 !                   allowed during one call to the solver.
04370 !                   The default value is 500.
04371 !
04372 ! MXHNIL  IWORK(7)  maximum number of messages printed (per problem)
04373 !                   warning that T + H = T on a step (H = step size).
04374 !                   This must be positive to result in a non-default
04375 !                   value.  The default value is 10.
04376 !
04377 ! MXORDN  IWORK(8)  the maximum order to be allowed for the nonstiff
04378 !                   (Adams) method.  the default value is 12.
04379 !                   if MXORDN exceeds the default value, it will
04380 !                   be reduced to the default value.
04381 !                   MXORDN is held constant during the problem.
04382 !
04383 ! MXORDS  IWORK(9)  the maximum order to be allowed for the stiff
04384 !                   (BDF) method.  The default value is 5.
04385 !                   If MXORDS exceeds the default value, it will
04386 !                   be reduced to the default value.
04387 !                   MXORDS is held constant during the problem.
04388 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
04389 ! Optional Outputs.
04390 !
04391 ! As optional additional output from DLSODA, the variables listed
04392 ! below are quantities related to the performance of DLSODA
04393 ! which are available to the user.  These are communicated by way of
04394 ! the work arrays, but also have internal mnemonic names as shown.
04395 ! except where stated otherwise, all of these outputs are defined
04396 ! on any successful return from DLSODA, and on any return with
04397 ! ISTATE = -1, -2, -4, -5, or -6.  On an illegal input return
04398 ! (ISTATE = -3), they will be unchanged from their existing values
04399 ! (if any), except possibly for TOLSF, LENRW, and LENIW.
04400 ! On any error return, outputs relevant to the error will be defined,
04401 ! as noted below.
04402 !
04403 ! Name    Location      Meaning
04404 !
04405 ! HU      RWORK(11) the step size in t last used (successfully).
04406 !
04407 ! HCUR    RWORK(12) the step size to be attempted on the next step.
04408 !
04409 ! TCUR    RWORK(13) the current value of the independent variable
04410 !                   which the solver has actually reached, i.e. the
04411 !                   current internal mesh point in t.  On output, TCUR
04412 !                   will always be at least as far as the argument
04413 !                   T, but may be farther (if interpolation was done).
04414 !
04415 ! TOLSF   RWORK(14) a tolerance scale factor, greater than 1.0,
04416 !                   computed when a request for too much accuracy was
04417 !                   detected (ISTATE = -3 if detected at the start of
04418 !                   the problem, ISTATE = -2 otherwise).  If ITOL is
04419 !                   left unaltered but RTOL and ATOL are uniformly
04420 !                   scaled up by a factor of TOLSF for the next call,
04421 !                   then the solver is deemed likely to succeed.
04422 !                   (The user may also ignore TOLSF and alter the
04423 !                   tolerance parameters in any other way appropriate.)
04424 !
04425 ! TSW     RWORK(15) the value of t at the time of the last method
04426 !                   switch, if any.
04427 !
04428 ! NST     IWORK(11) the number of steps taken for the problem so far.
04429 !
04430 ! NFE     IWORK(12) the number of f evaluations for the problem so far.
04431 !
04432 ! NJE     IWORK(13) the number of Jacobian evaluations (and of matrix
04433 !                   LU decompositions) for the problem so far.
04434 !
04435 ! NQU     IWORK(14) the method order last used (successfully).
04436 !
04437 ! NQCUR   IWORK(15) the order to be attempted on the next step.
04438 !
04439 ! IMXER   IWORK(16) the index of the component of largest magnitude in
04440 !                   the weighted local error vector ( E(i)/EWT(i) ),
04441 !                   on an error return with ISTATE = -4 or -5.
04442 !
04443 ! LENRW   IWORK(17) the length of RWORK actually required, assuming
04444 !                   that the length of RWORK is to be fixed for the
04445 !                   rest of the problem, and that switching may occur.
04446 !                   This is defined on normal returns and on an illegal
04447 !                   input return for insufficient storage.
04448 !
04449 ! LENIW   IWORK(18) the length of IWORK actually required, assuming
04450 !                   that the length of IWORK is to be fixed for the
04451 !                   rest of the problem, and that switching may occur.
04452 !                   This is defined on normal returns and on an illegal
04453 !                   input return for insufficient storage.
04454 !
04455 ! MUSED   IWORK(19) the method indicator for the last successful step:
04456 !                   1 means Adams (nonstiff), 2 means BDF (stiff).
04457 !
04458 ! MCUR    IWORK(20) the current method indicator:
04459 !                   1 means Adams (nonstiff), 2 means BDF (stiff).
04460 !                   This is the method to be attempted
04461 !                   on the next step.  Thus it differs from MUSED
04462 !                   only if a method switch has just been made.
04463 !
04464 ! The following two arrays are segments of the RWORK array which
04465 ! may also be of interest to the user as optional outputs.
04466 ! For each array, the table below gives its internal name,
04467 ! its base address in RWORK, and its description.
04468 !
04469 ! Name    Base Address      Description
04470 !
