04471 ! YH      21             the Nordsieck history array, of size NYH by
04472 !                        (NQCUR + 1), where NYH is the initial value
04473 !                        of NEQ.  For j = 0,1,...,NQCUR, column j+1
04474 !                        of YH contains HCUR**j/factorial(j) times
04475 !                        the j-th derivative of the interpolating
04476 !                        polynomial currently representing the solution,
04477 !                        evaluated at T = TCUR.
04478 !
04479 ! ACOR     LACOR         array of size NEQ used for the accumulated
04480 !         (from Common   corrections on each step, scaled on output
04481 !           as noted)    to represent the estimated local error in y
04482 !                        on the last step.  This is the vector E in
04483 !                        the description of the error control.  It is
04484 !                        defined only on a successful return from
04485 !                        DLSODA.  The base address LACOR is obtained by
04486 !                        including in the user's program the
04487 !                        following 2 lines:
04488 !                           COMMON /DLS001/ RLS(218), ILS(37)
04489 !                           LACOR = ILS(22)
04490 !
04491 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
04492 ! Part 2.  Other Routines Callable.
04493 !
04494 ! The following are optional calls which the user may make to
04495 ! gain additional capabilities in conjunction with DLSODA.
04496 ! (The routines XSETUN and XSETF are designed to conform to the
04497 ! SLATEC error handling package.)
04498 !
04499 !     Form of Call                  Function
04500 !   CALL XSETUN(LUN)          set the logical unit number, LUN, for
04501 !                             output of messages from DLSODA, if
04502 !                             the default is not desired.
04503 !                             The default value of LUN is 6.
04504 !
04505 !   CALL XSETF(MFLAG)         set a flag to control the printing of
04506 !                             messages by DLSODA.
04507 !                             MFLAG = 0 means do not print. (Danger:
04508 !                             This risks losing valuable information.)
04509 !                             MFLAG = 1 means print (the default).
04510 !
04511 !                             Either of the above calls may be made at
04512 !                             any time and will take effect immediately.
04513 !
04514 !   CALL DSRCMA(RSAV,ISAV,JOB) saves and restores the contents of
04515 !                             the internal Common blocks used by
04516 !                             DLSODA (see Part 3 below).
04517 !                             RSAV must be a real array of length 240
04518 !                             or more, and ISAV must be an integer
04519 !                             array of length 46 or more.
04520 !                             JOB=1 means save Common into RSAV/ISAV.
04521 !                             JOB=2 means restore Common from RSAV/ISAV.
04522 !                                DSRCMA is useful if one is
04523 !                             interrupting a run and restarting
04524 !                             later, or alternating between two or
04525 !                             more problems solved with DLSODA.
04526 !
04527 !   CALL DINTDY(,,,,,)        provide derivatives of y, of various
04528 !        (see below)          orders, at a specified point t, if
04529 !                             desired.  It may be called only after
04530 !                             a successful return from DLSODA.
04531 !
04532 ! The detailed instructions for using DINTDY are as follows.
04533 ! The form of the call is:
04534 !
04535 !   CALL DINTDY (T, K, RWORK(21), NYH, DKY, IFLAG)
04536 !
04537 ! The input parameters are:
04538 !
04539 ! T         = value of independent variable where answers are desired
04540 !             (normally the same as the T last returned by DLSODA).
04541 !             For valid results, T must lie between TCUR - HU and TCUR.
04542 !             (See optional outputs for TCUR and HU.)
04543 ! K         = integer order of the derivative desired.  K must satisfy
04544 !             0 .le. K .le. NQCUR, where NQCUR is the current order
04545 !             (see optional outputs).  The capability corresponding
04546 !             to K = 0, i.e. computing y(T), is already provided
04547 !             by DLSODA directly.  Since NQCUR .ge. 1, the first
04548 !             derivative dy/dt is always available with DINTDY.
04549 ! RWORK(21) = the base address of the history array YH.
04550 ! NYH       = column length of YH, equal to the initial value of NEQ.
04551 !
04552 ! The output parameters are:
04553 !
04554 ! DKY       = a real array of length NEQ containing the computed value
04555 !             of the K-th derivative of y(t).
04556 ! IFLAG     = integer flag, returned as 0 if K and T were legal,
04557 !             -1 if K was illegal, and -2 if T was illegal.
04558 !             On an error return, a message is also written.
04559 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
04560 ! Part 3.  Common Blocks.
04561 !
04562 ! If DLSODA is to be used in an overlay situation, the user
04563 ! must declare, in the primary overlay, the variables in:
04564 !   (1) the call sequence to DLSODA, and
04565 !   (2) the two internal Common blocks
04566 !         /DLS001/  of length  255  (218 double precision words
04567 !                      followed by 37 integer words),
04568 !         /DLSA01/  of length  31    (22 double precision words
04569 !                      followed by  9 integer words).
04570 !
04571 ! If DLSODA is used on a system in which the contents of internal
04572 ! Common blocks are not preserved between calls, the user should
04573 ! declare the above Common blocks in the calling program to insure
04574 ! that their contents are preserved.
04575 !
04576 ! If the solution of a given problem by DLSODA is to be interrupted
04577 ! and then later continued, such as when restarting an interrupted run
04578 ! or alternating between two or more problems, the user should save,
04579 ! following the return from the last DLSODA call prior to the
04580 ! interruption, the contents of the call sequence variables and the
04581 ! internal Common blocks, and later restore these values before the
04582 ! next DLSODA call for that problem.  To save and restore the Common
04583 ! blocks, use Subroutine DSRCMA (see Part 2 above).
04584 !
04585 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
04586 ! Part 4.  Optionally Replaceable Solver Routines.
04587 !
04588 ! Below is a description of a routine in the DLSODA package which
04589 ! relates to the measurement of errors, and can be
04590 ! replaced by a user-supplied version, if desired.  However, since such
04591 ! a replacement may have a major impact on performance, it should be
04592 ! done only when absolutely necessary, and only with great caution.
04593 ! (Note: The means by which the package version of a routine is
04594 ! superseded by the user's version may be system-dependent.)
04595 !
04596 ! (a) DEWSET.
04597 ! The following subroutine is called just before each internal
04598 ! integration step, and sets the array of error weights, EWT, as
04599 ! described under ITOL/RTOL/ATOL above:
04600 !     Subroutine DEWSET (NEQ, ITOL, RTOL, ATOL, YCUR, EWT)
04601 ! where NEQ, ITOL, RTOL, and ATOL are as in the DLSODA call sequence,
04602 ! YCUR contains the current dependent variable vector, and
04603 ! EWT is the array of weights set by DEWSET.
04604 !
04605 ! If the user supplies this subroutine, it must return in EWT(i)
04606 ! (i = 1,...,NEQ) a positive quantity suitable for comparing errors
04607 ! in y(i) to.  The EWT array returned by DEWSET is passed to the
04608 ! DMNORM routine, and also used by DLSODA in the computation
04609 ! of the optional output IMXER, and the increments for difference
04610 ! quotient Jacobians.
04611 !
04612 ! In the user-supplied version of DEWSET, it may be desirable to use
04613 ! the current values of derivatives of y.  Derivatives up to order NQ
04614 ! are available from the history array YH, described above under
04615 ! optional outputs.  In DEWSET, YH is identical to the YCUR array,
04616 ! extended to NQ + 1 columns with a column length of NYH and scale
04617 ! factors of H**j/factorial(j).  On the first call for the problem,
04618 ! given by NST = 0, NQ is 1 and H is temporarily set to 1.0.
04619 ! NYH is the initial value of NEQ.  The quantities NQ, H, and NST
04620 ! can be obtained by including in DEWSET the statements:
04621 !     DOUBLE PRECISION RLS
04622 !     COMMON /DLS001/ RLS(218),ILS(37)
04623 !     NQ = ILS(33)
04624 !     NST = ILS(34)
04625 !     H = RLS(212)
04626 ! Thus, for example, the current value of dy/dt can be obtained as
04627 ! YCUR(NYH+i)/H  (i=1,...,NEQ)  (and the division by H is
04628 ! unnecessary when NST = 0).
04629 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
04630 !
04631 !***REVISION HISTORY  (YYYYMMDD)
04632 ! 19811102  DATE WRITTEN
04633 ! 19820126  Fixed bug in tests of work space lengths;
04634 !           minor corrections in main prologue and comments.
04635 ! 19870330  Major update: corrected comments throughout;
04636 !           removed TRET from Common; rewrote EWSET with 4 loops;
04637 !           fixed t test in INTDY; added Cray directives in STODA;
04638 !           in STODA, fixed DELP init. and logic around PJAC call;
04639 !           combined routines to save/restore Common;
04640 !           passed LEVEL = 0 in error message calls (except run abort).
04641 ! 19970225  Fixed lines setting JSTART = -2 in Subroutine LSODA.
04642 ! 20010425  Major update: convert source lines to upper case;
04643 !           added *DECK lines; changed from 1 to * in dummy dimensions;
04644 !           changed names R1MACH/D1MACH to RUMACH/DUMACH;
04645 !           renamed routines for uniqueness across single/double prec.;
04646 !           converted intrinsic names to generic form;
04647 !           removed ILLIN and NTREP (data loaded) from Common;
04648 !           removed all 'own' variables from Common;
04649 !           changed error messages to quoted strings;
04650 !           replaced XERRWV/XERRWD with 1993 revised version;
04651 !           converted prologues, comments, error messages to mixed case;
04652 !           numerous corrections to prologues and internal comments.
04653 ! 20010507  Converted single precision source to double precision.
04654 ! 20010613  Revised excess accuracy test (to match rest of ODEPACK).
04655 ! 20010808  Fixed bug in DPRJA (matrix in DBNORM call).
04656 ! 20020502  Corrected declarations in descriptions of user routines.
04657 ! 20031105  Restored 'own' variables to Common blocks, to enable
04658 !           interrupt/restart feature.
04659 ! 20031112  Added SAVE statements for data-loaded constants.
04660 !
04661 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
04662 ! Other routines in the DLSODA package.
04663 !
04664 ! In addition to Subroutine DLSODA, the DLSODA package includes the
04665 ! following subroutines and function routines:
04666 !  DINTDY   computes an interpolated value of the y vector at t = TOUT.
04667 !  DSTODA   is the core integrator, which does one step of the
04668 !           integration and the associated error control.
04669 !  DCFODE   sets all method coefficients and test constants.
04670 !  DPRJA    computes and preprocesses the Jacobian matrix J = df/dy
04671 !           and the Newton iteration matrix P = I - h*l0*J.
04672 !  DSOLSY   manages solution of linear system in chord iteration.
04673 !  DEWSET   sets the error weight vector EWT before each step.
04674 !  DMNORM   computes the weighted max-norm of a vector.
04675 !  DFNORM   computes the norm of a full matrix consistent with the
04676 !           weighted max-norm on vectors.
04677 !  DBNORM   computes the norm of a band matrix consistent with the
04678 !           weighted max-norm on vectors.
04679 !  DSRCMA   is a user-callable routine to save and restore
04680 !           the contents of the internal Common blocks.
04681 !  DGEFA and DGESL   are routines from LINPACK for solving full
04682 !           systems of linear algebraic equations.
04683 !  DGBFA and DGBSL   are routines from LINPACK for solving banded
04684 !           linear systems.
04685 !  DUMACH   computes the unit roundoff in a machine-independent manner.
04686 !  XERRWD, XSETUN, XSETF, IXSAV, and IUMACH  handle the printing of all
04687 !           error messages and warnings.  XERRWD is machine-dependent.
04688 ! Note:  DMNORM, DFNORM, DBNORM, DUMACH, IXSAV, and IUMACH are
04689 ! function routines.  All the others are subroutines.
04690 !
04691 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
04692 EXTERNAL DPRJA, DSOLSY
04693 DOUBLE PRECISION DUMACH, DMNORM
04694 INTEGER INIT, MXSTEP, MXHNIL, NHNIL, NSLAST, NYH, IOWNS, ICF, IERPJ, IERSL, JCUR, JSTART, KFLAG, L, LYH
04695 INTEGER LEWT, LACOR, LSAVF, LWM, LIWM, METH, MITER, MAXORD, MAXCOR, MSBP, MXNCF, N, NQ, NST, NFE, NJE, NQU
04696 INTEGER INSUFR, INSUFI, IXPR, IOWNS2, JTYP, MUSED, MXORDN, MXORDS
04697 INTEGER I, I1, I2, IFLAG, IMXER, KGO, LF0, LENIW, LENRW, LENWM, ML, MORD, MU, MXHNL0, MXSTP0
04698 INTEGER LEN1, LEN1C, LEN1N, LEN1S, LEN2, LENIWC, LENRWC
04699 DOUBLE PRECISION ROWNS, CCMAX, EL0, H, HMIN, HMXI, HU, RC, TN, UROUND
04700 DOUBLE PRECISION TSW, ROWNS2, PDNORM
04701 DOUBLE PRECISION ATOLI, AYI, BIG, EWTI, H0, HMAX, HMX, RH, RTOLI, TCRIT, TDIST, TNEXT, TOL, TOLSF, TP, SIZE, SUM, W0
04702 DIMENSION MORD(2)
04703 LOGICAL IHIT
04704 character(len=60) MSG
04705 SAVE MORD, MXSTP0, MXHNL0
04706 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
04707 ! The following two internal Common blocks contain
04708 ! (a) variables which are local to any subroutine but whose values must
04709 !     be preserved between calls to the routine ("own" variables), and
04710 ! (b) variables which are communicated between subroutines.
04711 ! The block DLS001 is declared in subroutines DLSODA, DINTDY, DSTODA,
04712 ! DPRJA, and DSOLSY.
04713 ! The block DLSA01 is declared in subroutines DLSODA, DSTODA, and DPRJA.
04714 ! Groups of variables are replaced by dummy arrays in the Common
04715 ! declarations in routines where those variables are not used.
04716 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
04717 COMMON /DLS001/ ROWNS(209), CCMAX, EL0, H, HMIN, HMXI, HU, RC, TN, UROUND, INIT, MXSTEP, MXHNIL, NHNIL, NSLAST, NYH, & 
04718 IOWNS( 6), ICF, IERPJ, IERSL, JCUR, JSTART, KFLAG, L, LYH, LEWT, LACOR, LSAVF, LWM, LIWM, METH, MITER, MAXORD, MAXCOR, & 
04719 MSBP, MXNCF , N, NQ, NST, NFE, NJE, NQU
04720 !
04721 COMMON /DLSA01/ TSW, ROWNS2(20), PDNORM, INSUFR, INSUFI, IXPR, IOWNS2(2), JTYP, MUSED, MXORDN, MXORDS
04722 !
04723 DATA MORD(1),MORD(2)/12,5/, MXSTP0/500/, MXHNL0/10/
04724 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
04725 ! Block A.
04726 ! This code block is executed on every call.
04727 ! It tests ISTATE and ITASK for legality and branches appropriately.
04728 ! If ISTATE .gt. 1 but the flag INIT shows that initialization has
04729 ! not yet been done, an error return occurs.
04730 ! If ISTATE = 1 and TOUT = T, return immediately.
04731 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
04732 IF (ISTATE .LT. 1 .OR. ISTATE .GT. 3) GOTO 601
04733 IF (ITASK .LT. 1 .OR. ITASK .GT. 5) GOTO 602
04734 IF (ISTATE .EQ. 1) GOTO 10
04735 IF (INIT .EQ. 0) GOTO 603
04736 IF (ISTATE .EQ. 2) GOTO 200
04737 GOTO 20
04738 10   INIT = 0
04739 IF (TOUT .EQ. T) RETURN
04740 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
04741 ! Block B.
04742 ! The next code block is executed for the initial call (ISTATE = 1),
04743 ! or for a continuation call with parameter changes (ISTATE = 3).
04744 ! It contains checking of all inputs and various initializations.
04745 !
04746 ! First check legality of the non-optional inputs NEQ, ITOL, IOPT,
04747 ! JT, ML, and MU.
04748 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
04749 20   IF (NEQ(1) .LE. 0) GOTO 604
04750 IF (ISTATE .EQ. 1) GOTO 25
04751 IF (NEQ(1) .GT. N) GOTO 605
04752 25   N = NEQ(1)
04753 IF (ITOL .LT. 1 .OR. ITOL .GT. 4) GOTO 606
04754 IF (IOPT .LT. 0 .OR. IOPT .GT. 1) GOTO 607
04755 IF (JT .EQ. 3 .OR. JT .LT. 1 .OR. JT .GT. 5) GOTO 608
04756 JTYP = JT
04757 IF (JT .LE. 2) GOTO 30
04758 ML = IWORK(1)
04759 MU = IWORK(2)
04760 IF (ML .LT. 0 .OR. ML .GE. N) GOTO 609
04761 IF (MU .LT. 0 .OR. MU .GE. N) GOTO 610
04762 30   CONTINUE
04763 ! Next process and check the optional inputs. --------------------------
04764 IF (IOPT .EQ. 1) GOTO 40
04765 IXPR = 0
04766 MXSTEP = MXSTP0
04767 MXHNIL = MXHNL0
04768 HMXI = 0.0D0
04769 HMIN = 0.0D0
04770 IF (ISTATE .NE. 1) GOTO 60
04771 H0 = 0.0D0
04772 MXORDN = MORD(1)
04773 MXORDS = MORD(2)
04774 GOTO 60
04775 40   IXPR = IWORK(5)
04776 IF (IXPR .LT. 0 .OR. IXPR .GT. 1) GOTO 611
04777 MXSTEP = IWORK(6)
04778 IF (MXSTEP .LT. 0) GOTO 612
04779 IF (MXSTEP .EQ. 0) MXSTEP = MXSTP0
04780 MXHNIL = IWORK(7)
04781 IF (MXHNIL .LT. 0) GOTO 613
04782 IF (MXHNIL .EQ. 0) MXHNIL = MXHNL0
04783 IF (ISTATE .NE. 1) GOTO 50
04784 H0 = RWORK(5)
04785 MXORDN = IWORK(8)
04786 IF (MXORDN .LT. 0) GOTO 628
04787 IF (MXORDN .EQ. 0) MXORDN = 100
04788 MXORDN = MIN(MXORDN,MORD(1))
04789 MXORDS = IWORK(9)
04790 IF (MXORDS .LT. 0) GOTO 629
04791 IF (MXORDS .EQ. 0) MXORDS = 100
04792 MXORDS = MIN(MXORDS,MORD(2))
04793 IF ((TOUT - T)*H0 .LT. 0.0D0) GOTO 614
04794 50   HMAX = RWORK(6)
04795 IF (HMAX .LT. 0.0D0) GOTO 615
04796 HMXI = 0.0D0
04797 IF (HMAX .GT. 0.0D0) HMXI = 1.0D0/HMAX
04798 HMIN = RWORK(7)
04799 IF (HMIN .LT. 0.0D0) GOTO 616
04800 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
04801 ! Set work array pointers and check lengths LRW and LIW.
04802 ! If ISTATE = 1, METH is initialized to 1 here to facilitate the
04803 ! checking of work space lengths.
04804 ! Pointers to segments of RWORK and IWORK are named by prefixing L to
04805 ! the name of the segment.  E.g., the segment YH starts at RWORK(LYH).
04806 ! Segments of RWORK (in order) are denoted  YH, WM, EWT, SAVF, ACOR.
04807 ! If the lengths provided are insufficient for the current method,
04808 ! an error return occurs.  This is treated as illegal input on the
04809 ! first call, but as a problem interruption with ISTATE = -7 on a
04810 ! continuation call.  If the lengths are sufficient for the current
04811 ! method but not for both methods, a warning message is sent.
04812 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
04813 60   IF (ISTATE .EQ. 1) METH = 1
04814 IF (ISTATE .EQ. 1) NYH = N
04815 LYH = 21
04816 LEN1N = 20 + (MXORDN + 1)*NYH
04817 LEN1S = 20 + (MXORDS + 1)*NYH
04818 LWM = LEN1S + 1
04819 IF (JT .LE. 2) LENWM = N*N + 2
04820 IF (JT .GE. 4) LENWM = (2*ML + MU + 1)*N + 2
04821 LEN1S = LEN1S + LENWM
04822 LEN1C = LEN1N
04823 IF (METH .EQ. 2) LEN1C = LEN1S
04824 LEN1 = MAX(LEN1N,LEN1S)
04825 LEN2 = 3*N
04826 LENRW = LEN1 + LEN2
04827 LENRWC = LEN1C + LEN2
04828 IWORK(17) = LENRW
04829 LIWM = 1
04830 LENIW = 20 + N
04831 LENIWC = 20
04832 IF (METH .EQ. 2) LENIWC = LENIW
04833 IWORK(18) = LENIW
04834 IF (ISTATE .EQ. 1 .AND. LRW .LT. LENRWC) GOTO 617
04835 IF (ISTATE .EQ. 1 .AND. LIW .LT. LENIWC) GOTO 618
04836 IF (ISTATE .EQ. 3 .AND. LRW .LT. LENRWC) GOTO 550
04837 IF (ISTATE .EQ. 3 .AND. LIW .LT. LENIWC) GOTO 555
04838 LEWT = LEN1 + 1
04839 INSUFR = 0
04840 IF (LRW .GE. LENRW) GOTO 65
04841 INSUFR = 2
04842 LEWT = LEN1C + 1
04843 MSG='DLSODA-  Warning.. RWORK length is sufficient for now, but  '
04844 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 103, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
04845 MSG='      may not be later.  Integration will proceed anyway.   '
04846 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 103, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
04847 MSG = '      Length needed is LENRW = I1, while LRW = I2.'
04848 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 103, 0, 2, LENRW, LRW, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
04849 65   LSAVF = LEWT + N
04850 LACOR = LSAVF + N
04851 INSUFI = 0
04852 IF (LIW .GE. LENIW) GOTO 70
04853 INSUFI = 2
04854 MSG='DLSODA-  Warning.. IWORK length is sufficient for now, but  '
04855 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 104, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
04856 MSG='      may not be later.  Integration will proceed anyway.   '
04857 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 104, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
04858 MSG = '      Length needed is LENIW = I1, while LIW = I2.'
04859 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 104, 0, 2, LENIW, LIW, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
04860 70   CONTINUE
04861 ! Check RTOL and ATOL for legality. ------------------------------------
04862 RTOLI = RTOL(1)
04863 ATOLI = ATOL(1)
04864 DO 75 I = 1,N
04865 IF (ITOL .GE. 3) RTOLI = RTOL(I)
04866 IF (ITOL .EQ. 2 .OR. ITOL .EQ. 4) ATOLI = ATOL(I)
04867 IF (RTOLI .LT. 0.0D0) GOTO 619
04868 IF (ATOLI .LT. 0.0D0) GOTO 620
04869 75     CONTINUE
04870 IF (ISTATE .EQ. 1) GOTO 100
04871 ! If ISTATE = 3, set flag to signal parameter changes to DSTODA. -------
04872 JSTART = -1
04873 IF (N .EQ. NYH) GOTO 200
04874 ! NEQ was reduced.  Zero part of YH to avoid undefined references. -----
04875 I1 = LYH + L*NYH
04876 I2 = LYH + (MAXORD + 1)*NYH - 1
04877 IF (I1 .GT. I2) GOTO 200
04878 DO 95 I = I1,I2
04879 95     RWORK(I) = 0.0D0
04880 GOTO 200
04881 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
04882 ! Block C.
04883 ! The next block is for the initial call only (ISTATE = 1).
04884 ! It contains all remaining initializations, the initial call to F,
04885 ! and the calculation of the initial step size.
04886 ! The error weights in EWT are inverted after being loaded.
04887 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
04888 100  UROUND = DUMACH()
04889 TN = T
04890 TSW = T
04891 MAXORD = MXORDN
04892 IF (ITASK .NE. 4 .AND. ITASK .NE. 5) GOTO 110
04893 TCRIT = RWORK(1)
04894 IF ((TCRIT - TOUT)*(TOUT - T) .LT. 0.0D0) GOTO 625
04895 IF (H0 .NE. 0.0D0 .AND. (T + H0 - TCRIT)*H0 .GT. 0.0D0) H0 = TCRIT - T
04896 110  JSTART = 0
04897 NHNIL = 0
04898 NST = 0
04899 NJE = 0
04900 NSLAST = 0
04901 HU = 0.0D0
04902 NQU = 0
04903 MUSED = 0
04904 MITER = 0
04905 CCMAX = 0.3D0
04906 MAXCOR = 3
04907 MSBP = 20
04908 MXNCF = 10
04909 ! Initial call to F.  (LF0 points to YH(*,2).) -------------------------
04910 LF0 = LYH + NYH
04911 CALL F (NEQ, T, Y, RWORK(LF0))
04912 NFE = 1
04913 ! Load the initial value vector in YH. ---------------------------------
04914 DO 115 I = 1,N
04915 115    RWORK(I+LYH-1) = Y(I)
04916 ! Load and invert the EWT array.  (H is temporarily set to 1.0.) -------
04917 NQ = 1
04918 H = 1.0D0
04919 CALL DEWSET (N, ITOL, RTOL, ATOL, RWORK(LYH), RWORK(LEWT))
04920 DO 120 I = 1,N
04921 IF (RWORK(I+LEWT-1) .LE. 0.0D0) GOTO 621
04922 120    RWORK(I+LEWT-1) = 1.0D0/RWORK(I+LEWT-1)
04923 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
04924 ! The coding below computes the step size, H0, to be attempted on the
04925 ! first step, unless the user has supplied a value for this.
04926 ! First check that TOUT - T differs significantly from zero.
04927 ! A scalar tolerance quantity TOL is computed, as MAX(RTOL(i))
04928 ! if this is positive, or MAX(ATOL(i)/ABS(Y(i))) otherwise, adjusted
04929 ! so as to be between 100*UROUND and 1.0E-3.
04930 ! Then the computed value H0 is given by:
04931 !
04932 !   H0**(-2)  =  1./(TOL * w0**2)  +  TOL * (norm(F))**2
04933 !
04934 ! where   w0     = MAX ( ABS(T), ABS(TOUT) ),
04935 !         F      = the initial value of the vector f(t,y), and
04936 !         norm() = the weighted vector norm used throughout, given by
04937 !                  the DMNORM function routine, and weighted by the
04938 !                  tolerances initially loaded into the EWT array.
04939 ! The sign of H0 is inferred from the initial values of TOUT and T.
04940 ! ABS(H0) is made .le. ABS(TOUT-T) in any case.
04941 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
04942 IF (H0 .NE. 0.0D0) GOTO 180
04943 TDIST = ABS(TOUT - T)
04944 W0 = MAX(ABS(T),ABS(TOUT))
04945 IF (TDIST .LT. 2.0D0*UROUND*W0) GOTO 622
04946 TOL = RTOL(1)
04947 IF (ITOL .LE. 2) GOTO 140
04948 DO 130 I = 1,N
04949 130    TOL = MAX(TOL,RTOL(I))
04950 140  IF (TOL .GT. 0.0D0) GOTO 160
04951 ATOLI = ATOL(1)
04952 DO 150 I = 1,N
04953 IF (ITOL .EQ. 2 .OR. ITOL .EQ. 4) ATOLI = ATOL(I)
04954 AYI = ABS(Y(I))
04955 IF (AYI .NE. 0.0D0) TOL = MAX(TOL,ATOLI/AYI)
04956 150    CONTINUE
04957 160  TOL = MAX(TOL,100.0D0*UROUND)
04958 TOL = MIN(TOL,0.001D0)
04959 SUM = DMNORM (N, RWORK(LF0), RWORK(LEWT))
04960 SUM = 1.0D0/(TOL*W0*W0) + TOL*SUM**2
04961 H0 = 1.0D0/SQRT(SUM)
04962 H0 = MIN(H0,TDIST)
04963 H0 = SIGN(H0,TOUT-T)
04964 ! Adjust H0 if necessary to meet HMAX bound. ---------------------------
04965 180  RH = ABS(H0)*HMXI
04966 IF (RH .GT. 1.0D0) H0 = H0/RH
04967 ! Load H with H0 and scale YH(*,2) by H0. ------------------------------
04968 H = H0
04969 DO 190 I = 1,N
04970 190    RWORK(I+LF0-1) = H0*RWORK(I+LF0-1)
04971 GOTO 270
04972 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
04973 ! Block D.
04974 ! The next code block is for continuation calls only (ISTATE = 2 or 3)
04975 ! and is to check stop conditions before taking a step.
04976 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
04977 200  NSLAST = NST
04978 GOTO (210, 250, 220, 230, 240), ITASK
04979 210  IF ((TN - TOUT)*H .LT. 0.0D0) GOTO 250
04980 CALL DINTDY (TOUT, 0, RWORK(LYH), NYH, Y, IFLAG)
04981 IF (IFLAG .NE. 0) GOTO 627
04982 T = TOUT
04983 GOTO 420
04984 220  TP = TN - HU*(1.0D0 + 100.0D0*UROUND)
04985 IF ((TP - TOUT)*H .GT. 0.0D0) GOTO 623
04986 IF ((TN - TOUT)*H .LT. 0.0D0) GOTO 250
04987 T = TN
04988 GOTO 400
04989 230  TCRIT = RWORK(1)
04990 IF ((TN - TCRIT)*H .GT. 0.0D0) GOTO 624
04991 IF ((TCRIT - TOUT)*H .LT. 0.0D0) GOTO 625
04992 IF ((TN - TOUT)*H .LT. 0.0D0) GOTO 245
04993 CALL DINTDY (TOUT, 0, RWORK(LYH), NYH, Y, IFLAG)
04994 IF (IFLAG .NE. 0) GOTO 627
04995 T = TOUT
04996 GOTO 420
04997 240  TCRIT = RWORK(1)
04998 IF ((TN - TCRIT)*H .GT. 0.0D0) GOTO 624
04999 245  HMX = ABS(TN) + ABS(H)
05000 IHIT = ABS(TN - TCRIT) .LE. 100.0D0*UROUND*HMX
05001 IF (IHIT) T = TCRIT
05002 IF (IHIT) GOTO 400
05003 TNEXT = TN + H*(1.0D0 + 4.0D0*UROUND)
05004 IF ((TNEXT - TCRIT)*H .LE. 0.0D0) GOTO 250
05005 H = (TCRIT - TN)*(1.0D0 - 4.0D0*UROUND)
05006 IF (ISTATE .EQ. 2 .AND. JSTART .GE. 0) JSTART = -2
05007 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
05008 ! Block E.
05009 ! The next block is normally executed for all calls and contains
05010 ! the call to the one-step core integrator DSTODA.
05011 !
05012 ! This is a looping point for the integration steps.
05013 !
05014 ! First check for too many steps being taken, update EWT (if not at
05015 ! start of problem), check for too much accuracy being requested, and
05016 ! check for H below the roundoff level in T.
05017 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
05018 250  CONTINUE
05019 IF (METH .EQ. MUSED) GOTO 255
05020 IF (INSUFR .EQ. 1) GOTO 550
05021 IF (INSUFI .EQ. 1) GOTO 555
05022 255  IF ((NST-NSLAST) .GE. MXSTEP) GOTO 500
05023 CALL DEWSET (N, ITOL, RTOL, ATOL, RWORK(LYH), RWORK(LEWT))
05024 DO 260 I = 1,N
05025 IF (RWORK(I+LEWT-1) .LE. 0.0D0) GOTO 510
05026 260    RWORK(I+LEWT-1) = 1.0D0/RWORK(I+LEWT-1)
05027 270  TOLSF = UROUND*DMNORM (N, RWORK(LYH), RWORK(LEWT))
05028 IF (TOLSF .LE. 1.0D0) GOTO 280
05029 TOLSF = TOLSF*2.0D0
05030 IF (NST .EQ. 0) GOTO 626
05031 GOTO 520
05032 280  IF ((TN + H) .NE. TN) GOTO 290
05033 NHNIL = NHNIL + 1
05034 IF (NHNIL .GT. MXHNIL) GOTO 290
05035 MSG = 'DLSODA-  Warning..Internal T (=R1) and H (=R2) are'
05036 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 101, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
05037 MSG='      such that in the machine, T + H = T on the next step  '
05038 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 101, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
05039 MSG = '     (H = step size). Solver will continue anyway.'
05040 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 101, 0, 0, 0, 0, 2, TN, H)
05041 IF (NHNIL .LT. MXHNIL) GOTO 290
05042 MSG = 'DLSODA-  Above warning has been issued I1 times.  '
05043 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 102, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
05044 MSG = '     It will not be issued again for this problem.'
05045 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 102, 0, 1, MXHNIL, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
05046 290  CONTINUE
05047 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
05048 !   CALL DSTODA(NEQ,Y,YH,NYH,YH,EWT,SAVF,ACOR,WM,IWM,F,JAC,DPRJA,DSOLSY)
05049 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
05050 CALL DSTODA (NEQ, Y, RWORK(LYH), NYH, RWORK(LYH), RWORK(LEWT), RWORK(LSAVF), RWORK(LACOR), RWORK(LWM), &
05051 IWORK(LIWM), F, JAC, DPRJA, DSOLSY)
05052 KGO = 1 - KFLAG
05053 GOTO (300, 530, 540), KGO
05054 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
05055 ! Block F.
05056 ! The following block handles the case of a successful return from the
05057 ! core integrator (KFLAG = 0).
05058 ! If a method switch was just made, record TSW, reset MAXORD,
05059 ! set JSTART to -1 to signal DSTODA to complete the switch,
05060 ! and do extra printing of data if IXPR = 1.
05061 ! Then, in any case, check for stop conditions.
05062 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
05063 300  INIT = 1
05064 IF (METH .EQ. MUSED) GOTO 310
05065 TSW = TN
05066 MAXORD = MXORDN
05067 IF (METH .EQ. 2) MAXORD = MXORDS
05068 IF (METH .EQ. 2) RWORK(LWM) = SQRT(UROUND)
05069 INSUFR = MIN(INSUFR,1)
05070 INSUFI = MIN(INSUFI,1)
05071 JSTART = -1
05072 IF (IXPR .EQ. 0) GOTO 310
05073 IF (METH .EQ. 2) THEN
05074 MSG='DLSODA- A switch to the BDF (stiff) method has occurred     '
05075 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 105, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
05076 ENDIF
05077 IF (METH .EQ. 1) THEN
05078 MSG='DLSODA- A switch to the Adams (nonstiff) method has occurred'
05079 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 106, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
05080 ENDIF
05081 MSG='     at T = R1,  tentative step size H = R2,  step NST = I1 '
05082 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 107, 0, 1, NST, 0, 2, TN, H)
05083 310  GOTO (320, 400, 330, 340, 350), ITASK
05084 ! ITASK = 1.  If TOUT has been reached, interpolate. -------------------
05085 320  IF ((TN - TOUT)*H .LT. 0.0D0) GOTO 250
05086 CALL DINTDY (TOUT, 0, RWORK(LYH), NYH, Y, IFLAG)
05087 T = TOUT
05088 GOTO 420
05089 ! ITASK = 3.  Jump to exit if TOUT was reached. ------------------------
05090 330  IF ((TN - TOUT)*H .GE. 0.0D0) GOTO 400
05091 GOTO 250
05092 ! ITASK = 4.  See if TOUT or TCRIT was reached.  Adjust H if necessary.
05093 340  IF ((TN - TOUT)*H .LT. 0.0D0) GOTO 345
05094 CALL DINTDY (TOUT, 0, RWORK(LYH), NYH, Y, IFLAG)
05095 T = TOUT
05096 GOTO 420
05097 345  HMX = ABS(TN) + ABS(H)
05098 IHIT = ABS(TN - TCRIT) .LE. 100.0D0*UROUND*HMX
05099 IF (IHIT) GOTO 400
05100 TNEXT = TN + H*(1.0D0 + 4.0D0*UROUND)
05101 IF ((TNEXT - TCRIT)*H .LE. 0.0D0) GOTO 250
05102 H = (TCRIT - TN)*(1.0D0 - 4.0D0*UROUND)
05103 IF (JSTART .GE. 0) JSTART = -2
05104 GOTO 250
05105 ! ITASK = 5.  See if TCRIT was reached and jump to exit. ---------------
05106 350  HMX = ABS(TN) + ABS(H)
05107 IHIT = ABS(TN - TCRIT) .LE. 100.0D0*UROUND*HMX
05108 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
05109 ! Block G.
05110 ! The following block handles all successful returns from DLSODA.
05111 ! If ITASK .ne. 1, Y is loaded from YH and T is set accordingly.
05112 ! ISTATE is set to 2, and the optional outputs are loaded into the
05113 ! work arrays before returning.
05114 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
05115 400  DO 410 I = 1,N
05116 410    Y(I) = RWORK(I+LYH-1)
05117 T = TN
05118 IF (ITASK .NE. 4 .AND. ITASK .NE. 5) GOTO 420
05119 IF (IHIT) T = TCRIT
05120 420  ISTATE = 2
05121 RWORK(11) = HU
05122 RWORK(12) = H
05123 RWORK(13) = TN
05124 RWORK(15) = TSW
05125 IWORK(11) = NST
05126 IWORK(12) = NFE
05127 IWORK(13) = NJE
05128 IWORK(14) = NQU
05129 IWORK(15) = NQ
05130 IWORK(19) = MUSED
05131 IWORK(20) = METH
05132 RETURN
05133 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
05134 ! Block H.
05135 ! The following block handles all unsuccessful returns other than
05136 ! those for illegal input.  First the error message routine is called.
05137 ! If there was an error test or convergence test failure, IMXER is set.
05138 ! Then Y is loaded from YH and T is set to TN.
05139 ! The optional outputs are loaded into the work arrays before returning.
05140 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
05141 ! The maximum number of steps was taken before reaching TOUT. ----------
05142 500  MSG = 'DLSODA-  At current T (=R1), MXSTEP (=I1) steps   '
05143 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 201, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
05144 MSG = '      taken on this call before reaching TOUT     '
05145 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 201, 0, 1, MXSTEP, 0, 1, TN, 0.0D0)
05146 ISTATE = -1
05147 GOTO 580
05148 ! EWT(i) .le. 0.0 for some i (not at start of problem). ----------------
05149 510  EWTI = RWORK(LEWT+I-1)
05150 MSG = 'DLSODA-  At T (=R1), EWT(I1) has become R2 .le. 0.'
05151 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 202, 0, 1, I, 0, 2, TN, EWTI)
05152 ISTATE = -6
05153 GOTO 580
05154 ! Too much accuracy requested for machine precision. -------------------
05155 520  MSG = 'DLSODA-  At T (=R1), too much accuracy requested  '
05156 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 203, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
05157 MSG = '      for precision of machine..  See TOLSF (=R2) '
05158 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 203, 0, 0, 0, 0, 2, TN, TOLSF)
05159 RWORK(14) = TOLSF
05160 ISTATE = -2
05161 GOTO 580
05162 ! KFLAG = -1.  Error test failed repeatedly or with ABS(H) = HMIN. -----
05163 530  MSG = 'DLSODA-  At T(=R1) and step size H(=R2), the error'
05164 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 204, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
05165 MSG = '      test failed repeatedly or with ABS(H) = HMIN'
05166 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 204, 0, 0, 0, 0, 2, TN, H)
05167 ISTATE = -4
05168 GOTO 560
05169 ! KFLAG = -2.  Convergence failed repeatedly or with ABS(H) = HMIN. ----
05170 540  MSG = 'DLSODA-  At T (=R1) and step size H (=R2), the    '
05171 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 205, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
05172 MSG = '      corrector convergence failed repeatedly     '
05173 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 205, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
05174 MSG = '      or with ABS(H) = HMIN   '
05175 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 205, 0, 0, 0, 0, 2, TN, H)
05176 ISTATE = -5
05177 GOTO 560
05178 ! RWORK length too small to proceed. -----------------------------------
05179 550  MSG = 'DLSODA-  At current T(=R1), RWORK length too small'
05180 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 206, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
05181 MSG='      to proceed.  The integration was otherwise successful.'
05182 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 206, 0, 0, 0, 0, 1, TN, 0.0D0)
05183 ISTATE = -7
05184 GOTO 580
05185 ! IWORK length too small to proceed. -----------------------------------
05186 555  MSG = 'DLSODA-  At current T(=R1), IWORK length too small'
05187 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 207, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
05188 MSG='      to proceed.  The integration was otherwise successful.'
05189 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 207, 0, 0, 0, 0, 1, TN, 0.0D0)
05190 ISTATE = -7
05191 GOTO 580
05192 ! Compute IMXER if relevant. -------------------------------------------
05193 560  BIG = 0.0D0
05194 IMXER = 1
05195 DO 570 I = 1,N
05196 SIZE = ABS(RWORK(I+LACOR-1)*RWORK(I+LEWT-1))
05197 IF (BIG .GE. SIZE) GOTO 570
05198 BIG = SIZE
05199 IMXER = I
05200 570    CONTINUE
05201 IWORK(16) = IMXER
05202 ! Set Y vector, T, and optional outputs. -------------------------------
05203 580  DO 590 I = 1,N
05204 590    Y(I) = RWORK(I+LYH-1)
05205 T = TN
05206 RWORK(11) = HU
05207 RWORK(12) = H
05208 RWORK(13) = TN
05209 RWORK(15) = TSW
05210 IWORK(11) = NST
05211 IWORK(12) = NFE
05212 IWORK(13) = NJE
05213 IWORK(14) = NQU
05214 IWORK(15) = NQ
05215 IWORK(19) = MUSED
05216 IWORK(20) = METH
05217 RETURN
05218 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
05219 ! Block I.
05220 ! The following block handles all error returns due to illegal input
05221 ! (ISTATE = -3), as detected before calling the core integrator.
05222 ! First the error message routine is called.  If the illegal input
05223 ! is a negative ISTATE, the run is aborted (apparent infinite loop).
05224 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
05225 601  MSG = 'DLSODA-  ISTATE (=I1) illegal.'
05226 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 1, 0, 1, ISTATE, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
05227 IF (ISTATE .LT. 0) GOTO 800
05228 GOTO 700
05229 602  MSG = 'DLSODA-  ITASK (=I1) illegal. '
05230 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 2, 0, 1, ITASK, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
05231 GOTO 700
05232 603  MSG = 'DLSODA-  ISTATE .gt. 1 but DLSODA not initialized.'
05233 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 3, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
05234 GOTO 700
05235 604  MSG = 'DLSODA-  NEQ (=I1) .lt. 1     '
05236 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 4, 0, 1, NEQ(1), 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
05237 GOTO 700
05238 605  MSG = 'DLSODA-  ISTATE = 3 and NEQ increased (I1 to I2). '
05239 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 5, 0, 2, N, NEQ(1), 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
05240 GOTO 700
05241 606  MSG = 'DLSODA-  ITOL (=I1) illegal.  '
05242 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 6, 0, 1, ITOL, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
05243 GOTO 700
05244 607  MSG = 'DLSODA-  IOPT (=I1) illegal.  '
05245 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 7, 0, 1, IOPT, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
05246 GOTO 700
05247 608  MSG = 'DLSODA-  JT (=I1) illegal.    '
05248 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 8, 0, 1, JT, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
05249 GOTO 700
05250 609  MSG = 'DLSODA-  ML (=I1) illegal: .lt.0 or .ge.NEQ (=I2) '
05251 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 9, 0, 2, ML, NEQ(1), 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
05252 GOTO 700
05253 610  MSG = 'DLSODA-  MU (=I1) illegal: .lt.0 or .ge.NEQ (=I2) '
05254 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 10, 0, 2, MU, NEQ(1), 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
05255 GOTO 700
05256 611  MSG = 'DLSODA-  IXPR (=I1) illegal.  '
05257 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 11, 0, 1, IXPR, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
05258 GOTO 700
05259 612  MSG = 'DLSODA-  MXSTEP (=I1) .lt. 0  '
05260 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 12, 0, 1, MXSTEP, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
05261 GOTO 700
05262 613  MSG = 'DLSODA-  MXHNIL (=I1) .lt. 0  '
05263 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 13, 0, 1, MXHNIL, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
05264 GOTO 700
05265 614  MSG = 'DLSODA-  TOUT (=R1) behind T (=R2)      '
05266 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 40, 14, 0, 0, 0, 0, 2, TOUT, T)
05267 MSG = '      Integration direction is given by H0 (=R1)  '
05268 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 14, 0, 0, 0, 0, 1, H0, 0.0D0)
05269 GOTO 700
05270 615  MSG = 'DLSODA-  HMAX (=R1) .lt. 0.0  '
05271 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 15, 0, 0, 0, 0, 1, HMAX, 0.0D0)
05272 GOTO 700
05273 616  MSG = 'DLSODA-  HMIN (=R1) .lt. 0.0  '
05274 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 16, 0, 0, 0, 0, 1, HMIN, 0.0D0)
05275 GOTO 700
05276 617  MSG='DLSODA-  RWORK length needed, LENRW (=I1), exceeds LRW (=I2)'
05277 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 17, 0, 2, LENRW, LRW, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
05278 GOTO 700
05279 618  MSG='DLSODA-  IWORK length needed, LENIW (=I1), exceeds LIW (=I2)'
05280 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 18, 0, 2, LENIW, LIW, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
05281 GOTO 700
05282 619  MSG = 'DLSODA-  RTOL(I1) is R1 .lt. 0.0        '
05283 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 40, 19, 0, 1, I, 0, 1, RTOLI, 0.0D0)
05284 GOTO 700
05285 620  MSG = 'DLSODA-  ATOL(I1) is R1 .lt. 0.0        '
05286 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 40, 20, 0, 1, I, 0, 1, ATOLI, 0.0D0)
05287 GOTO 700
05288 621  EWTI = RWORK(LEWT+I-1)
05289 MSG = 'DLSODA-  EWT(I1) is R1 .le. 0.0         '
05290 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 40, 21, 0, 1, I, 0, 1, EWTI, 0.0D0)
05291 GOTO 700
05292 622  MSG='DLSODA-  TOUT(=R1) too close to T(=R2) to start integration.'
05293 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 22, 0, 0, 0, 0, 2, TOUT, T)
05294 GOTO 700
05295 623  MSG='DLSODA-  ITASK = I1 and TOUT (=R1) behind TCUR - HU (= R2)  '
05296 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 23, 0, 1, ITASK, 0, 2, TOUT, TP)
05297 GOTO 700
05298 624  MSG='DLSODA-  ITASK = 4 or 5 and TCRIT (=R1) behind TCUR (=R2)   '
05299 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 24, 0, 0, 0, 0, 2, TCRIT, TN)
05300 GOTO 700
05301 625  MSG='DLSODA-  ITASK = 4 or 5 and TCRIT (=R1) behind TOUT (=R2)   '
05302 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 25, 0, 0, 0, 0, 2, TCRIT, TOUT)
05303 GOTO 700
05304 626  MSG = 'DLSODA-  At start of problem, too much accuracy   '
05305 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 26, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
05306 MSG='      requested for precision of machine..  See TOLSF (=R1) '
05307 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 26, 0, 0, 0, 0, 1, TOLSF, 0.0D0)
05308 RWORK(14) = TOLSF
05309 GOTO 700
05310 627  MSG = 'DLSODA-  Trouble in DINTDY.  ITASK = I1, TOUT = R1'
05311 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 27, 0, 1, ITASK, 0, 1, TOUT, 0.0D0)
05312 GOTO 700
05313 628  MSG = 'DLSODA-  MXORDN (=I1) .lt. 0  '
05314 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 28, 0, 1, MXORDN, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
05315 GOTO 700
05316 629  MSG = 'DLSODA-  MXORDS (=I1) .lt. 0  '
05317 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 29, 0, 1, MXORDS, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
05318 !
05319 700  ISTATE = -3
05320 RETURN
05321 !
05322 800  MSG = 'DLSODA-  Run aborted.. apparent infinite loop.    '
05323 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 303, 2, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
05324 RETURN
05325 !----------------------- End of Subroutine DLSODA ----------------------
05326 END
05327 
05328 SUBROUTINE DLSODAR (F, NEQ, Y, T, TOUT, ITOL, RTOL, ATOL, ITASK, ISTATE, IOPT, RWORK, LRW, IWORK, LIW, JAC, JT, G, NG, JROOT)
05329 EXTERNAL F, JAC, G
05330 INTEGER NEQ, ITOL, ITASK, ISTATE, IOPT, LRW, IWORK, LIW, JT, NG, JROOT
05331 DOUBLE PRECISION Y, T, TOUT, RTOL, ATOL, RWORK
05332 DIMENSION NEQ(*), Y(*), RTOL(*), ATOL(*), RWORK(LRW), IWORK(LIW), JROOT(NG)
05333 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
05334 ! This is the 12 November 2003 version of
05335 ! DLSODAR: Livermore Solver for Ordinary Differential Equations, with
05336 !          Automatic method switching for stiff and nonstiff problems,
05337 !          and with Root-finding.
05338 !
05339 ! This version is in double precision.
05340 !
05341 ! DLSODAR solves the initial value problem for stiff or nonstiff
05342 ! systems of first order ODEs,
05343 !     dy/dt = f(t,y) ,  or, in component form,
05344 !     dy(i)/dt = f(i) = f(i,t,y(1),y(2),...,y(NEQ)) (i = 1,...,NEQ).
05345 ! At the same time, it locates the roots of any of a set of functions
05346 !     g(i) = g(i,t,y(1),...,y(NEQ))  (i = 1,...,ng).
05347 !
05348 ! This a variant version of the DLSODE package.  It differs from it
05349 ! in two ways:
05350 ! (a) It switches automatically between stiff and nonstiff methods.
05351 ! This means that the user does not have to determine whether the
05352 ! problem is stiff or not, and the solver will automatically choose the
05353 ! appropriate method.  It always starts with the nonstiff method.
05354 ! (b) It finds the root of at least one of a set of constraint
05355 ! functions g(i) of the independent and dependent variables.
05356 ! It finds only those roots for which some g(i), as a function
05357 ! of t, changes sign in the interval of integration.
05358 ! It then returns the solution at the root, if that occurs
05359 ! sooner than the specified stop condition, and otherwise returns
05360 ! the solution according the specified stop condition.
05361 !
05362 ! Authors:       Alan C. Hindmarsh,
05363 !                Center for Applied Scientific Computing, L-561
05364 !                Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory
05365 !                Livermore, CA 94551
05366 ! and
05367 !                Linda R. Petzold
05368 !                Univ. of California at Santa Barbara
05369 !                Dept. of Computer Science
05370 !                Santa Barbara, CA 93106
05371 !
05372 ! References:
05373 ! 1.  Alan C. Hindmarsh,  ODEPACK, A Systematized Collection of ODE
05374 !     Solvers, in Scientific Computing, R. S. Stepleman et al. (Eds.),
05375 !     North-Holland, Amsterdam, 1983, pp. 55-64.
05376 ! 2.  Linda R. Petzold, Automatic Selection of Methods for Solving
05377 !     Stiff and Nonstiff Systems of Ordinary Differential Equations,
05378 !     Siam J. Sci. Stat. Comput. 4 (1983), pp. 136-148.
05379 ! 3.  Kathie L. Hiebert and Lawrence F. Shampine, Implicitly Defined
05380 !     Output Points for Solutions of ODEs, Sandia Report SAND80-0180,
05381 !     February 1980.
05382 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
05383 ! Summary of Usage.
05384 !
05385 ! Communication between the user and the DLSODAR package, for normal
05386 ! situations, is summarized here.  This summary describes only a subset
05387 ! of the full set of options available.  See the full description for
05388 ! details, including alternative treatment of the Jacobian matrix,
05389 ! optional inputs and outputs, nonstandard options, and
05390 ! instructions for special situations.  See also the example
05391 ! problem (with program and output) following this summary.
05392 !
05393 ! A. First provide a subroutine of the form:
05394 !               SUBROUTINE F (NEQ, T, Y, YDOT)
05395 !               DOUBLE PRECISION T, Y(*), YDOT(*)
05396 ! which supplies the vector function f by loading YDOT(i) with f(i).
05397 !
05398 ! B. Provide a subroutine of the form:
05399 !               SUBROUTINE G (NEQ, T, Y, NG, GOUT)
05400 !               DOUBLE PRECISION T, Y(*), GOUT(NG)
05401 ! which supplies the vector function g by loading GOUT(i) with
05402 ! g(i), the i-th constraint function whose root is sought.
05403 !
05404 ! C. Write a main program which calls Subroutine DLSODAR once for
05405 ! each point at which answers are desired.  This should also provide
05406 ! for possible use of logical unit 6 for output of error messages by
05407 ! DLSODAR.  On the first call to DLSODAR, supply arguments as follows:
05408 ! F      = name of subroutine for right-hand side vector f.
05409 !          This name must be declared External in calling program.
05410 ! NEQ    = number of first order ODEs.
05411 ! Y      = array of initial values, of length NEQ.
05412 ! T      = the initial value of the independent variable.
05413 ! TOUT   = first point where output is desired (.ne. T).
05414 ! ITOL   = 1 or 2 according as ATOL (below) is a scalar or array.
05415 ! RTOL   = relative tolerance parameter (scalar).
05416 ! ATOL   = absolute tolerance parameter (scalar or array).
05417 !          the estimated local error in y(i) will be controlled so as
05418 !          to be less than
05419 !             EWT(i) = RTOL*ABS(Y(i)) + ATOL     if ITOL = 1, or
05420 !             EWT(i) = RTOL*ABS(Y(i)) + ATOL(i)  if ITOL = 2.
05421 !          Thus the local error test passes if, in each component,
05422 !          either the absolute error is less than ATOL (or ATOL(i)),
05423 !          or the relative error is less than RTOL.
05424 !          Use RTOL = 0.0 for pure absolute error control, and
05425 !          use ATOL = 0.0 (or ATOL(i) = 0.0) for pure relative error
05426 !          control.  Caution: actual (global) errors may exceed these
05427 !          local tolerances, so choose them conservatively.
05428 ! ITASK  = 1 for normal computation of output values of y at t = TOUT.
05429 ! ISTATE = integer flag (input and output).  Set ISTATE = 1.
05430 ! IOPT   = 0 to indicate no optional inputs used.
05431 ! RWORK  = real work array of length at least:
05432 !             22 + NEQ * MAX(16, NEQ + 9) + 3*NG.
05433 !          See also Paragraph F below.
05434 ! LRW    = declared length of RWORK (in user's dimension).
05435 ! IWORK  = integer work array of length at least  20 + NEQ.
05436 ! LIW    = declared length of IWORK (in user's dimension).
05437 ! JAC    = name of subroutine for Jacobian matrix.
05438 !          Use a dummy name.  See also Paragraph F below.
05439 ! JT     = Jacobian type indicator.  Set JT = 2.
05440 !          See also Paragraph F below.
05441 ! G      = name of subroutine for constraint functions, whose
05442 !          roots are desired during the integration.
05443 !          This name must be declared External in calling program.
05444 ! NG     = number of constraint functions g(i).  If there are none,
05445 !          set NG = 0, and pass a dummy name for G.
05446 ! JROOT  = integer array of length NG for output of root information.
05447 !          See next paragraph.
05448 ! Note that the main program must declare arrays Y, RWORK, IWORK,
05449 ! JROOT, and possibly ATOL.
05450 !
05451 ! D. The output from the first call (or any call) is:
05452 !      Y = array of computed values of y(t) vector.
05453 !      T = corresponding value of independent variable.  This is
05454 !          TOUT if ISTATE = 2, or the root location if ISTATE = 3,
05455 !          or the farthest point reached if DLSODAR was unsuccessful.
05456 ! ISTATE = 2 or 3  if DLSODAR was successful, negative otherwise.
05457 !           2 means no root was found, and TOUT was reached as desired.
05458 !           3 means a root was found prior to reaching TOUT.
05459 !          -1 means excess work done on this call (perhaps wrong JT).
05460 !          -2 means excess accuracy requested (tolerances too small).
05461 !          -3 means illegal input detected (see printed message).
05462 !          -4 means repeated error test failures (check all inputs).
05463 !          -5 means repeated convergence failures (perhaps bad Jacobian
05464 !             supplied or wrong choice of JT or tolerances).
05465 !          -6 means error weight became zero during problem. (Solution
05466 !             component i vanished, and ATOL or ATOL(i) = 0.)
05467 !          -7 means work space insufficient to finish (see messages).
05468 ! JROOT  = array showing roots found if ISTATE = 3 on return.
05469 !          JROOT(i) = 1 if g(i) has a root at t, or 0 otherwise.
05470 !
05471 ! E. To continue the integration after a successful return, proceed
05472 ! as follows:
05473 !  (a) If ISTATE = 2 on return, reset TOUT and call DLSODAR again.
05474 !  (b) If ISTATE = 3 on return, reset ISTATE to 2, call DLSODAR again.
05475 ! In either case, no other parameters need be reset.
05476 !
05477 ! F. Note: If and when DLSODAR regards the problem as stiff, and
05478 ! switches methods accordingly, it must make use of the NEQ by NEQ
05479 ! Jacobian matrix, J = df/dy.  For the sake of simplicity, the
05480 ! inputs to DLSODAR recommended in Paragraph C above cause DLSODAR to
05481 ! treat J as a full matrix, and to approximate it internally by
05482 ! difference quotients.  Alternatively, J can be treated as a band
05483 ! matrix (with great potential reduction in the size of the RWORK
05484 ! array).  Also, in either the full or banded case, the user can supply
05485 ! J in closed form, with a routine whose name is passed as the JAC
05486 ! argument.  These alternatives are described in the paragraphs on
05487 ! RWORK, JAC, and JT in the full description of the call sequence below.
05488 !
05489 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
05490 ! Example Problem.
05491 !
05492 ! The following is a simple example problem, with the coding
05493 ! needed for its solution by DLSODAR.  The problem is from chemical
05494 ! kinetics, and consists of the following three rate equations:
05495 !     dy1/dt = -.04*y1 + 1.e4*y2*y3
05496 !     dy2/dt = .04*y1 - 1.e4*y2*y3 - 3.e7*y2**2
05497 !     dy3/dt = 3.e7*y2**2
05498 ! on the interval from t = 0.0 to t = 4.e10, with initial conditions
05499 ! y1 = 1.0, y2 = y3 = 0.  The problem is stiff.
05500 ! In addition, we want to find the values of t, y1, y2, and y3 at which
05501 !   (1) y1 reaches the value 1.e-4, and
05502 !   (2) y3 reaches the value 1.e-2.
05503 !
05504 ! The following coding solves this problem with DLSODAR,
05505 ! printing results at t = .4, 4., ..., 4.e10, and at the computed
05506 ! roots.  It uses ITOL = 2 and ATOL much smaller for y2 than y1 or y3
05507 ! because y2 has much smaller values.
05508 ! At the end of the run, statistical quantities of interest are
05509 ! printed (see optional outputs in the full description below).
05510 !
05511 !     EXTERNAL FEX, GEX
05512 !     DOUBLE PRECISION ATOL, RTOL, RWORK, T, TOUT, Y
05513 !     DIMENSION Y(3), ATOL(3), RWORK(76), IWORK(23), JROOT(2)
05514 !     NEQ = 3
05515 !     Y(1) = 1.
05516 !     Y(2) = 0.
05517 !     Y(3) = 0.
05518 !     T = 0.
05519 !     TOUT = .4
05520 !     ITOL = 2
05521 !     RTOL = 1.D-4
05522 !     ATOL(1) = 1.D-6
05523 !     ATOL(2) = 1.D-10
05524 !     ATOL(3) = 1.D-6
05525 !     ITASK = 1
05526 !     ISTATE = 1
05527 !     IOPT = 0
05528 !     LRW = 76
05529 !     LIW = 23
05530 !     JT = 2
05531 !     NG = 2
05532 !     DO 40 IOUT = 1,12
05533 ! 10    CALL DLSODAR(FEX,NEQ,Y,T,TOUT,ITOL,RTOL,ATOL,ITASK,ISTATE,
05534 !    1     IOPT,RWORK,LRW,IWORK,LIW,JDUM,JT,GEX,NG,JROOT)
05535 !       WRITE(6,20)T,Y(1),Y(2),Y(3)
05536 ! 20    FORMAT(' At t =',D12.4,'   Y =',3D14.6)
05537 !       IF (ISTATE .LT. 0) GOTO 80
05538 !       IF (ISTATE .EQ. 2) GOTO 40
05539 !       WRITE(6,30)JROOT(1),JROOT(2)
05540 ! 30    FORMAT(5X,' The above line is a root,  JROOT =',2I5)
05541 !       ISTATE = 2
05542 !       GOTO 10
05543 ! 40    TOUT = TOUT*10.
05544 !     WRITE(6,60)IWORK(11),IWORK(12),IWORK(13),IWORK(10),
05545 !    1   IWORK(19),RWORK(15)
05546 ! 60  FORMAT(/' No. steps =',I4,'  No. f-s =',I4,'  No. J-s =',I4,
05547 !    1   '  No. g-s =',I4/
05548 !    2   ' Method last used =',I2,'   Last switch was at t =',D12.4)
05549 !     STOP
05550 ! 80  WRITE(6,90)ISTATE
05551 ! 90  FORMAT(///' Error halt.. ISTATE =',I3)
05552 !     STOP
05553 !     END
05554 !
05555 !     SUBROUTINE FEX (NEQ, T, Y, YDOT)
05556 !     DOUBLE PRECISION T, Y, YDOT
05557 !     DIMENSION Y(3), YDOT(3)
05558 !     YDOT(1) = -.04*Y(1) + 1.D4*Y(2)*Y(3)
05559 !     YDOT(3) = 3.D7*Y(2)*Y(2)
05560 !     YDOT(2) = -YDOT(1) - YDOT(3)
05561 !     RETURN
05562 !     END
05563 !
05564 !     SUBROUTINE GEX (NEQ, T, Y, NG, GOUT)
05565 !     DOUBLE PRECISION T, Y, GOUT
05566 !     DIMENSION Y(3), GOUT(2)
05567 !     GOUT(1) = Y(1) - 1.D-4
05568 !     GOUT(2) = Y(3) - 1.D-2
05569 !     RETURN
05570 !     END
05571 !
05572 ! The output of this program (on a CDC-7600 in single precision)
05573 ! is as follows:
05574 !
05575 !   At t =  2.6400e-01   y =  9.899653e-01  3.470563e-05  1.000000e-02
05576 !        The above line is a root,  JROOT =    0    1
05577 !   At t =  4.0000e-01   Y =  9.851712e-01  3.386380e-05  1.479493e-02
05578 !   At t =  4.0000e+00   Y =  9.055333e-01  2.240655e-05  9.444430e-02
05579 !   At t =  4.0000e+01   Y =  7.158403e-01  9.186334e-06  2.841505e-01
05580 !   At t =  4.0000e+02   Y =  4.505250e-01  3.222964e-06  5.494717e-01
05581 !   At t =  4.0000e+03   Y =  1.831975e-01  8.941774e-07  8.168016e-01
05582 !   At t =  4.0000e+04   Y =  3.898730e-02  1.621940e-07  9.610125e-01
05583 !   At t =  4.0000e+05   Y =  4.936363e-03  1.984221e-08  9.950636e-01
05584 !   At t =  4.0000e+06   Y =  5.161831e-04  2.065786e-09  9.994838e-01
05585 !   At t =  2.0745e+07   Y =  1.000000e-04  4.000395e-10  9.999000e-01
05586 !        The above line is a root,  JROOT =    1    0
05587 !   At t =  4.0000e+07   Y =  5.179817e-05  2.072032e-10  9.999482e-01
05588 !   At t =  4.0000e+08   Y =  5.283401e-06  2.113371e-11  9.999947e-01
05589 !   At t =  4.0000e+09   Y =  4.659031e-07  1.863613e-12  9.999995e-01
05590 !   At t =  4.0000e+10   Y =  1.404280e-08  5.617126e-14  1.000000e+00
05591 !
05592 !   No. steps = 361  No. f-s = 693  No. J-s =  64  No. g-s = 390
05593 !   Method last used = 2   Last switch was at t =  6.0092e-03
05594 !
05595 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
05596 ! Full Description of User Interface to DLSODAR.
05597 !
05598 ! The user interface to DLSODAR consists of the following parts.
05599 !
05600 ! 1.   The call sequence to Subroutine DLSODAR, which is a driver
05601 !      routine for the solver.  This includes descriptions of both
05602 !      the call sequence arguments and of user-supplied routines.
05603 !      Following these descriptions is a description of
05604 !      optional inputs available through the call sequence, and then
05605 !      a description of optional outputs (in the work arrays).
05606 !
05607 ! 2.   Descriptions of other routines in the DLSODAR package that may be
05608 !      (optionally) called by the user.  These provide the ability to
05609 !      alter error message handling, save and restore the internal
05610 !      Common, and obtain specified derivatives of the solution y(t).
05611 !
05612 ! 3.   Descriptions of Common blocks to be declared in overlay
05613 !      or similar environments, or to be saved when doing an interrupt
05614 !      of the problem and continued solution later.
05615 !
05616 ! 4.   Description of a subroutine in the DLSODAR package,
05617 !      which the user may replace with his/her own version, if desired.
05618 !      this relates to the measurement of errors.
05619 !
05620 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
05621 ! Part 1.  Call Sequence.
05622 !
05623 ! The call sequence parameters used for input only are
05624 !     F, NEQ, TOUT, ITOL, RTOL, ATOL, ITASK, IOPT, LRW, LIW, JAC,
05625 !     JT, G, and NG,
05626 ! that used only for output is  JROOT,
05627 ! and those used for both input and output are
05628 !     Y, T, ISTATE.
05629 ! The work arrays RWORK and IWORK are also used for conditional and
05630 ! optional inputs and optional outputs.  (The term output here refers
05631 ! to the return from Subroutine DLSODAR to the user's calling program.)
05632 !
05633 ! The legality of input parameters will be thoroughly checked on the
05634 ! initial call for the problem, but not checked thereafter unless a
05635 ! change in input parameters is flagged by ISTATE = 3 on input.
05636 !
05637 ! The descriptions of the call arguments are as follows.
05638 !
05639 ! F      = the name of the user-supplied subroutine defining the
05640 !          ODE system.  The system must be put in the first-order
05641 !          form dy/dt = f(t,y), where f is a vector-valued function
05642 !          of the scalar t and the vector y.  Subroutine F is to
05643 !          compute the function f.  It is to have the form
05644 !               SUBROUTINE F (NEQ, T, Y, YDOT)
05645 !               DOUBLE PRECISION T, Y(*), YDOT(*)
05646 !          where NEQ, T, and Y are input, and the array YDOT = f(t,y)
05647 !          is output.  Y and YDOT are arrays of length NEQ.
05648 !          Subroutine F should not alter Y(1),...,Y(NEQ).
05649 !          F must be declared External in the calling program.
05650 !
05651 !          Subroutine F may access user-defined quantities in
05652 !          NEQ(2),... and/or in Y(NEQ(1)+1),... if NEQ is an array
05653 !          (dimensioned in F) and/or Y has length exceeding NEQ(1).
05654 !          See the descriptions of NEQ and Y below.
05655 !
05656 !          If quantities computed in the F routine are needed
05657 !          externally to DLSODAR, an extra call to F should be made
05658 !          for this purpose, for consistent and accurate results.
05659 !          If only the derivative dy/dt is needed, use DINTDY instead.
05660 !
05661 ! NEQ    = the size of the ODE system (number of first order
05662 !          ordinary differential equations).  Used only for input.
05663 !          NEQ may be decreased, but not increased, during the problem.
05664 !          If NEQ is decreased (with ISTATE = 3 on input), the
05665 !          remaining components of Y should be left undisturbed, if
05666 !          these are to be accessed in F and/or JAC.
05667 !
05668 !          Normally, NEQ is a scalar, and it is generally referred to
05669 !          as a scalar in this user interface description.  However,
05670 !          NEQ may be an array, with NEQ(1) set to the system size.
05671 !          (The DLSODAR package accesses only NEQ(1).)  In either case,
05672 !          this parameter is passed as the NEQ argument in all calls
05673 !          to F, JAC, and G.  Hence, if it is an array, locations
05674 !          NEQ(2),... may be used to store other integer data and pass
05675 !          it to F, JAC, and G.  Each such subroutine must include
05676 !          NEQ in a Dimension statement in that case.
05677 !
05678 ! Y      = a real array for the vector of dependent variables, of
05679 !          length NEQ or more.  Used for both input and output on the
05680 !          first call (ISTATE = 1), and only for output on other calls.
05681 !          On the first call, Y must contain the vector of initial
05682 !          values.  On output, Y contains the computed solution vector,
05683 !          evaluated at T.  If desired, the Y array may be used
05684 !          for other purposes between calls to the solver.
05685 !
05686 !          This array is passed as the Y argument in all calls to F,
05687 !          JAC, and G.  Hence its length may exceed NEQ, and locations
05688 !          Y(NEQ+1),... may be used to store other real data and
05689 !          pass it to F, JAC, and G.  (The DLSODAR package accesses only
05690 !          Y(1),...,Y(NEQ).)
05691 !
05692 ! T      = the independent variable.  On input, T is used only on the
05693 !          first call, as the initial point of the integration.
05694 !          On output, after each call, T is the value at which a
05695 !          computed solution y is evaluated (usually the same as TOUT).
05696 !          If a root was found, T is the computed location of the
05697 !          root reached first, on output.
05698 !          On an error return, T is the farthest point reached.
05699 !
05700 ! TOUT   = the next value of t at which a computed solution is desired.
05701 !          Used only for input.
05702 !
05703 !          When starting the problem (ISTATE = 1), TOUT may be equal
05704 !          to T for one call, then should .ne. T for the next call.
05705 !          For the initial T, an input value of TOUT .ne. T is used
05706 !          in order to determine the direction of the integration
05707 !          (i.e. the algebraic sign of the step sizes) and the rough
05708 !          scale of the problem.  Integration in either direction
05709 !          (forward or backward in t) is permitted.
05710 !
05711 !          If ITASK = 2 or 5 (one-step modes), TOUT is ignored after
05712 !          the first call (i.e. the first call with TOUT .ne. T).
05713 !          Otherwise, TOUT is required on every call.
05714 !
05715 !          If ITASK = 1, 3, or 4, the values of TOUT need not be
05716 !          monotone, but a value of TOUT which backs up is limited
05717 !          to the current internal T interval, whose endpoints are
05718 !          TCUR - HU and TCUR (see optional outputs, below, for
05719 !          TCUR and HU).
05720 !
05721 ! ITOL   = an indicator for the type of error control.  See
05722 !          description below under ATOL.  Used only for input.
05723 !
05724 ! RTOL   = a relative error tolerance parameter, either a scalar or
05725 !          an array of length NEQ.  See description below under ATOL.
05726 !          Input only.
05727 !
05728 ! ATOL   = an absolute error tolerance parameter, either a scalar or
05729 !          an array of length NEQ.  Input only.
05730 !
05731 !             The input parameters ITOL, RTOL, and ATOL determine
05732 !          the error control performed by the solver.  The solver will
05733 !          control the vector E = (E(i)) of estimated local errors
05734 !          in y, according to an inequality of the form
05735 !                      max-norm of ( E(i)/EWT(i) )   .le.   1,
05736 !          where EWT = (EWT(i)) is a vector of positive error weights.
05737 !          The values of RTOL and ATOL should all be non-negative.
05738 !          The following table gives the types (scalar/array) of
05739 !          RTOL and ATOL, and the corresponding form of EWT(i).
05740 !
05741 !             ITOL    RTOL       ATOL          EWT(i)
05742 !              1     scalar     scalar     RTOL*ABS(Y(i)) + ATOL
05743 !              2     scalar     array      RTOL*ABS(Y(i)) + ATOL(i)
05744 !              3     array      scalar     RTOL(i)*ABS(Y(i)) + ATOL
05745 !              4     array      array      RTOL(i)*ABS(Y(i)) + ATOL(i)
05746 !
05747 !          When either of these parameters is a scalar, it need not
05748 !          be dimensioned in the user's calling program.
05749 !
05750 !          If none of the above choices (with ITOL, RTOL, and ATOL
05751 !          fixed throughout the problem) is suitable, more general
05752 !          error controls can be obtained by substituting a
05753 !          user-supplied routine for the setting of EWT.
05754 !          See Part 4 below.
05755 !
05756 !          If global errors are to be estimated by making a repeated
05757 !          run on the same problem with smaller tolerances, then all
05758 !          components of RTOL and ATOL (i.e. of EWT) should be scaled
05759 !          down uniformly.
05760 !
05761 ! ITASK  = an index specifying the task to be performed.
05762 !          input only.  ITASK has the following values and meanings.
05763 !          1  means normal computation of output values of y(t) at
05764 !             t = TOUT (by overshooting and interpolating).
05765 !          2  means take one step only and return.
05766 !          3  means stop at the first internal mesh point at or
05767 !             beyond t = TOUT and return.
05768 !          4  means normal computation of output values of y(t) at
05769 !             t = TOUT but without overshooting t = TCRIT.
05770 !             TCRIT must be input as RWORK(1).  TCRIT may be equal to
05771 !             or beyond TOUT, but not behind it in the direction of
05772 !             integration.  This option is useful if the problem
05773 !             has a singularity at or beyond t = TCRIT.
05774 !          5  means take one step, without passing TCRIT, and return.
05775 !             TCRIT must be input as RWORK(1).
05776 !
05777 !          Note:  If ITASK = 4 or 5 and the solver reaches TCRIT
05778 !          (within roundoff), it will return T = TCRIT (exactly) to
05779 !          indicate this (unless ITASK = 4 and TOUT comes before TCRIT,
05780 !          in which case answers at t = TOUT are returned first).
05781 !
05782 ! ISTATE = an index used for input and output to specify the
05783 !          the state of the calculation.
05784 !
05785 !          On input, the values of ISTATE are as follows.
05786 !          1  means this is the first call for the problem
05787 !             (initializations will be done).  See note below.
05788 !          2  means this is not the first call, and the calculation
05789 !             is to continue normally, with no change in any input
05790 !             parameters except possibly TOUT and ITASK.
05791 !             (If ITOL, RTOL, and/or ATOL are changed between calls
05792 !             with ISTATE = 2, the new values will be used but not
05793 !             tested for legality.)
05794 !          3  means this is not the first call, and the
05795 !             calculation is to continue normally, but with
05796 !             a change in input parameters other than
05797 !             TOUT and ITASK.  Changes are allowed in
05798 !             NEQ, ITOL, RTOL, ATOL, IOPT, LRW, LIW, JT, ML, MU,
05799 !             and any optional inputs except H0, MXORDN, and MXORDS.
05800 !             (See IWORK description for ML and MU.)
05801 !             In addition, immediately following a return with
05802 !             ISTATE = 3 (root found), NG and G may be changed.
05803 !             (But changing NG from 0 to .gt. 0 is not allowed.)
05804 !          Note:  A preliminary call with TOUT = T is not counted
05805 !          as a first call here, as no initialization or checking of
05806 !          input is done.  (Such a call is sometimes useful for the
05807 !          purpose of outputting the initial conditions.)
05808 !          Thus the first call for which TOUT .ne. T requires
05809 !          ISTATE = 1 on input.
05810 !
05811 !          On output, ISTATE has the following values and meanings.
05812 !           1  means nothing was done; TOUT = t and ISTATE = 1 on input.
05813 !           2  means the integration was performed successfully, and
05814 !              no roots were found.
05815 !           3  means the integration was successful, and one or more
05816 !              roots were found before satisfying the stop condition
05817 !              specified by ITASK.  See JROOT.
05818 !          -1  means an excessive amount of work (more than MXSTEP
05819 !              steps) was done on this call, before completing the
05820 !              requested task, but the integration was otherwise
05821 !              successful as far as T.  (MXSTEP is an optional input
05822 !              and is normally 500.)  To continue, the user may
05823 !              simply reset ISTATE to a value .gt. 1 and call again
05824 !              (the excess work step counter will be reset to 0).
05825 !              In addition, the user may increase MXSTEP to avoid
05826 !              this error return (see below on optional inputs).
05827 !          -2  means too much accuracy was requested for the precision
05828 !              of the machine being used.  This was detected before
05829 !              completing the requested task, but the integration
05830 !              was successful as far as T.  To continue, the tolerance
05831 !              parameters must be reset, and ISTATE must be set
05832 !              to 3.  The optional output TOLSF may be used for this
05833 !              purpose.  (Note: If this condition is detected before
05834 !              taking any steps, then an illegal input return
05835 !              (ISTATE = -3) occurs instead.)
05836 !          -3  means illegal input was detected, before taking any
05837 !              integration steps.  See written message for details.
05838 !              Note:  If the solver detects an infinite loop of calls
05839 !              to the solver with illegal input, it will cause
05840 !              the run to stop.
05841 !          -4  means there were repeated error test failures on
05842 !              one attempted step, before completing the requested
05843 !              task, but the integration was successful as far as T.
05844 !              The problem may have a singularity, or the input
05845 !              may be inappropriate.
05846 !          -5  means there were repeated convergence test failures on
05847 !              one attempted step, before completing the requested
05848 !              task, but the integration was successful as far as T.
05849 !              This may be caused by an inaccurate Jacobian matrix,
05850 !              if one is being used.
05851 !          -6  means EWT(i) became zero for some i during the
05852 !              integration.  Pure relative error control (ATOL(i)=0.0)
05853 !              was requested on a variable which has now vanished.
05854 !              The integration was successful as far as T.
05855 !          -7  means the length of RWORK and/or IWORK was too small to
05856 !              proceed, but the integration was successful as far as T.
05857 !              This happens when DLSODAR chooses to switch methods
05858 !              but LRW and/or LIW is too small for the new method.
05859 !
05860 !          Note:  Since the normal output value of ISTATE is 2,
05861 !          it does not need to be reset for normal continuation.
05862 !          Also, since a negative input value of ISTATE will be
05863 !          regarded as illegal, a negative output value requires the
05864 !          user to change it, and possibly other inputs, before
05865 !          calling the solver again.
05866 !
05867 ! IOPT   = an integer flag to specify whether or not any optional
05868 !          inputs are being used on this call.  Input only.
05869 !          The optional inputs are listed separately below.
05870 !          IOPT = 0 means no optional inputs are being used.
05871 !                   Default values will be used in all cases.
05872 !          IOPT = 1 means one or more optional inputs are being used.
05873 !
05874 ! RWORK  = a real array (double precision) for work space, and (in the
05875 !          first 20 words) for conditional and optional inputs and
05876 !          optional outputs.
05877 !          As DLSODAR switches automatically between stiff and nonstiff
05878 !          methods, the required length of RWORK can change during the
05879 !          problem.  Thus the RWORK array passed to DLSODAR can either
05880 !          have a static (fixed) length large enough for both methods,
05881 !          or have a dynamic (changing) length altered by the calling
05882 !          program in response to output from DLSODAR.
05883 !
05884 !                       --- Fixed Length Case ---
05885 !          If the RWORK length is to be fixed, it should be at least
05886 !               max (LRN, LRS),
05887 !          where LRN and LRS are the RWORK lengths required when the
05888 !          current method is nonstiff or stiff, respectively.
05889 !
05890 !          The separate RWORK length requirements LRN and LRS are
05891 !          as follows:
05892 !          If NEQ is constant and the maximum method orders have
05893 !          their default values, then
05894 !             LRN = 20 + 16*NEQ + 3*NG,
05895 !             LRS = 22 + 9*NEQ + NEQ**2 + 3*NG           (JT = 1 or 2),
05896 !             LRS = 22 + 10*NEQ + (2*ML+MU)*NEQ + 3*NG   (JT = 4 or 5).
05897 !          Under any other conditions, LRN and LRS are given by:
05898 !             LRN = 20 + NYH*(MXORDN+1) + 3*NEQ + 3*NG,
05899 !             LRS = 20 + NYH*(MXORDS+1) + 3*NEQ + LMAT + 3*NG,
05900 !          where
05901 !             NYH    = the initial value of NEQ,
05902 !             MXORDN = 12, unless a smaller value is given as an
05903 !                      optional input,
05904 !             MXORDS = 5, unless a smaller value is given as an
05905 !                      optional input,
05906 !             LMAT   = length of matrix work space:
05907 !             LMAT   = NEQ**2 + 2              if JT = 1 or 2,
05908 !             LMAT   = (2*ML + MU + 1)*NEQ + 2 if JT = 4 or 5.
05909 !
05910 !                       --- Dynamic Length Case ---
05911 !          If the length of RWORK is to be dynamic, then it should
05912 !          be at least LRN or LRS, as defined above, depending on the
05913 !          current method.  Initially, it must be at least LRN (since
05914 !          DLSODAR starts with the nonstiff method).  On any return
05915 !          from DLSODAR, the optional output MCUR indicates the current
05916 !          method.  If MCUR differs from the value it had on the
05917 !          previous return, or if there has only been one call to
05918 !          DLSODAR and MCUR is now 2, then DLSODAR has switched
05919 !          methods during the last call, and the length of RWORK
05920 !          should be reset (to LRN if MCUR = 1, or to LRS if
05921 !          MCUR = 2).  (An increase in the RWORK length is required
05922 !          if DLSODAR returned ISTATE = -7, but not otherwise.)
05923 !          After resetting the length, call DLSODAR with ISTATE = 3
05924 !          to signal that change.
05925 !
05926 ! LRW    = the length of the array RWORK, as declared by the user.
05927 !          (This will be checked by the solver.)
05928 !
05929 ! IWORK  = an integer array for work space.
05930 !          As DLSODAR switches automatically between stiff and nonstiff
05931 !          methods, the required length of IWORK can change during
05932 !          problem, between
05933 !             LIS = 20 + NEQ   and   LIN = 20,
05934 !          respectively.  Thus the IWORK array passed to DLSODAR can
05935 !          either have a fixed length of at least 20 + NEQ, or have a
05936 !          dynamic length of at least LIN or LIS, depending on the
05937 !          current method.  The comments on dynamic length under
05938 !          RWORK above apply here.  Initially, this length need
05939 !          only be at least LIN = 20.
05940 !
05941 !          The first few words of IWORK are used for conditional and
05942 !          optional inputs and optional outputs.
05943 !
05944 !          The following 2 words in IWORK are conditional inputs:
05945 !            IWORK(1) = ML     These are the lower and upper
05946 !            IWORK(2) = MU     half-bandwidths, respectively, of the
05947 !                       banded Jacobian, excluding the main diagonal.
05948 !                       The band is defined by the matrix locations
05949 !                       (i,j) with i-ML .le. j .le. i+MU.  ML and MU
05950 !                       must satisfy  0 .le.  ML,MU  .le. NEQ-1.
05951 !                       These are required if JT is 4 or 5, and
05952 !                       ignored otherwise.  ML and MU may in fact be
05953 !                       the band parameters for a matrix to which
05954 !                       df/dy is only approximately equal.
05955 !
05956 ! LIW    = the length of the array IWORK, as declared by the user.
05957 !          (This will be checked by the solver.)
05958 !
05959 ! Note: The base addresses of the work arrays must not be
05960 ! altered between calls to DLSODAR for the same problem.
05961 ! The contents of the work arrays must not be altered
05962 ! between calls, except possibly for the conditional and
05963 ! optional inputs, and except for the last 3*NEQ words of RWORK.
05964 ! The latter space is used for internal scratch space, and so is
05965 ! available for use by the user outside DLSODAR between calls, if
05966 ! desired (but not for use by F, JAC, or G).
05967 !
05968 ! JAC    = the name of the user-supplied routine to compute the
05969 !          Jacobian matrix, df/dy, if JT = 1 or 4.  The JAC routine
05970 !          is optional, but if the problem is expected to be stiff much
05971 !          of the time, you are encouraged to supply JAC, for the sake
05972 !          of efficiency.  (Alternatively, set JT = 2 or 5 to have
05973 !          DLSODAR compute df/dy internally by difference quotients.)
05974 !          If and when DLSODAR uses df/dy, it treats this NEQ by NEQ
05975 !          matrix either as full (JT = 1 or 2), or as banded (JT =
05976 !          4 or 5) with half-bandwidths ML and MU (discussed under
05977 !          IWORK above).  In either case, if JT = 1 or 4, the JAC
05978 !          routine must compute df/dy as a function of the scalar t
05979 !          and the vector y.  It is to have the form
05980 !               SUBROUTINE JAC (NEQ, T, Y, ML, MU, PD, NROWPD)
05981 !               DOUBLE PRECISION T, Y(*), PD(NROWPD,*)
05982 !          where NEQ, T, Y, ML, MU, and NROWPD are input and the array
05983 !          PD is to be loaded with partial derivatives (elements of
05984 !          the Jacobian matrix) on output.  PD must be given a first
05985 !          dimension of NROWPD.  T and Y have the same meaning as in
05986 !          Subroutine F.
05987 !               In the full matrix case (JT = 1), ML and MU are
05988 !          ignored, and the Jacobian is to be loaded into PD in
05989 !          columnwise manner, with df(i)/dy(j) loaded into pd(i,j).
05990 !               In the band matrix case (JT = 4), the elements
05991 !          within the band are to be loaded into PD in columnwise
05992 !          manner, with diagonal lines of df/dy loaded into the rows
05993 !          of PD.  Thus df(i)/dy(j) is to be loaded into PD(i-j+MU+1,j).
05994 !          ML and MU are the half-bandwidth parameters (see IWORK).
05995 !          The locations in PD in the two triangular areas which
05996 !          correspond to nonexistent matrix elements can be ignored
