05997 !          or loaded arbitrarily, as they are overwritten by DLSODAR.
05998 !               JAC need not provide df/dy exactly.  A crude
05999 !          approximation (possibly with a smaller bandwidth) will do.
06000 !               In either case, PD is preset to zero by the solver,
06001 !          so that only the nonzero elements need be loaded by JAC.
06002 !          Each call to JAC is preceded by a call to F with the same
06003 !          arguments NEQ, T, and Y.  Thus to gain some efficiency,
06004 !          intermediate quantities shared by both calculations may be
06005 !          saved in a user Common block by F and not recomputed by JAC,
06006 !          if desired.  Also, JAC may alter the Y array, if desired.
06007 !          JAC must be declared External in the calling program.
06008 !               Subroutine JAC may access user-defined quantities in
06009 !          NEQ(2),... and/or in Y(NEQ(1)+1),... if NEQ is an array
06010 !          (dimensioned in JAC) and/or Y has length exceeding NEQ(1).
06011 !          See the descriptions of NEQ and Y above.
06012 !
06013 ! JT     = Jacobian type indicator.  Used only for input.
06014 !          JT specifies how the Jacobian matrix df/dy will be
06015 !          treated, if and when DLSODAR requires this matrix.
06016 !          JT has the following values and meanings:
06017 !           1 means a user-supplied full (NEQ by NEQ) Jacobian.
06018 !           2 means an internally generated (difference quotient) full
06019 !             Jacobian (using NEQ extra calls to F per df/dy value).
06020 !           4 means a user-supplied banded Jacobian.
06021 !           5 means an internally generated banded Jacobian (using
06022 !             ML+MU+1 extra calls to F per df/dy evaluation).
06023 !          If JT = 1 or 4, the user must supply a Subroutine JAC
06024 !          (the name is arbitrary) as described above under JAC.
06025 !          If JT = 2 or 5, a dummy argument can be used.
06026 !
06027 ! G      = the name of subroutine for constraint functions, whose
06028 !          roots are desired during the integration.  It is to have
06029 !          the form
06030 !               SUBROUTINE G (NEQ, T, Y, NG, GOUT)
06031 !               DOUBLE PRECISION T, Y(*), GOUT(NG)
06032 !          where NEQ, T, Y, and NG are input, and the array GOUT
06033 !          is output.  NEQ, T, and Y have the same meaning as in
06034 !          the F routine, and GOUT is an array of length NG.
06035 !          For i = 1,...,NG, this routine is to load into GOUT(i)
06036 !          the value at (T,Y) of the i-th constraint function g(i).
06037 !          DLSODAR will find roots of the g(i) of odd multiplicity
06038 !          (i.e. sign changes) as they occur during the integration.
06039 !          G must be declared External in the calling program.
06040 !
06041 !          Caution:  Because of numerical errors in the functions
06042 !          g(i) due to roundoff and integration error, DLSODAR may
06043 !          return false roots, or return the same root at two or more
06044 !          nearly equal values of t.  If such false roots are
06045 !          suspected, the user should consider smaller error tolerances
06046 !          and/or higher precision in the evaluation of the g(i).
06047 !
06048 !          If a root of some g(i) defines the end of the problem,
06049 !          the input to DLSODAR should nevertheless allow integration
06050 !          to a point slightly past that root, so that DLSODAR can
06051 !          locate the root by interpolation.
06052 !
06053 !          Subroutine G may access user-defined quantities in
06054 !          NEQ(2),... and Y(NEQ(1)+1),... if NEQ is an array
06055 !          (dimensioned in G) and/or Y has length exceeding NEQ(1).
06056 !          See the descriptions of NEQ and Y above.
06057 !
06058 ! NG     = number of constraint functions g(i).  If there are none,
06059 !          set NG = 0, and pass a dummy name for G.
06060 !
06061 ! JROOT  = integer array of length NG.  Used only for output.
06062 !          On a return with ISTATE = 3 (one or more roots found),
06063 !          JROOT(i) = 1 if g(i) has a root at T, or JROOT(i) = 0 if not.
06064 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
06065 ! Optional Inputs.
06066 !
06067 ! The following is a list of the optional inputs provided for in the
06068 ! call sequence.  (See also Part 2.)  For each such input variable,
06069 ! this table lists its name as used in this documentation, its
06070 ! location in the call sequence, its meaning, and the default value.
06071 ! The use of any of these inputs requires IOPT = 1, and in that
06072 ! case all of these inputs are examined.  A value of zero for any
06073 ! of these optional inputs will cause the default value to be used.
06074 ! Thus to use a subset of the optional inputs, simply preload
06075 ! locations 5 to 10 in RWORK and IWORK to 0.0 and 0 respectively, and
06076 ! then set those of interest to nonzero values.
06077 !
06078 ! Name    Location      Meaning and Default Value
06079 !
06080 ! H0      RWORK(5)  the step size to be attempted on the first step.
06081 !                   The default value is determined by the solver.
06082 !
06083 ! HMAX    RWORK(6)  the maximum absolute step size allowed.
06084 !                   The default value is infinite.
06085 !
06086 ! HMIN    RWORK(7)  the minimum absolute step size allowed.
06087 !                   The default value is 0.  (This lower bound is not
06088 !                   enforced on the final step before reaching TCRIT
06089 !                   when ITASK = 4 or 5.)
06090 !
06091 ! IXPR    IWORK(5)  flag to generate extra printing at method switches.
06092 !                   IXPR = 0 means no extra printing (the default).
06093 !                   IXPR = 1 means print data on each switch.
06094 !                   T, H, and NST will be printed on the same logical
06095 !                   unit as used for error messages.
06096 !
06097 ! MXSTEP  IWORK(6)  maximum number of (internally defined) steps
06098 !                   allowed during one call to the solver.
06099 !                   The default value is 500.
06100 !
06101 ! MXHNIL  IWORK(7)  maximum number of messages printed (per problem)
06102 !                   warning that T + H = T on a step (H = step size).
06103 !                   This must be positive to result in a non-default
06104 !                   value.  The default value is 10.
06105 !
06106 ! MXORDN  IWORK(8)  the maximum order to be allowed for the nonstiff
06107 !                   (Adams) method.  The default value is 12.
06108 !                   If MXORDN exceeds the default value, it will
06109 !                   be reduced to the default value.
06110 !                   MXORDN is held constant during the problem.
06111 !
06112 ! MXORDS  IWORK(9)  the maximum order to be allowed for the stiff
06113 !                   (BDF) method.  The default value is 5.
06114 !                   If MXORDS exceeds the default value, it will
06115 !                   be reduced to the default value.
06116 !                   MXORDS is held constant during the problem.
06117 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
06118 ! Optional Outputs.
06119 !
06120 ! As optional additional output from DLSODAR, the variables listed
06121 ! below are quantities related to the performance of DLSODAR
06122 ! which are available to the user.  These are communicated by way of
06123 ! the work arrays, but also have internal mnemonic names as shown.
06124 ! Except where stated otherwise, all of these outputs are defined
06125 ! on any successful return from DLSODAR, and on any return with
06126 ! ISTATE = -1, -2, -4, -5, or -6.  On an illegal input return
06127 ! (ISTATE = -3), they will be unchanged from their existing values
06128 ! (if any), except possibly for TOLSF, LENRW, and LENIW.
06129 ! On any error return, outputs relevant to the error will be defined,
06130 ! as noted below.
06131 !
06132 ! Name    Location      Meaning
06133 !
06134 ! HU      RWORK(11) the step size in t last used (successfully).
06135 !
06136 ! HCUR    RWORK(12) the step size to be attempted on the next step.
06137 !
06138 ! TCUR    RWORK(13) the current value of the independent variable
06139 !                   which the solver has actually reached, i.e. the
06140 !                   current internal mesh point in t.  On output, TCUR
06141 !                   will always be at least as far as the argument
06142 !                   T, but may be farther (if interpolation was done).
06143 !
06144 ! TOLSF   RWORK(14) a tolerance scale factor, greater than 1.0,
06145 !                   computed when a request for too much accuracy was
06146 !                   detected (ISTATE = -3 if detected at the start of
06147 !                   the problem, ISTATE = -2 otherwise).  If ITOL is
06148 !                   left unaltered but RTOL and ATOL are uniformly
06149 !                   scaled up by a factor of TOLSF for the next call,
06150 !                   then the solver is deemed likely to succeed.
06151 !                   (The user may also ignore TOLSF and alter the
06152 !                   tolerance parameters in any other way appropriate.)
06153 !
06154 ! TSW     RWORK(15) the value of t at the time of the last method
06155 !                   switch, if any.
06156 !
06157 ! NGE     IWORK(10) the number of g evaluations for the problem so far.
06158 !
06159 ! NST     IWORK(11) the number of steps taken for the problem so far.
06160 !
06161 ! NFE     IWORK(12) the number of f evaluations for the problem so far.
06162 !
06163 ! NJE     IWORK(13) the number of Jacobian evaluations (and of matrix
06164 !                   LU decompositions) for the problem so far.
06165 !
06166 ! NQU     IWORK(14) the method order last used (successfully).
06167 !
06168 ! NQCUR   IWORK(15) the order to be attempted on the next step.
06169 !
06170 ! IMXER   IWORK(16) the index of the component of largest magnitude in
06171 !                   the weighted local error vector ( E(i)/EWT(i) ),
06172 !                   on an error return with ISTATE = -4 or -5.
06173 !
06174 ! LENRW   IWORK(17) the length of RWORK actually required, assuming
06175 !                   that the length of RWORK is to be fixed for the
06176 !                   rest of the problem, and that switching may occur.
06177 !                   This is defined on normal returns and on an illegal
06178 !                   input return for insufficient storage.
06179 !
06180 ! LENIW   IWORK(18) the length of IWORK actually required, assuming
06181 !                   that the length of IWORK is to be fixed for the
06182 !                   rest of the problem, and that switching may occur.
06183 !                   This is defined on normal returns and on an illegal
06184 !                   input return for insufficient storage.
06185 !
06186 ! MUSED   IWORK(19) the method indicator for the last successful step:
06187 !                   1 means Adams (nonstiff), 2 means BDF (stiff).
06188 !
06189 ! MCUR    IWORK(20) the current method indicator:
06190 !                   1 means Adams (nonstiff), 2 means BDF (stiff).
06191 !                   This is the method to be attempted
06192 !                   on the next step.  Thus it differs from MUSED
06193 !                   only if a method switch has just been made.
06194 !
06195 ! The following two arrays are segments of the RWORK array which
06196 ! may also be of interest to the user as optional outputs.
06197 ! For each array, the table below gives its internal name,
06198 ! its base address in RWORK, and its description.
06199 !
06200 ! Name    Base Address      Description
06201 !
06202 ! YH      21 + 3*NG      the Nordsieck history array, of size NYH by
06203 !                        (NQCUR + 1), where NYH is the initial value
06204 !                        of NEQ.  For j = 0,1,...,NQCUR, column j+1
06205 !                        of YH contains HCUR**j/factorial(j) times
06206 !                        the j-th derivative of the interpolating
06207 !                        polynomial currently representing the solution,
06208 !                        evaluated at t = TCUR.
06209 !
06210 ! ACOR     LACOR         array of size NEQ used for the accumulated
06211 !         (from Common   corrections on each step, scaled on output
06212 !           as noted)    to represent the estimated local error in y
06213 !                        on the last step.  This is the vector E in
06214 !                        the description of the error control.  It is
06215 !                        defined only on a successful return from
06216 !                        DLSODAR.  The base address LACOR is obtained by
06217 !                        including in the user's program the
06218 !                        following 2 lines:
06219 !                           COMMON /DLS001/ RLS(218), ILS(37)
06220 !                           LACOR = ILS(22)
06221 !
06222 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
06223 ! Part 2.  Other Routines Callable.
06224 !
06225 ! The following are optional calls which the user may make to
06226 ! gain additional capabilities in conjunction with DLSODAR.
06227 ! (The routines XSETUN and XSETF are designed to conform to the
06228 ! SLATEC error handling package.)
06229 !
06230 !     Form of Call                  Function
06231 !   CALL XSETUN(LUN)          Set the logical unit number, LUN, for
06232 !                             output of messages from DLSODAR, if
06233 !                             the default is not desired.
06234 !                             The default value of LUN is 6.
06235 !
06236 !   CALL XSETF(MFLAG)         Set a flag to control the printing of
06237 !                             messages by DLSODAR.
06238 !                             MFLAG = 0 means do not print. (Danger:
06239 !                             This risks losing valuable information.)
06240 !                             MFLAG = 1 means print (the default).
06241 !
06242 !                             Either of the above calls may be made at
06243 !                             any time and will take effect immediately.
06244 !
06245 !   CALL DSRCAR(RSAV,ISAV,JOB) saves and restores the contents of
06246 !                             the internal Common blocks used by
06247 !                             DLSODAR (see Part 3 below).
06248 !                             RSAV must be a real array of length 245
06249 !                             or more, and ISAV must be an integer
06250 !                             array of length 55 or more.
06251 !                             JOB=1 means save Common into RSAV/ISAV.
06252 !                             JOB=2 means restore Common from RSAV/ISAV.
06253 !                                DSRCAR is useful if one is
06254 !                             interrupting a run and restarting
06255 !                             later, or alternating between two or
06256 !                             more problems solved with DLSODAR.
06257 !
06258 !   CALL DINTDY(,,,,,)        Provide derivatives of y, of various
06259 !        (see below)          orders, at a specified point t, if
06260 !                             desired.  It may be called only after
06261 !                             a successful return from DLSODAR.
06262 !
06263 ! The detailed instructions for using DINTDY are as follows.
06264 ! The form of the call is:
06265 !
06266 !   LYH = 21 + 3*NG
06267 !   CALL DINTDY (T, K, RWORK(LYH), NYH, DKY, IFLAG)
06268 !
06269 ! The input parameters are:
06270 !
06271 ! T         = value of independent variable where answers are desired
06272 !             (normally the same as the T last returned by DLSODAR).
06273 !             For valid results, T must lie between TCUR - HU and TCUR.
06274 !             (See optional outputs for TCUR and HU.)
06275 ! K         = integer order of the derivative desired.  K must satisfy
06276 !             0 .le. K .le. NQCUR, where NQCUR is the current order
06277 !             (see optional outputs).  The capability corresponding
06278 !             to K = 0, i.e. computing y(t), is already provided
06279 !             by DLSODAR directly.  Since NQCUR .ge. 1, the first
06280 !             derivative dy/dt is always available with DINTDY.
06281 ! LYH       = 21 + 3*NG = base address in RWORK of the history array YH.
06282 ! NYH       = column length of YH, equal to the initial value of NEQ.
06283 !
06284 ! The output parameters are:
06285 !
06286 ! DKY       = a real array of length NEQ containing the computed value
06287 !             of the K-th derivative of y(t).
06288 ! IFLAG     = integer flag, returned as 0 if K and T were legal,
06289 !             -1 if K was illegal, and -2 if T was illegal.
06290 !             On an error return, a message is also written.
06291 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
06292 ! Part 3.  Common Blocks.
06293 !
06294 ! If DLSODAR is to be used in an overlay situation, the user
06295 ! must declare, in the primary overlay, the variables in:
06296 !   (1) the call sequence to DLSODAR, and
06297 !   (2) the three internal Common blocks
06298 !         /DLS001/  of length  255  (218 double precision words
06299 !                      followed by 37 integer words),
06300 !         /DLSA01/  of length  31    (22 double precision words
06301 !                      followed by  9 integer words).
06302 !         /DLSR01/  of length   7  (3 double precision words
06303 !                      followed by  4 integer words).
06304 !
06305 ! If DLSODAR is used on a system in which the contents of internal
06306 ! Common blocks are not preserved between calls, the user should
06307 ! declare the above Common blocks in the calling program to insure
06308 ! that their contents are preserved.
06309 !
06310 ! If the solution of a given problem by DLSODAR is to be interrupted
06311 ! and then later continued, such as when restarting an interrupted run
06312 ! or alternating between two or more problems, the user should save,
06313 ! following the return from the last DLSODAR call prior to the
06314 ! interruption, the contents of the call sequence variables and the
06315 ! internal Common blocks, and later restore these values before the
06316 ! next DLSODAR call for that problem.  To save and restore the Common
06317 ! blocks, use Subroutine DSRCAR (see Part 2 above).
06318 !
06319 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
06320 ! Part 4.  Optionally Replaceable Solver Routines.
06321 !
06322 ! Below is a description of a routine in the DLSODAR package which
06323 ! relates to the measurement of errors, and can be
06324 ! replaced by a user-supplied version, if desired.  However, since such
06325 ! a replacement may have a major impact on performance, it should be
06326 ! done only when absolutely necessary, and only with great caution.
06327 ! (Note: The means by which the package version of a routine is
06328 ! superseded by the user's version may be system-dependent.)
06329 !
06330 ! (a) DEWSET.
06331 ! The following subroutine is called just before each internal
06332 ! integration step, and sets the array of error weights, EWT, as
06333 ! described under ITOL/RTOL/ATOL above:
06334 !     Subroutine DEWSET (NEQ, ITOL, RTOL, ATOL, YCUR, EWT)
06335 ! where NEQ, ITOL, RTOL, and ATOL are as in the DLSODAR call sequence,
06336 ! YCUR contains the current dependent variable vector, and
06337 ! EWT is the array of weights set by DEWSET.
06338 !
06339 ! If the user supplies this subroutine, it must return in EWT(i)
06340 ! (i = 1,...,NEQ) a positive quantity suitable for comparing errors
06341 ! in y(i) to.  The EWT array returned by DEWSET is passed to the
06342 ! DMNORM routine, and also used by DLSODAR in the computation
06343 ! of the optional output IMXER, and the increments for difference
06344 ! quotient Jacobians.
06345 !
06346 ! In the user-supplied version of DEWSET, it may be desirable to use
06347 ! the current values of derivatives of y.  Derivatives up to order NQ
06348 ! are available from the history array YH, described above under
06349 ! optional outputs.  In DEWSET, YH is identical to the YCUR array,
06350 ! extended to NQ + 1 columns with a column length of NYH and scale
06351 ! factors of H**j/factorial(j).  On the first call for the problem,
06352 ! given by NST = 0, NQ is 1 and H is temporarily set to 1.0.
06353 ! NYH is the initial value of NEQ.  The quantities NQ, H, and NST
06354 ! can be obtained by including in DEWSET the statements:
06355 !     DOUBLE PRECISION RLS
06356 !     COMMON /DLS001/ RLS(218),ILS(37)
06357 !     NQ = ILS(33)
06358 !     NST = ILS(34)
06359 !     H = RLS(212)
06360 ! Thus, for example, the current value of dy/dt can be obtained as
06361 ! YCUR(NYH+i)/H  (i=1,...,NEQ)  (and the division by H is
06362 ! unnecessary when NST = 0).
06363 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
06364 !
06365 !***REVISION HISTORY  (YYYYMMDD)
06366 ! 19811102  DATE WRITTEN
06367 ! 19820126  Fixed bug in tests of work space lengths;
06368 !           minor corrections in main prologue and comments.
06369 ! 19820507  Fixed bug in RCHEK in setting HMING.
06370 ! 19870330  Major update: corrected comments throughout;
06371 !           removed TRET from Common; rewrote EWSET with 4 loops;
06372 !           fixed t test in INTDY; added Cray directives in STODA;
06373 !           in STODA, fixed DELP init. and logic around PJAC call;
06374 !           combined routines to save/restore Common;
06375 !           passed LEVEL = 0 in error message calls (except run abort).
06376 ! 19970225  Fixed lines setting JSTART = -2 in Subroutine LSODAR.
06377 ! 20010425  Major update: convert source lines to upper case;
06378 !           added *DECK lines; changed from 1 to * in dummy dimensions;
06379 !           changed names R1MACH/D1MACH to RUMACH/DUMACH;
06380 !           renamed routines for uniqueness across single/double prec.;
06381 !           converted intrinsic names to generic form;
06382 !           removed ILLIN and NTREP (data loaded) from Common;
06383 !           removed all 'own' variables from Common;
06384 !           changed error messages to quoted strings;
06385 !           replaced XERRWV/XERRWD with 1993 revised version;
06386 !           converted prologues, comments, error messages to mixed case;
06387 !           numerous corrections to prologues and internal comments.
06388 ! 20010507  Converted single precision source to double precision.
06389 ! 20010613  Revised excess accuracy test (to match rest of ODEPACK).
06390 ! 20010808  Fixed bug in DPRJA (matrix in DBNORM call).
06391 ! 20020502  Corrected declarations in descriptions of user routines.
06392 ! 20031105  Restored 'own' variables to Common blocks, to enable
06393 !           interrupt/restart feature.
06394 ! 20031112  Added SAVE statements for data-loaded constants.
06395 !
06396 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
06397 ! Other routines in the DLSODAR package.
06398 !
06399 ! In addition to Subroutine DLSODAR, the DLSODAR package includes the
06400 ! following subroutines and function routines:
06401 !  DRCHEK   does preliminary checking for roots, and serves as an
06402 !           interface between Subroutine DLSODAR and Subroutine DROOTS.
06403 !  DROOTS   finds the leftmost root of a set of functions.
06404 !  DINTDY   computes an interpolated value of the y vector at t = TOUT.
06405 !  DSTODA   is the core integrator, which does one step of the
06406 !           integration and the associated error control.
06407 !  DCFODE   sets all method coefficients and test constants.
06408 !  DPRJA    computes and preprocesses the Jacobian matrix J = df/dy
06409 !           and the Newton iteration matrix P = I - h*l0*J.
06410 !  DSOLSY   manages solution of linear system in chord iteration.
06411 !  DEWSET   sets the error weight vector EWT before each step.
06412 !  DMNORM   computes the weighted max-norm of a vector.
06413 !  DFNORM   computes the norm of a full matrix consistent with the
06414 !           weighted max-norm on vectors.
06415 !  DBNORM   computes the norm of a band matrix consistent with the
06416 !           weighted max-norm on vectors.
06417 !  DSRCAR   is a user-callable routine to save and restore
06418 !           the contents of the internal Common blocks.
06419 !  DGEFA and DGESL   are routines from LINPACK for solving full
06420 !           systems of linear algebraic equations.
06421 !  DGBFA and DGBSL   are routines from LINPACK for solving banded
06422 !           linear systems.
06423 !  DCOPY    is one of the basic linear algebra modules (BLAS).
06424 !  DUMACH   computes the unit roundoff in a machine-independent manner.
06425 !  XERRWD, XSETUN, XSETF, IXSAV, and IUMACH  handle the printing of all
06426 !           error messages and warnings.  XERRWD is machine-dependent.
06427 ! Note:  DMNORM, DFNORM, DBNORM, DUMACH, IXSAV, and IUMACH are
06428 ! function routines.  All the others are subroutines.
06429 !
06430 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
06431 EXTERNAL DPRJA, DSOLSY
06432 DOUBLE PRECISION DUMACH, DMNORM
06433 INTEGER INIT, MXSTEP, MXHNIL, NHNIL, NSLAST, NYH, IOWNS, ICF, IERPJ, IERSL, JCUR, JSTART, KFLAG, L, LYH, LEWT
06434 INTEGER LACOR, LSAVF, LWM, LIWM, METH, MITER, MAXORD, MAXCOR, MSBP, MXNCF, N, NQ, NST, NFE, NJE, NQU
06435 INTEGER INSUFR, INSUFI, IXPR, IOWNS2, JTYP, MUSED, MXORDN, MXORDS
06436 INTEGER LG0, LG1, LGX, IOWNR3, IRFND, ITASKC, NGC, NGE
06437 INTEGER I, I1, I2, IFLAG, IMXER, KGO, LENIW, LENRW, LENWM, LF0, ML, MORD, MU, MXHNL0, MXSTP0
06438 INTEGER LEN1, LEN1C, LEN1N, LEN1S, LEN2, LENIWC, LENRWC
06439 INTEGER IRFP, IRT, LENYH, LYHNEW
06440 DOUBLE PRECISION ROWNS, CCMAX, EL0, H, HMIN, HMXI, HU, RC, TN, UROUND
06441 DOUBLE PRECISION TSW, ROWNS2, PDNORM
06442 DOUBLE PRECISION ROWNR3, T0, TLAST, TOUTC
06443 DOUBLE PRECISION ATOLI, AYI, BIG, EWTI, H0, HMAX, HMX, RH, RTOLI, TCRIT, TDIST, TNEXT, TOL, TOLSF, TP, SIZE, SUM, W0
06444 DIMENSION MORD(2)
06445 LOGICAL IHIT
06446 character(len=60) MSG
06447 SAVE MORD, MXSTP0, MXHNL0
06448 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
06449 ! The following three internal Common blocks contain
06450 ! (a) variables which are local to any subroutine but whose values must
06451 !     be preserved between calls to the routine ("own" variables), and
06452 ! (b) variables which are communicated between subroutines.
06453 ! The block DLS001 is declared in subroutines DLSODAR, DINTDY, DSTODA,
06454 ! DPRJA, and DSOLSY.
06455 ! The block DLSA01 is declared in subroutines DLSODAR, DSTODA, DPRJA.
06456 ! The block DLSR01 is declared in subroutines DLSODAR, DRCHEK, DROOTS.
06457 ! Groups of variables are replaced by dummy arrays in the Common
06458 ! declarations in routines where those variables are not used.
06459 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
06460 COMMON /DLS001/ ROWNS(209), CCMAX, EL0, H, HMIN, HMXI, HU, RC, TN, UROUND, INIT, MXSTEP, MXHNIL, NHNIL, NSLAST, NYH, & 
06461 IOWNS( 6), ICF, IERPJ, IERSL, JCUR, JSTART, KFLAG, L, LYH, LEWT, LACOR, LSAVF, LWM, LIWM, METH, MITER, MAXORD, MAXCOR, & 
06462 MSBP , MXNCF , N, NQ, NST, NFE, NJE, NQU
06463 !
06464 COMMON /DLSA01/ TSW, ROWNS2(20), PDNORM, INSUFR, INSUFI, IXPR, IOWNS2(2), JTYP, MUSED, MXORDN, MXORDS
06465 !
06466 COMMON /DLSR01/ ROWNR3(2), T0, TLAST, TOUTC, LG0, LG1, LGX, IOWNR3(2), IRFND, ITASKC, NGC, NGE
06467 !
06468 DATA MORD(1),MORD(2)/12,5/, MXSTP0/500/, MXHNL0/10/
06469 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
06470 ! Block A.
06471 ! This code block is executed on every call.
06472 ! It tests ISTATE and ITASK for legality and branches appropriately.
06473 ! If ISTATE .gt. 1 but the flag INIT shows that initialization has
06474 ! not yet been done, an error return occurs.
06475 ! If ISTATE = 1 and TOUT = T, return immediately.
06476 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
06477 IF (ISTATE .LT. 1 .OR. ISTATE .GT. 3) GOTO 601
06478 IF (ITASK .LT. 1 .OR. ITASK .GT. 5) GOTO 602
06479 ITASKC = ITASK
06480 IF (ISTATE .EQ. 1) GOTO 10
06481 IF (INIT .EQ. 0) GOTO 603
06482 IF (ISTATE .EQ. 2) GOTO 200
06483 GOTO 20
06484 10   INIT = 0
06485 IF (TOUT .EQ. T) RETURN
06486 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
06487 ! Block B.
06488 ! The next code block is executed for the initial call (ISTATE = 1),
06489 ! or for a continuation call with parameter changes (ISTATE = 3).
06490 ! It contains checking of all inputs and various initializations.
06491 !
06492 ! First check legality of the non-optional inputs NEQ, ITOL, IOPT,
06493 ! JT, ML, MU, and NG.
06494 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
06495 20   IF (NEQ(1) .LE. 0) GOTO 604
06496 IF (ISTATE .EQ. 1) GOTO 25
06497 IF (NEQ(1) .GT. N) GOTO 605
06498 25   N = NEQ(1)
06499 IF (ITOL .LT. 1 .OR. ITOL .GT. 4) GOTO 606
06500 IF (IOPT .LT. 0 .OR. IOPT .GT. 1) GOTO 607
06501 IF (JT .EQ. 3 .OR. JT .LT. 1 .OR. JT .GT. 5) GOTO 608
06502 JTYP = JT
06503 IF (JT .LE. 2) GOTO 30
06504 ML = IWORK(1)
06505 MU = IWORK(2)
06506 IF (ML .LT. 0 .OR. ML .GE. N) GOTO 609
06507 IF (MU .LT. 0 .OR. MU .GE. N) GOTO 610
06508 30   CONTINUE
06509 IF (NG .LT. 0) GOTO 630
06510 IF (ISTATE .EQ. 1) GOTO 35
06511 IF (IRFND .EQ. 0 .AND. NG .NE. NGC) GOTO 631
06512 35   NGC = NG
06513 ! Next process and check the optional inputs. --------------------------
06514 IF (IOPT .EQ. 1) GOTO 40
06515 IXPR = 0
06516 MXSTEP = MXSTP0
06517 MXHNIL = MXHNL0
06518 HMXI = 0.0D0
06519 HMIN = 0.0D0
06520 IF (ISTATE .NE. 1) GOTO 60
06521 H0 = 0.0D0
06522 MXORDN = MORD(1)
06523 MXORDS = MORD(2)
06524 GOTO 60
06525 40   IXPR = IWORK(5)
06526 IF (IXPR .LT. 0 .OR. IXPR .GT. 1) GOTO 611
06527 MXSTEP = IWORK(6)
06528 IF (MXSTEP .LT. 0) GOTO 612
06529 IF (MXSTEP .EQ. 0) MXSTEP = MXSTP0
06530 MXHNIL = IWORK(7)
06531 IF (MXHNIL .LT. 0) GOTO 613
06532 IF (MXHNIL .EQ. 0) MXHNIL = MXHNL0
06533 IF (ISTATE .NE. 1) GOTO 50
06534 H0 = RWORK(5)
06535 MXORDN = IWORK(8)
06536 IF (MXORDN .LT. 0) GOTO 628
06537 IF (MXORDN .EQ. 0) MXORDN = 100
06538 MXORDN = MIN(MXORDN,MORD(1))
06539 MXORDS = IWORK(9)
06540 IF (MXORDS .LT. 0) GOTO 629
06541 IF (MXORDS .EQ. 0) MXORDS = 100
06542 MXORDS = MIN(MXORDS,MORD(2))
06543 IF ((TOUT - T)*H0 .LT. 0.0D0) GOTO 614
06544 50   HMAX = RWORK(6)
06545 IF (HMAX .LT. 0.0D0) GOTO 615
06546 HMXI = 0.0D0
06547 IF (HMAX .GT. 0.0D0) HMXI = 1.0D0/HMAX
06548 HMIN = RWORK(7)
06549 IF (HMIN .LT. 0.0D0) GOTO 616
06550 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
06551 ! Set work array pointers and check lengths LRW and LIW.
06552 ! If ISTATE = 1, METH is initialized to 1 here to facilitate the
06553 ! checking of work space lengths.
06554 ! Pointers to segments of RWORK and IWORK are named by prefixing L to
06555 ! the name of the segment.  E.g., the segment YH starts at RWORK(LYH).
06556 ! Segments of RWORK (in order) are denoted  G0, G1, GX, YH, WM,
06557 ! EWT, SAVF, ACOR.
06558 ! If the lengths provided are insufficient for the current method,
06559 ! an error return occurs.  This is treated as illegal input on the
06560 ! first call, but as a problem interruption with ISTATE = -7 on a
06561 ! continuation call.  If the lengths are sufficient for the current
06562 ! method but not for both methods, a warning message is sent.
06563 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
06564 60   IF (ISTATE .EQ. 1) METH = 1
06565 IF (ISTATE .EQ. 1) NYH = N
06566 LG0 = 21
06567 LG1 = LG0 + NG
06568 LGX = LG1 + NG
06569 LYHNEW = LGX + NG
06570 IF (ISTATE .EQ. 1) LYH = LYHNEW
06571 IF (LYHNEW .EQ. LYH) GOTO 62
06572 ! If ISTATE = 3 and NG was changed, shift YH to its new location. ------
06573 LENYH = L*NYH
06574 IF (LRW .LT. LYHNEW-1+LENYH) GOTO 62
06575 I1 = 1
06576 IF (LYHNEW .GT. LYH) I1 = -1
06577 CALL DCOPY (LENYH, RWORK(LYH), I1, RWORK(LYHNEW), I1)
06578 LYH = LYHNEW
06579 62   CONTINUE
06580 LEN1N = LYHNEW - 1 + (MXORDN + 1)*NYH
06581 LEN1S = LYHNEW - 1 + (MXORDS + 1)*NYH
06582 LWM = LEN1S + 1
06583 IF (JT .LE. 2) LENWM = N*N + 2
06584 IF (JT .GE. 4) LENWM = (2*ML + MU + 1)*N + 2
06585 LEN1S = LEN1S + LENWM
06586 LEN1C = LEN1N
06587 IF (METH .EQ. 2) LEN1C = LEN1S
06588 LEN1 = MAX(LEN1N,LEN1S)
06589 LEN2 = 3*N
06590 LENRW = LEN1 + LEN2
06591 LENRWC = LEN1C + LEN2
06592 IWORK(17) = LENRW
06593 LIWM = 1
06594 LENIW = 20 + N
06595 LENIWC = 20
06596 IF (METH .EQ. 2) LENIWC = LENIW
06597 IWORK(18) = LENIW
06598 IF (ISTATE .EQ. 1 .AND. LRW .LT. LENRWC) GOTO 617
06599 IF (ISTATE .EQ. 1 .AND. LIW .LT. LENIWC) GOTO 618
06600 IF (ISTATE .EQ. 3 .AND. LRW .LT. LENRWC) GOTO 550
06601 IF (ISTATE .EQ. 3 .AND. LIW .LT. LENIWC) GOTO 555
06602 LEWT = LEN1 + 1
06603 INSUFR = 0
06604 IF (LRW .GE. LENRW) GOTO 65
06605 INSUFR = 2
06606 LEWT = LEN1C + 1
06607 MSG='DLSODAR-  Warning.. RWORK length is sufficient for now, but '
06608 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 103, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
06609 MSG='      may not be later.  Integration will proceed anyway.   '
06610 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 103, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
06611 MSG = '      Length needed is LENRW = I1, while LRW = I2.'
06612 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 103, 0, 2, LENRW, LRW, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
06613 65   LSAVF = LEWT + N
06614 LACOR = LSAVF + N
06615 INSUFI = 0
06616 IF (LIW .GE. LENIW) GOTO 70
06617 INSUFI = 2
06618 MSG='DLSODAR-  Warning.. IWORK length is sufficient for now, but '
06619 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 104, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
06620 MSG='      may not be later.  Integration will proceed anyway.   '
06621 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 104, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
06622 MSG = '      Length needed is LENIW = I1, while LIW = I2.'
06623 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 104, 0, 2, LENIW, LIW, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
06624 70   CONTINUE
06625 ! Check RTOL and ATOL for legality. ------------------------------------
06626 RTOLI = RTOL(1)
06627 ATOLI = ATOL(1)
06628 DO 75 I = 1,N
06629 IF (ITOL .GE. 3) RTOLI = RTOL(I)
06630 IF (ITOL .EQ. 2 .OR. ITOL .EQ. 4) ATOLI = ATOL(I)
06631 IF (RTOLI .LT. 0.0D0) GOTO 619
06632 IF (ATOLI .LT. 0.0D0) GOTO 620
06633 75     CONTINUE
06634 IF (ISTATE .EQ. 1) GOTO 100
06635 ! if ISTATE = 3, set flag to signal parameter changes to DSTODA. -------
06636 JSTART = -1
06637 IF (N .EQ. NYH) GOTO 200
06638 ! NEQ was reduced.  zero part of yh to avoid undefined references. -----
06639 I1 = LYH + L*NYH
06640 I2 = LYH + (MAXORD + 1)*NYH - 1
06641 IF (I1 .GT. I2) GOTO 200
06642 DO 95 I = I1,I2
06643 95     RWORK(I) = 0.0D0
06644 GOTO 200
06645 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
06646 ! Block C.
06647 ! The next block is for the initial call only (ISTATE = 1).
06648 ! It contains all remaining initializations, the initial call to F,
06649 ! and the calculation of the initial step size.
06650 ! The error weights in EWT are inverted after being loaded.
06651 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
06652 100  UROUND = DUMACH()
06653 TN = T
06654 TSW = T
06655 MAXORD = MXORDN
06656 IF (ITASK .NE. 4 .AND. ITASK .NE. 5) GOTO 110
06657 TCRIT = RWORK(1)
06658 IF ((TCRIT - TOUT)*(TOUT - T) .LT. 0.0D0) GOTO 625
06659 IF (H0 .NE. 0.0D0 .AND. (T + H0 - TCRIT)*H0 .GT. 0.0D0) H0 = TCRIT - T
06660 110  JSTART = 0
06661 NHNIL = 0
06662 NST = 0
06663 NJE = 0
06664 NSLAST = 0
06665 HU = 0.0D0
06666 NQU = 0
06667 MUSED = 0
06668 MITER = 0
06669 CCMAX = 0.3D0
06670 MAXCOR = 3
06671 MSBP = 20
06672 MXNCF = 10
06673 ! Initial call to F.  (LF0 points to YH(*,2).) -------------------------
06674 LF0 = LYH + NYH
06675 CALL F (NEQ, T, Y, RWORK(LF0))
06676 NFE = 1
06677 ! Load the initial value vector in YH. ---------------------------------
06678 DO 115 I = 1,N
06679 115    RWORK(I+LYH-1) = Y(I)
06680 ! Load and invert the EWT array.  (H is temporarily set to 1.0.) -------
06681 NQ = 1
06682 H = 1.0D0
06683 CALL DEWSET (N, ITOL, RTOL, ATOL, RWORK(LYH), RWORK(LEWT))
06684 DO 120 I = 1,N
06685 IF (RWORK(I+LEWT-1) .LE. 0.0D0) GOTO 621
06686 120    RWORK(I+LEWT-1) = 1.0D0/RWORK(I+LEWT-1)
06687 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
06688 ! The coding below computes the step size, H0, to be attempted on the
06689 ! first step, unless the user has supplied a value for this.
06690 ! First check that TOUT - T differs significantly from zero.
06691 ! A scalar tolerance quantity TOL is computed, as MAX(RTOL(i))
06692 ! if this is positive, or MAX(ATOL(i)/ABS(Y(i))) otherwise, adjusted
06693 ! so as to be between 100*UROUND and 1.0E-3.
06694 ! Then the computed value H0 is given by:
06695 !
06696 !   H0**(-2)  =  1./(TOL * w0**2)  +  TOL * (norm(F))**2
06697 !
06698 ! where   w0     = MAX ( ABS(T), ABS(TOUT) ),
06699 !         F      = the initial value of the vector f(t,y), and
06700 !         norm() = the weighted vector norm used throughout, given by
06701 !                  the DMNORM function routine, and weighted by the
06702 !                  tolerances initially loaded into the EWT array.
06703 ! The sign of H0 is inferred from the initial values of TOUT and T.
06704 ! ABS(H0) is made .le. ABS(TOUT-T) in any case.
06705 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
06706 IF (H0 .NE. 0.0D0) GOTO 180
06707 TDIST = ABS(TOUT - T)
06708 W0 = MAX(ABS(T),ABS(TOUT))
06709 IF (TDIST .LT. 2.0D0*UROUND*W0) GOTO 622
06710 TOL = RTOL(1)
06711 IF (ITOL .LE. 2) GOTO 140
06712 DO 130 I = 1,N
06713 130    TOL = MAX(TOL,RTOL(I))
06714 140  IF (TOL .GT. 0.0D0) GOTO 160
06715 ATOLI = ATOL(1)
06716 DO 150 I = 1,N
06717 IF (ITOL .EQ. 2 .OR. ITOL .EQ. 4) ATOLI = ATOL(I)
06718 AYI = ABS(Y(I))
06719 IF (AYI .NE. 0.0D0) TOL = MAX(TOL,ATOLI/AYI)
06720 150    CONTINUE
06721 160  TOL = MAX(TOL,100.0D0*UROUND)
06722 TOL = MIN(TOL,0.001D0)
06723 SUM = DMNORM (N, RWORK(LF0), RWORK(LEWT))
06724 SUM = 1.0D0/(TOL*W0*W0) + TOL*SUM**2
06725 H0 = 1.0D0/SQRT(SUM)
06726 H0 = MIN(H0,TDIST)
06727 H0 = SIGN(H0,TOUT-T)
06728 ! Adjust H0 if necessary to meet HMAX bound. ---------------------------
06729 180  RH = ABS(H0)*HMXI
06730 IF (RH .GT. 1.0D0) H0 = H0/RH
06731 ! Load H with H0 and scale YH(*,2) by H0. ------------------------------
06732 H = H0
06733 DO 190 I = 1,N
06734 190    RWORK(I+LF0-1) = H0*RWORK(I+LF0-1)
06735 !
06736 ! Check for a zero of g at T. ------------------------------------------
06737 IRFND = 0
06738 TOUTC = TOUT
06739 IF (NGC .EQ. 0) GOTO 270
06740 CALL DRCHEK (1, G, NEQ, Y, RWORK(LYH), NYH, RWORK(LG0), RWORK(LG1), RWORK(LGX), JROOT, IRT)
06741 IF (IRT .EQ. 0) GOTO 270
06742 GOTO 632
06743 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
06744 ! Block D.
06745 ! The next code block is for continuation calls only (ISTATE = 2 or 3)
06746 ! and is to check stop conditions before taking a step.
06747 ! First, DRCHEK is called to check for a root within the last step
06748 ! taken, other than the last root found there, if any.
06749 ! If ITASK = 2 or 5, and y(TN) has not yet been returned to the user
06750 ! because of an intervening root, return through Block G.
06751 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
06752 200  NSLAST = NST
06753 !
06754 IRFP = IRFND
06755 IF (NGC .EQ. 0) GOTO 205
06756 IF (ITASK .EQ. 1 .OR. ITASK .EQ. 4) TOUTC = TOUT
06757 CALL DRCHEK (2, G, NEQ, Y, RWORK(LYH), NYH, RWORK(LG0), RWORK(LG1), RWORK(LGX), JROOT, IRT)
06758 IF (IRT .NE. 1) GOTO 205
06759 IRFND = 1
06760 ISTATE = 3
06761 T = T0
06762 GOTO 425
06763 205  CONTINUE
06764 IRFND = 0
06765 IF (IRFP .EQ. 1 .AND. TLAST .NE. TN .AND. ITASK .EQ. 2) GOTO 400
06766 !
06767 GOTO (210, 250, 220, 230, 240), ITASK
06768 210  IF ((TN - TOUT)*H .LT. 0.0D0) GOTO 250
06769 CALL DINTDY (TOUT, 0, RWORK(LYH), NYH, Y, IFLAG)
06770 IF (IFLAG .NE. 0) GOTO 627
06771 T = TOUT
06772 GOTO 420
06773 220  TP = TN - HU*(1.0D0 + 100.0D0*UROUND)
06774 IF ((TP - TOUT)*H .GT. 0.0D0) GOTO 623
06775 IF ((TN - TOUT)*H .LT. 0.0D0) GOTO 250
06776 T = TN
06777 GOTO 400
06778 230  TCRIT = RWORK(1)
06779 IF ((TN - TCRIT)*H .GT. 0.0D0) GOTO 624
06780 IF ((TCRIT - TOUT)*H .LT. 0.0D0) GOTO 625
06781 IF ((TN - TOUT)*H .LT. 0.0D0) GOTO 245
06782 CALL DINTDY (TOUT, 0, RWORK(LYH), NYH, Y, IFLAG)
06783 IF (IFLAG .NE. 0) GOTO 627
06784 T = TOUT
06785 GOTO 420
06786 240  TCRIT = RWORK(1)
06787 IF ((TN - TCRIT)*H .GT. 0.0D0) GOTO 624
06788 245  HMX = ABS(TN) + ABS(H)
06789 IHIT = ABS(TN - TCRIT) .LE. 100.0D0*UROUND*HMX
06790 IF (IHIT) T = TCRIT
06791 IF (IRFP .EQ. 1 .AND. TLAST .NE. TN .AND. ITASK .EQ. 5) GOTO 400
06792 IF (IHIT) GOTO 400
06793 TNEXT = TN + H*(1.0D0 + 4.0D0*UROUND)
06794 IF ((TNEXT - TCRIT)*H .LE. 0.0D0) GOTO 250
06795 H = (TCRIT - TN)*(1.0D0 - 4.0D0*UROUND)
06796 IF (ISTATE .EQ. 2 .AND. JSTART .GE. 0) JSTART = -2
06797 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
06798 ! Block E.
06799 ! The next block is normally executed for all calls and contains
06800 ! the call to the one-step core integrator DSTODA.
06801 !
06802 ! This is a looping point for the integration steps.
06803 !
06804 ! First check for too many steps being taken, update EWT (if not at
06805 ! start of problem), check for too much accuracy being requested, and
06806 ! check for H below the roundoff level in T.
06807 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
06808 250  CONTINUE
06809 IF (METH .EQ. MUSED) GOTO 255
06810 IF (INSUFR .EQ. 1) GOTO 550
06811 IF (INSUFI .EQ. 1) GOTO 555
06812 255  IF ((NST-NSLAST) .GE. MXSTEP) GOTO 500
06813 CALL DEWSET (N, ITOL, RTOL, ATOL, RWORK(LYH), RWORK(LEWT))
06814 DO 260 I = 1,N
06815 IF (RWORK(I+LEWT-1) .LE. 0.0D0) GOTO 510
06816 260    RWORK(I+LEWT-1) = 1.0D0/RWORK(I+LEWT-1)
06817 270  TOLSF = UROUND*DMNORM (N, RWORK(LYH), RWORK(LEWT))
06818 IF (TOLSF .LE. 1.0D0) GOTO 280
06819 TOLSF = TOLSF*2.0D0
06820 IF (NST .EQ. 0) GOTO 626
06821 GOTO 520
06822 280  IF ((TN + H) .NE. TN) GOTO 290
06823 NHNIL = NHNIL + 1
06824 IF (NHNIL .GT. MXHNIL) GOTO 290
06825 MSG = 'DLSODAR-  Warning..Internal T(=R1) and H(=R2) are '
06826 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 101, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
06827 MSG='      such that in the machine, T + H = T on the next step  '
06828 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 101, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
06829 MSG = '     (H = step size). Solver will continue anyway.'
06830 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 101, 0, 0, 0, 0, 2, TN, H)
06831 IF (NHNIL .LT. MXHNIL) GOTO 290
06832 MSG = 'DLSODAR-  Above warning has been issued I1 times. '
06833 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 102, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
06834 MSG = '     It will not be issued again for this problem.'
06835 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 102, 0, 1, MXHNIL, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
06836 290  CONTINUE
06837 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
06838 !   CALL DSTODA(NEQ,Y,YH,NYH,YH,EWT,SAVF,ACOR,WM,IWM,F,JAC,DPRJA,DSOLSY)
06839 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
06840 CALL DSTODA(NEQ, Y, RWORK(LYH), NYH, RWORK(LYH), RWORK(LEWT), RWORK(LSAVF), RWORK(LACOR), RWORK(LWM), &
06841 IWORK(LIWM), F, JAC, DPRJA, DSOLSY)
06842 KGO = 1 - KFLAG
06843 GOTO (300, 530, 540), KGO
06844 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
06845 ! Block F.
06846 ! The following block handles the case of a successful return from the
06847 ! core integrator (KFLAG = 0).
06848 ! If a method switch was just made, record TSW, reset MAXORD,
06849 ! set JSTART to -1 to signal DSTODA to complete the switch,
06850 ! and do extra printing of data if IXPR = 1.
06851 ! Then call DRCHEK to check for a root within the last step.
06852 ! Then, if no root was found, check for stop conditions.
06853 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
06854 300  INIT = 1
06855 IF (METH .EQ. MUSED) GOTO 310
06856 TSW = TN
06857 MAXORD = MXORDN
06858 IF (METH .EQ. 2) MAXORD = MXORDS
06859 IF (METH .EQ. 2) RWORK(LWM) = SQRT(UROUND)
06860 INSUFR = MIN(INSUFR,1)
06861 INSUFI = MIN(INSUFI,1)
06862 JSTART = -1
06863 IF (IXPR .EQ. 0) GOTO 310
06864 IF (METH .EQ. 2) THEN
06865 MSG='DLSODAR- A switch to the BDF (stiff) method has occurred    '
06866 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 105, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
06867 ENDIF
06868 IF (METH .EQ. 1) THEN
06869 MSG='DLSODAR- A switch to the Adams (nonstiff) method occurred   '
06870 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 106, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
06871 ENDIF
06872 MSG='     at T = R1,  tentative step size H = R2,  step NST = I1 '
06873 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 107, 0, 1, NST, 0, 2, TN, H)
06874 310  CONTINUE
06875 !
06876 IF (NGC .EQ. 0) GOTO 315
06877 CALL DRCHEK (3, G, NEQ, Y, RWORK(LYH), NYH, RWORK(LG0), RWORK(LG1), RWORK(LGX), JROOT, IRT)
06878 IF (IRT .NE. 1) GOTO 315
06879 IRFND = 1
06880 ISTATE = 3
06881 T = T0
06882 GOTO 425
06883 315  CONTINUE
06884 !
06885 GOTO (320, 400, 330, 340, 350), ITASK
06886 ! ITASK = 1.  If TOUT has been reached, interpolate. -------------------
06887 320  IF ((TN - TOUT)*H .LT. 0.0D0) GOTO 250
06888 CALL DINTDY (TOUT, 0, RWORK(LYH), NYH, Y, IFLAG)
06889 T = TOUT
06890 GOTO 420
06891 ! ITASK = 3.  Jump to exit if TOUT was reached. ------------------------
06892 330  IF ((TN - TOUT)*H .GE. 0.0D0) GOTO 400
06893 GOTO 250
06894 ! ITASK = 4.  See if TOUT or TCRIT was reached.  Adjust H if necessary.
06895 340  IF ((TN - TOUT)*H .LT. 0.0D0) GOTO 345
06896 CALL DINTDY (TOUT, 0, RWORK(LYH), NYH, Y, IFLAG)
06897 T = TOUT
06898 GOTO 420
06899 345  HMX = ABS(TN) + ABS(H)
06900 IHIT = ABS(TN - TCRIT) .LE. 100.0D0*UROUND*HMX
06901 IF (IHIT) GOTO 400
06902 TNEXT = TN + H*(1.0D0 + 4.0D0*UROUND)
06903 IF ((TNEXT - TCRIT)*H .LE. 0.0D0) GOTO 250
06904 H = (TCRIT - TN)*(1.0D0 - 4.0D0*UROUND)
06905 IF (JSTART .GE. 0) JSTART = -2
06906 GOTO 250
06907 ! ITASK = 5.  See if TCRIT was reached and jump to exit. ---------------
06908 350  HMX = ABS(TN) + ABS(H)
06909 IHIT = ABS(TN - TCRIT) .LE. 100.0D0*UROUND*HMX
06910 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
06911 ! Block G.
06912 ! The following block handles all successful returns from DLSODAR.
06913 ! If ITASK .ne. 1, Y is loaded from YH and T is set accordingly.
06914 ! ISTATE is set to 2, and the optional outputs are loaded into the
06915 ! work arrays before returning.
06916 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
06917 400  DO 410 I = 1,N
06918 410    Y(I) = RWORK(I+LYH-1)
06919 T = TN
06920 IF (ITASK .NE. 4 .AND. ITASK .NE. 5) GOTO 420
06921 IF (IHIT) T = TCRIT
06922 420  ISTATE = 2
06923 425  CONTINUE
06924 RWORK(11) = HU
06925 RWORK(12) = H
06926 RWORK(13) = TN
06927 RWORK(15) = TSW
06928 IWORK(11) = NST
06929 IWORK(12) = NFE
06930 IWORK(13) = NJE
06931 IWORK(14) = NQU
06932 IWORK(15) = NQ
06933 IWORK(19) = MUSED
06934 IWORK(20) = METH
06935 IWORK(10) = NGE
06936 TLAST = T
06937 RETURN
06938 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
06939 ! Block H.
06940 ! The following block handles all unsuccessful returns other than
06941 ! those for illegal input.  First the error message routine is called.
06942 ! If there was an error test or convergence test failure, IMXER is set.
06943 ! Then Y is loaded from YH and T is set to TN.
06944 ! The optional outputs are loaded into the work arrays before returning.
06945 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
06946 ! The maximum number of steps was taken before reaching TOUT. ----------
06947 500  MSG = 'DLSODAR-  At current T (=R1), MXSTEP (=I1) steps  '
06948 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 201, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
06949 MSG = '      taken on this call before reaching TOUT     '
06950 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 201, 0, 1, MXSTEP, 0, 1, TN, 0.0D0)
06951 ISTATE = -1
06952 GOTO 580
06953 ! EWT(i) .le. 0.0 for some i (not at start of problem). ----------------
06954 510  EWTI = RWORK(LEWT+I-1)
06955 MSG = 'DLSODAR-  At T(=R1), EWT(I1) has become R2 .le. 0.'
06956 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 202, 0, 1, I, 0, 2, TN, EWTI)
06957 ISTATE = -6
06958 GOTO 580
06959 ! Too much accuracy requested for machine precision. -------------------
06960 520  MSG = 'DLSODAR-  At T (=R1), too much accuracy requested '
06961 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 203, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
06962 MSG = '      for precision of machine..  See TOLSF (=R2) '
06963 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 203, 0, 0, 0, 0, 2, TN, TOLSF)
06964 RWORK(14) = TOLSF
06965 ISTATE = -2
06966 GOTO 580
06967 ! KFLAG = -1.  Error test failed repeatedly or with ABS(H) = HMIN. -----
06968 530  MSG = 'DLSODAR-  At T(=R1), step size H(=R2), the error  '
06969 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 204, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
06970 MSG = '      test failed repeatedly or with ABS(H) = HMIN'
06971 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 204, 0, 0, 0, 0, 2, TN, H)
06972 ISTATE = -4
06973 GOTO 560
06974 ! KFLAG = -2.  Convergence failed repeatedly or with ABS(H) = HMIN. ----
06975 540  MSG = 'DLSODAR-  At T (=R1) and step size H (=R2), the   '
06976 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 205, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
06977 MSG = '      corrector convergence failed repeatedly     '
06978 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 205, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
06979 MSG = '      or with ABS(H) = HMIN   '
06980 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 205, 0, 0, 0, 0, 2, TN, H)
06981 ISTATE = -5
06982 GOTO 560
06983 ! RWORK length too small to proceed. -----------------------------------
06984 550  MSG = 'DLSODAR- At current T(=R1), RWORK length too small'
06985 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 206, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
06986 MSG='      to proceed.  The integration was otherwise successful.'
06987 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 206, 0, 0, 0, 0, 1, TN, 0.0D0)
06988 ISTATE = -7
06989 GOTO 580
06990 ! IWORK length too small to proceed. -----------------------------------
06991 555  MSG = 'DLSODAR- At current T(=R1), IWORK length too small'
06992 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 207, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
06993 MSG='      to proceed.  The integration was otherwise successful.'
06994 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 207, 0, 0, 0, 0, 1, TN, 0.0D0)
06995 ISTATE = -7
06996 GOTO 580
06997 ! Compute IMXER if relevant. -------------------------------------------
06998 560  BIG = 0.0D0
06999 IMXER = 1
07000 DO 570 I = 1,N
07001 SIZE = ABS(RWORK(I+LACOR-1)*RWORK(I+LEWT-1))
07002 IF (BIG .GE. SIZE) GOTO 570
07003 BIG = SIZE
07004 IMXER = I
07005 570    CONTINUE
07006 IWORK(16) = IMXER
07007 ! Set Y vector, T, and optional outputs. -------------------------------
07008 580  DO 590 I = 1,N
07009 590    Y(I) = RWORK(I+LYH-1)
07010 T = TN
07011 RWORK(11) = HU
07012 RWORK(12) = H
07013 RWORK(13) = TN
07014 RWORK(15) = TSW
07015 IWORK(11) = NST
07016 IWORK(12) = NFE
07017 IWORK(13) = NJE
07018 IWORK(14) = NQU
07019 IWORK(15) = NQ
07020 IWORK(19) = MUSED
07021 IWORK(20) = METH
07022 IWORK(10) = NGE
07023 TLAST = T
07024 RETURN
07025 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
07026 ! Block I.
07027 ! The following block handles all error returns due to illegal input
07028 ! (ISTATE = -3), as detected before calling the core integrator.
07029 ! First the error message routine is called.  If the illegal input
07030 ! is a negative ISTATE, the run is aborted (apparent infinite loop).
07031 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
07032 601  MSG = 'DLSODAR-  ISTATE(=I1) illegal.'
07033 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 1, 0, 1, ISTATE, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
07034 IF (ISTATE .LT. 0) GOTO 800
07035 GOTO 700
07036 602  MSG = 'DLSODAR-  ITASK (=I1) illegal.'
07037 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 2, 0, 1, ITASK, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
07038 GOTO 700
07039 603  MSG = 'DLSODAR-  ISTATE.gt.1 but DLSODAR not initialized.'
07040 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 3, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
07041 GOTO 700
07042 604  MSG = 'DLSODAR-  NEQ (=I1) .lt. 1    '
07043 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 4, 0, 1, NEQ(1), 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
07044 GOTO 700
07045 605  MSG = 'DLSODAR-  ISTATE = 3 and NEQ increased (I1 to I2).'
07046 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 5, 0, 2, N, NEQ(1), 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
07047 GOTO 700
07048 606  MSG = 'DLSODAR-  ITOL (=I1) illegal. '
07049 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 6, 0, 1, ITOL, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
07050 GOTO 700
07051 607  MSG = 'DLSODAR-  IOPT (=I1) illegal. '
07052 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 7, 0, 1, IOPT, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
07053 GOTO 700
07054 608  MSG = 'DLSODAR-  JT (=I1) illegal.   '
07055 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 8, 0, 1, JT, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
07056 GOTO 700
07057 609  MSG = 'DLSODAR-  ML (=I1) illegal: .lt.0 or .ge.NEQ (=I2)'
07058 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 9, 0, 2, ML, NEQ(1), 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
07059 GOTO 700
07060 610  MSG = 'DLSODAR-  MU (=I1) illegal: .lt.0 or .ge.NEQ (=I2)'
07061 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 10, 0, 2, MU, NEQ(1), 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
07062 GOTO 700
07063 611  MSG = 'DLSODAR-  IXPR (=I1) illegal. '
07064 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 11, 0, 1, IXPR, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
07065 GOTO 700
07066 612  MSG = 'DLSODAR-  MXSTEP (=I1) .lt. 0 '
07067 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 12, 0, 1, MXSTEP, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
07068 GOTO 700
07069 613  MSG = 'DLSODAR-  MXHNIL (=I1) .lt. 0 '
07070 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 13, 0, 1, MXHNIL, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
07071 GOTO 700
07072 614  MSG = 'DLSODAR-  TOUT (=R1) behind T (=R2)     '
07073 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 40, 14, 0, 0, 0, 0, 2, TOUT, T)
07074 MSG = '      Integration direction is given by H0 (=R1)  '
07075 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 14, 0, 0, 0, 0, 1, H0, 0.0D0)
07076 GOTO 700
07077 615  MSG = 'DLSODAR-  HMAX (=R1) .lt. 0.0 '
07078 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 15, 0, 0, 0, 0, 1, HMAX, 0.0D0)
07079 GOTO 700
07080 616  MSG = 'DLSODAR-  HMIN (=R1) .lt. 0.0 '
07081 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 16, 0, 0, 0, 0, 1, HMIN, 0.0D0)
07082 GOTO 700
07083 617  MSG='DLSODAR-  RWORK length needed, LENRW(=I1), exceeds LRW(=I2) '
07084 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 17, 0, 2, LENRW, LRW, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
07085 GOTO 700
07086 618  MSG='DLSODAR-  IWORK length needed, LENIW(=I1), exceeds LIW(=I2) '
07087 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 18, 0, 2, LENIW, LIW, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
07088 GOTO 700
07089 619  MSG = 'DLSODAR-  RTOL(I1) is R1 .lt. 0.0       '
07090 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 40, 19, 0, 1, I, 0, 1, RTOLI, 0.0D0)
07091 GOTO 700
07092 620  MSG = 'DLSODAR-  ATOL(I1) is R1 .lt. 0.0       '
07093 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 40, 20, 0, 1, I, 0, 1, ATOLI, 0.0D0)
07094 GOTO 700
07095 621  EWTI = RWORK(LEWT+I-1)
07096 MSG = 'DLSODAR-  EWT(I1) is R1 .le. 0.0        '
07097 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 40, 21, 0, 1, I, 0, 1, EWTI, 0.0D0)
07098 GOTO 700
07099 622  MSG='DLSODAR- TOUT(=R1) too close to T(=R2) to start integration.'
07100 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 22, 0, 0, 0, 0, 2, TOUT, T)
07101 GOTO 700
07102 623  MSG='DLSODAR-  ITASK = I1 and TOUT (=R1) behind TCUR - HU (= R2) '
07103 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 23, 0, 1, ITASK, 0, 2, TOUT, TP)
07104 GOTO 700
07105 624  MSG='DLSODAR-  ITASK = 4 or 5 and TCRIT (=R1) behind TCUR (=R2)  '
07106 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 24, 0, 0, 0, 0, 2, TCRIT, TN)
07107 GOTO 700
07108 625  MSG='DLSODAR-  ITASK = 4 or 5 and TCRIT (=R1) behind TOUT (=R2)  '
07109 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 25, 0, 0, 0, 0, 2, TCRIT, TOUT)
07110 GOTO 700
07111 626  MSG = 'DLSODAR-  At start of problem, too much accuracy  '
07112 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 26, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
07113 MSG='      requested for precision of machine..  See TOLSF (=R1) '
07114 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 26, 0, 0, 0, 0, 1, TOLSF, 0.0D0)
07115 RWORK(14) = TOLSF
07116 GOTO 700
07117 627  MSG = 'DLSODAR-  Trouble in DINTDY. ITASK = I1, TOUT = R1'
07118 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 27, 0, 1, ITASK, 0, 1, TOUT, 0.0D0)
07119 GOTO 700
07120 628  MSG = 'DLSODAR-  MXORDN (=I1) .lt. 0 '
07121 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 28, 0, 1, MXORDN, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
07122 GOTO 700
07123 629  MSG = 'DLSODAR-  MXORDS (=I1) .lt. 0 '
07124 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 29, 0, 1, MXORDS, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
07125 GOTO 700
07126 630  MSG = 'DLSODAR-  NG (=I1) .lt. 0     '
07127 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 30, 0, 1, NG, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
07128 GOTO 700
07129 631  MSG = 'DLSODAR-  NG changed (from I1 to I2) illegally,   '
07130 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 31, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
07131 MSG = '      i.e. not immediately after a root was found.'
07132 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 31, 0, 2, NGC, NG, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
07133 GOTO 700
07134 632  MSG = 'DLSODAR-  One or more components of g has a root  '
07135 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 32, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
07136 MSG = '      too near to the initial point.    '
07137 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 40, 32, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
07138 !
07139 700  ISTATE = -3
07140 RETURN
07141 !
07142 800  MSG = 'DLSODAR-  Run aborted.. apparent infinite loop.   '
07143 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 303, 2, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
07144 RETURN
07145 !----------------------- End of Subroutine DLSODAR ---------------------
07146 END
07147 
07148 SUBROUTINE DLSODPK (F, NEQ, Y, T, TOUT, ITOL, RTOL, ATOL, ITASK, ISTATE, IOPT, RWORK, LRW, IWORK, LIW, JAC, PSOL, MF)
07149 EXTERNAL F, JAC, PSOL
07150 INTEGER NEQ, ITOL, ITASK, ISTATE, IOPT, LRW, IWORK, LIW, MF
07151 DOUBLE PRECISION Y, T, TOUT, RTOL, ATOL, RWORK
07152 DIMENSION NEQ(*), Y(*), RTOL(*), ATOL(*), RWORK(LRW), IWORK(LIW)
07153 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
07154 ! This is the 18 November 2003 version of
07155 ! DLSODPK: Livermore Solver for Ordinary Differential equations,
07156 !          with Preconditioned Krylov iteration methods for the
07157 !          Newton correction linear systems.
07158 !
07159 ! This version is in double precision.
07160 !
07161 ! DLSODPK solves the initial value problem for stiff or nonstiff
07162 ! systems of first order ODEs,
07163 !     dy/dt = f(t,y) ,  or, in component form,
07164 !     dy(i)/dt = f(i) = f(i,t,y(1),y(2),...,y(NEQ)) (i = 1,...,NEQ).
07165 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
07166 ! Introduction.
07167 !
07168 ! This is a modification of the DLSODE package which incorporates
07169 ! various preconditioned Krylov subspace iteration methods for the
07170 ! linear algebraic systems that arise in the case of stiff systems.
07171 !
07172 ! The linear systems that must be solved have the form
07173 !   A * x  = b ,  where  A = identity - hl0 * (df/dy) .
07174 ! Here hl0 is a scalar, and df/dy is the Jacobian matrix of partial
07175 ! derivatives of f (NEQ by NEQ).
07176 !
07177 ! The particular Krylov method is chosen by setting the second digit,
07178 ! MITER, in the method flag MF.
07179 ! Currently, the values of MITER have the following meanings:
07180 !
07181 !  MITER = 1 means the preconditioned Scaled Incomplete
07182 !            Orthogonalization Method (SPIOM).
07183 !
07184 !          2 means an incomplete version of the Preconditioned Scaled
07185 !            Generalized Minimal Residual method (SPIGMR).
07186 !            This is the best choice in general.
07187 !
07188 !          3 means the Preconditioned Conjugate Gradient method (PCG).
07189 !            Recommended only when df/dy is symmetric or nearly so.
07190 !
07191 !          4 means the scaled Preconditioned Conjugate Gradient method
07192 !            (PCGS).  Recommended only when D-inverse * df/dy * D is
07193 !            symmetric or nearly so, where D is the diagonal scaling
07194 !            matrix with elements 1/EWT(i) (see RTOL/ATOL description).
07195 !
07196 !          9 means that only a user-supplied matrix P (approximating A)
07197 !            will be used, with no Krylov iteration done.  This option
07198 !            allows the user to provide the complete linear system
07199 !            solution algorithm, if desired.
07200 !
07201 ! The user can apply preconditioning to the linear system A*x = b,
07202 ! by means of arbitrary matrices (the preconditioners).
07203 !     In the case of SPIOM and SPIGMR, one can apply left and right
07204 ! preconditioners P1 and P2, and the basic iterative method is then
07205 ! applied to the matrix (P1-inverse)*A*(P2-inverse) instead of to the
07206 ! matrix A.  The product P1*P2 should be an approximation to matrix A
07207 ! such that linear systems with P1 or P2 are easier to solve than with
07208 ! A.  Preconditioning from the left only or right only means using
07209 ! P2 = identity or P1 = identity, respectively.
07210 !     In the case of the PCG and PCGS methods, there is only one
07211 ! preconditioner matrix P (but it can be the product of more than one).
07212 ! It should approximate the matrix A but allow for relatively
07213 ! easy solution of linear systems with coefficient matrix P.
07214 ! For PCG, P should be positive definite symmetric, or nearly so,
07215 ! and for PCGS, the scaled preconditioner D-inverse * P * D
07216 ! should be symmetric or nearly so.
07217 !     If the Jacobian J = df/dy splits in a natural way into a sum
07218 ! J = J1 + J2, then one possible choice of preconditioners is
07219 !     P1 = identity - hl0 * J1  and  P2 = identity - hl0 * J2
07220 ! provided each of these is easy to solve (or approximately solve).
07221 !
07222 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
07223 ! References:
07224 ! 1.  Peter N. Brown and Alan C. Hindmarsh, Reduced Storage Matrix
07225 !     Methods in Stiff ODE Systems, J. Appl. Math. & Comp., 31 (1989),
07226 !     pp. 40-91; also  L.L.N.L. Report UCRL-95088, Rev. 1, June 1987.
07227 ! 2.  Alan C. Hindmarsh,  ODEPACK, A Systematized Collection of ODE
07228 !     Solvers, in Scientific Computing, R. S. Stepleman et al. (Eds.),
07229 !     North-Holland, Amsterdam, 1983, pp. 55-64.
07230 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
07231 ! Authors:       Alan C. Hindmarsh and Peter N. Brown
07232 !                Center for Applied Scientific Computing, L-561
07233 !                Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory
07234 !                Livermore, CA 94551
07235 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
07236 ! Summary of Usage.
07237 !
07238 ! Communication between the user and the DLSODPK package, for normal
07239 ! situations, is summarized here.  This summary describes only a subset
07240 ! of the full set of options available.  See the full description for
07241 ! details, including optional communication, nonstandard options,
07242 ! and instructions for special situations.  See also the demonstration
07243 ! program distributed with this solver.
07244 !
07245 ! A. First provide a subroutine of the form:
07246 !               SUBROUTINE F (NEQ, T, Y, YDOT)
07247 !               DOUBLE PRECISION T, Y(*), YDOT(*)
07248 ! which supplies the vector function f by loading YDOT(i) with f(i).
07249 !
07250 ! B. Next determine (or guess) whether or not the problem is stiff.
07251 ! Stiffness occurs when the Jacobian matrix df/dy has an eigenvalue
07252 ! whose real part is negative and large in magnitude, compared to the
07253 ! reciprocal of the t span of interest.  If the problem is nonstiff,
07254 ! use a method flag MF = 10.  If it is stiff, MF should be between 21
07255 ! and 24, or possibly 29.  MF = 22 is generally the best choice.
07256 ! Use 23 or 24 only if symmetry is present.  Use MF = 29 if the
07257 ! complete linear system solution is to be provided by the user.
07258 ! The following four parameters must also be set.
07259 !  IWORK(1) = LWP  = length of real array WP for preconditioning.
07260 !  IWORK(2) = LIWP = length of integer array IWP for preconditioning.
07261 !  IWORK(3) = JPRE = preconditioner type flag:
07262 !                  = 0 for no preconditioning (P1 = P2 = P = identity)
07263 !                  = 1 for left-only preconditioning (P2 = identity)
07264 !                  = 2 for right-only preconditioning (P1 = identity)
07265 !                  = 3 for two-sided preconditioning (and PCG or PCGS)
07266 !  IWORK(4) = JACFLG = flag for whether JAC is called.
07267 !                    = 0 if JAC is not to be called,
07268 !                    = 1 if JAC is to be called.
07269 !  Use JACFLG = 1 if JAC computes any nonconstant data for use in
07270 !  preconditioning, such as Jacobian elements.
07271 !  The arrays WP and IWP are work arrays under the user's control,
07272 !  for use in the routines that perform preconditioning operations.
07273 !
07274 ! C. If the problem is stiff, you must supply two routines that deal
07275 ! with the preconditioning of the linear systems to be solved.
07276 ! These are as follows:
07277 !
07278 !     SUBROUTINE JAC (F, NEQ, T, Y, YSV, REWT, FTY, V, HL0, WP,IWP, IER)
07279 !     DOUBLE PRECISION T, Y(*),YSV(*), REWT(*), FTY(*), V(*), HL0, WP(*)
07280 !     INTEGER IWP(*)
07281 !        This routine must evaluate and preprocess any parts of the
07282 !     Jacobian matrix df/dy involved in the preconditioners P1, P2, P.
07283 !     The Y and FTY arrays contain the current values of y and f(t,y),
07284 !     respectively, and YSV also contains the current value of y.
07285 !     The array V is work space of length NEQ.
07286 !     JAC must multiply all computed Jacobian elements by the scalar
07287 !     -HL0, add the identity matrix, and do any factorization
07288 !     operations called for, in preparation for solving linear systems
07289 !     with a coefficient matrix of P1, P2, or P.  The matrix P1*P2 or P
07290 !     should be an approximation to  identity - HL0 * (df/dy).
07291 !     JAC should return IER = 0 if successful, and IER .ne. 0 if not.
07292 !     (If IER .ne. 0, a smaller time step will be tried.)
07293 !
07294 !     SUBROUTINE PSOL (NEQ, T, Y, FTY, WK, HL0, WP, IWP, B, LR, IER)
07295 !     DOUBLE PRECISION T, Y(*), FTY(*), WK(*), HL0, WP(*), B(*)
07296 !     INTEGER IWP(*)
07297 !        This routine must solve a linear system with B as right-hand
07298 !     side and one of the preconditioning matrices, P1, P2, or P, as
07299 !     coefficient matrix, and return the solution vector in B.
07300 !     LR is a flag concerning left vs right preconditioning, input
07301 !     to PSOL.  PSOL is to use P1 if LR = 1 and P2 if LR = 2.
07302 !     In the case of the PCG or PCGS method, LR will be 3, and PSOL
07303 !     should solve the system P*x = B with the preconditioner matrix P.
07304 !     In the case MF = 29 (no Krylov iteration), LR will be 0,
07305 !     and PSOL is to return in B the desired approximate solution
07306 !     to A * x = B, where A = identity - HL0 * (df/dy).
07307 !     PSOL can use data generated in the JAC routine and stored in
07308 !     WP and IWP.  WK is a work array of length NEQ.
07309 !     The argument HL0 is the current value of the scalar appearing
07310 !     in the linear system.  If the old value, at the time of the last
07311 !     JAC call, is needed, it must have been saved by JAC in WP.
07312 !     On return, PSOL should set the error flag IER as follows:
07313 !       IER = 0 if PSOL was successful,
07314 !       IER .gt. 0 if a recoverable error occurred, meaning that the
07315 !              time step will be retried,
07316 !       IER .lt. 0 if an unrecoverable error occurred, meaning that the
07317 !              solver is to stop immediately.
07318 !
07319 ! D. Write a main program which calls Subroutine DLSODPK once for
07320 ! each point at which answers are desired.  This should also provide
07321 ! for possible use of logical unit 6 for output of error messages by
07322 ! DLSODPK.  On the first call to DLSODPK, supply arguments as follows:
07323 ! F      = name of subroutine for right-hand side vector f.
07324 !          This name must be declared External in calling program.
07325 ! NEQ    = number of first order ODEs.
07326 ! Y      = array of initial values, of length NEQ.
07327 ! T      = the initial value of the independent variable.
07328 ! TOUT   = first point where output is desired (.ne. T).
07329 ! ITOL   = 1 or 2 according as ATOL (below) is a scalar or array.
07330 ! RTOL   = relative tolerance parameter (scalar).
07331 ! ATOL   = absolute tolerance parameter (scalar or array).
07332 !          the estimated local error in y(i) will be controlled so as
07333 !          to be roughly less (in magnitude) than
07334 !             EWT(i) = RTOL*ABS(Y(i)) + ATOL     if ITOL = 1, or
07335 !             EWT(i) = RTOL*ABS(Y(i)) + ATOL(i)  if ITOL = 2.
07336 !          Thus the local error test passes if, in each component,
07337 !          either the absolute error is less than ATOL (or ATOL(i)),
07338 !          or the relative error is less than RTOL.
07339 !          Use RTOL = 0.0 for pure absolute error control, and
07340 !          use ATOL = 0.0 (or ATOL(i) = 0.0) for pure relative error
07341 !          control.  Caution: Actual (global) errors may exceed these
07342 !          local tolerances, so choose them conservatively.
07343 ! ITASK  = 1 for normal computation of output values of y at t = TOUT.
07344 ! ISTATE = integer flag (input and output).  Set ISTATE = 1.
07345 ! IOPT   = 0 to indicate no optional inputs used.
07346 ! RWORK  = real work array of length at least:
07347 !             20 + 16*NEQ           for MF = 10,
07348 !             45 + 17*NEQ + LWP     for MF = 21,
07349 !             61 + 17*NEQ + LWP     for MF = 22,
07350 !             20 + 15*NEQ + LWP     for MF = 23 or 24,
07351 !             20 + 12*NEQ + LWP     for MF = 29.
07352 ! LRW    = declared length of RWORK (in user's dimension).
07353 ! IWORK  = integer work array of length at least:
07354 !             30            for MF = 10,
07355 !             35 + LIWP     for MF = 21,
07356 !             30 + LIWP     for MF = 22, 23, 24, or 29.
07357 ! LIW    = declared length of IWORK (in user's dimension).
07358 ! JAC,PSOL = names of subroutines for preconditioning.
07359 !          These names must be declared External in the calling program.
07360 ! MF     = method flag.  Standard values are:
07361 !          10 for nonstiff (Adams) method.
07362 !          21 for stiff (BDF) method, with preconditioned SIOM.
07363 !          22 for stiff method, with preconditioned GMRES method.
07364 !          23 for stiff method, with preconditioned CG method.
07365 !          24 for stiff method, with scaled preconditioned CG method.
07366 !          29 for stiff method, with user's PSOL routine only.
07367 ! Note that the main program must declare arrays Y, RWORK, IWORK,
07368 ! and possibly ATOL.
07369 !
07370 ! E. The output from the first call (or any call) is:
07371 !      Y = array of computed values of y(t) vector.
07372 !      T = corresponding value of independent variable (normally TOUT).
07373 ! ISTATE = 2  if DLSODPK was successful, negative otherwise.
07374 !          -1 means excess work done on this call (perhaps wrong MF).
07375 !          -2 means excess accuracy requested (tolerances too small).
07376 !          -3 means illegal input detected (see printed message).
07377 !          -4 means repeated error test failures (check all inputs).
07378 !          -5 means repeated convergence failures (perhaps bad JAC
07379 !             or PSOL routine supplied or wrong choice of MF or
07380 !             tolerances, or this solver is inappropriate).
07381 !          -6 means error weight became zero during problem. (Solution
07382 !             component i vanished, and ATOL or ATOL(i) = 0.)
07383 !          -7 means an unrecoverable error occurred in PSOL.
07384 !
07385 ! F. To continue the integration after a successful return, simply
07386 ! reset TOUT and call DLSODPK again.  No other parameters need be reset.
07387 !
07388 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
07389 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
07390 ! Full Description of User Interface to DLSODPK.
07391 !
07392 ! The user interface to DLSODPK consists of the following parts.
07393 !
07394 ! 1.   The call sequence to Subroutine DLSODPK, which is a driver
07395 !      routine for the solver.  This includes descriptions of both
07396 !      the call sequence arguments and of user-supplied routines.
07397 !      Following these descriptions is a description of
07398 !      optional inputs available through the call sequence, and then
07399 !      a description of optional outputs (in the work arrays).
07400 !
07401 ! 2.   Descriptions of other routines in the DLSODPK package that may be
07402 !      (optionally) called by the user.  These provide the ability to
07403 !      alter error message handling, save and restore the internal
07404 !      Common, and obtain specified derivatives of the solution y(t).
07405 !
07406 ! 3.   Descriptions of Common blocks to be declared in overlay
07407 !      or similar environments, or to be saved when doing an interrupt
07408 !      of the problem and continued solution later.
07409 !
07410 ! 4.   Description of two routines in the DLSODPK package, either of
07411 !      which the user may replace with his/her own version, if desired.
07412 !      These relate to the measurement of errors.
07413 !
07414 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
07415 ! Part 1.  Call Sequence.
07416 !
07417 ! The call sequence parameters used for input only are
07418 !  F, NEQ, TOUT, ITOL, RTOL, ATOL, ITASK, IOPT, LRW, LIW, JAC, PSOL, MF,
07419 ! and those used for both input and output are
07420 !  Y, T, ISTATE.
07421 ! The work arrays RWORK and IWORK are also used for conditional and
07422 ! optional inputs and optional outputs.  (The term output here refers
07423 ! to the return from Subroutine DLSODPK to the user's calling program.)
07424 !
07425 ! The legality of input parameters will be thoroughly checked on the
07426 ! initial call for the problem, but not checked thereafter unless a
07427 ! change in input parameters is flagged by ISTATE = 3 on input.
07428 !
07429 ! The descriptions of the call arguments are as follows.
07430 !
07431 ! F      = the name of the user-supplied subroutine defining the
07432 !          ODE system.  The system must be put in the first-order
07433 !          form dy/dt = f(t,y), where f is a vector-valued function
07434 !          of the scalar t and the vector y.  Subroutine F is to
07435 !          compute the function f.  It is to have the form
07436 !               SUBROUTINE F (NEQ, T, Y, YDOT)
07437 !               DOUBLE PRECISION T, Y(*), YDOT(*)
07438 !          where NEQ, T, and Y are input, and the array YDOT = f(t,y)
07439 !          is output.  Y and YDOT are arrays of length NEQ.
07440 !          Subroutine F should not alter Y(1),...,Y(NEQ).
07441 !          F must be declared External in the calling program.
07442 !
07443 !          Subroutine F may access user-defined quantities in
07444 !          NEQ(2),... and/or in Y(NEQ(1)+1),... if NEQ is an array
07445 !          (dimensioned in F) and/or Y has length exceeding NEQ(1).
07446 !          See the descriptions of NEQ and Y below.
07447 !
07448 !          If quantities computed in the F routine are needed
07449 !          externally to DLSODPK, an extra call to F should be made
07450 !          for this purpose, for consistent and accurate results.
07451 !          If only the derivative dy/dt is needed, use DINTDY instead.
07452 !
07453 ! NEQ    = the size of the ODE system (number of first order
07454 !          ordinary differential equations).  Used only for input.
07455 !          NEQ may be decreased, but not increased, during the problem.
07456 !          If NEQ is decreased (with ISTATE = 3 on input), the
07457 !          remaining components of Y should be left undisturbed, if
07458 !          these are to be accessed in the user-supplied subroutines.
07459 !
07460 !          Normally, NEQ is a scalar, and it is generally referred to
07461 !          as a scalar in this user interface description.  However,
07462 !          NEQ may be an array, with NEQ(1) set to the system size.
07463 !          (The DLSODPK package accesses only NEQ(1).)  In either case,
07464 !          this parameter is passed as the NEQ argument in all calls
07465 !          to F, JAC, and PSOL.  Hence, if it is an array, locations
07466 !          NEQ(2),... may be used to store other integer data and pass
07467 !          it to the user-supplied subroutines.  Each such routine must
07468 !          include NEQ in a Dimension statement in that case.
07469 !
07470 ! Y      = a real array for the vector of dependent variables, of
07471 !          length NEQ or more.  Used for both input and output on the
07472 !          first call (ISTATE = 1), and only for output on other calls.
07473 !          On the first call, Y must contain the vector of initial
07474 !          values.  On output, Y contains the computed solution vector,
07475 !          evaluated at T.  If desired, the Y array may be used
07476 !          for other purposes between calls to the solver.
07477 !
07478 !          This array is passed as the Y argument in all calls to F,
07479 !          JAC, and PSOL. Hence its length may exceed NEQ, and locations
07480 !          Y(NEQ+1),... may be used to store other real data and
07481 !          pass it to the user-supplied subroutines.  (The DLSODPK
07482 !          package accesses only Y(1),...,Y(NEQ).)
07483 !
07484 ! T      = the independent variable.  On input, T is used only on the
07485 !          first call, as the initial point of the integration.
07486 !          On output, after each call, T is the value at which a
07487 !          computed solution y is evaluated (usually the same as TOUT).
07488 !          On an error return, T is the farthest point reached.
07489 !
07490 ! TOUT   = the next value of t at which a computed solution is desired.
07491 !          Used only for input.
07492 !
07493 !          When starting the problem (ISTATE = 1), TOUT may be equal
07494 !          to T for one call, then should .ne. T for the next call.
07495 !          For the initial T, an input value of TOUT .ne. T is used
07496 !          in order to determine the direction of the integration
07497 !          (i.e. the algebraic sign of the step sizes) and the rough
07498 !          scale of the problem.  Integration in either direction
07499 !          (forward or backward in t) is permitted.
07500 !
07501 !          If ITASK = 2 or 5 (one-step modes), TOUT is ignored after
07502 !          the first call (i.e. the first call with TOUT .ne. T).
07503 !          Otherwise, TOUT is required on every call.
07504 !
07505 !          If ITASK = 1, 3, or 4, the values of TOUT need not be
07506 !          monotone, but a value of TOUT which backs up is limited
07507 !          to the current internal T interval, whose endpoints are
07508 !          TCUR - HU and TCUR (see optional outputs, below, for
07509 !          TCUR and HU).
07510 !
07511 ! ITOL   = an indicator for the type of error control.  See
07512 !          description below under ATOL.  Used only for input.
07513 !
07514 ! RTOL   = a relative error tolerance parameter, either a scalar or
07515 !          an array of length NEQ.  See description below under ATOL.
07516 !          Input only.
07517 !
07518 ! ATOL   = an absolute error tolerance parameter, either a scalar or
07519 !          an array of length NEQ.  Input only.
07520 !
07521 !             The input parameters ITOL, RTOL, and ATOL determine
07522 !          the error control performed by the solver.  The solver will
07523 !          control the vector E = (E(i)) of estimated local errors
07524 !          in y, according to an inequality of the form
07525 !                      RMS-norm of ( E(i)/EWT(i) )   .le.   1,
07526 !          where       EWT(i) = RTOL(i)*ABS(Y(i)) + ATOL(i),
07527 !          and the RMS-norm (root-mean-square norm) here is
07528 !          RMS-norm(v) = SQRT(sum v(i)**2 / NEQ).  Here EWT = (EWT(i))
07529 !          is a vector of weights which must always be positive, and
07530 !          the values of RTOL and ATOL should all be non-negative.
07531 !          the following table gives the types (scalar/array) of
07532 !          RTOL and ATOL, and the corresponding form of EWT(i).
07533 !
07534 !             ITOL    RTOL       ATOL          EWT(i)
