14989 !             a change in input parameters other than
14990 !             TOUT and ITASK.  Changes are allowed in
14991 !             NEQ, ITOL, RTOL, ATOL, IOPT, LRW, LIW, MF,
14992 !             the conditional inputs IA, JA, IC, and JC,
14993 !             and any of the optional inputs except H0.
14994 !             A call with ISTATE = 3 will cause the sparsity
14995 !             structure of the problem to be recomputed.
14996 !             (Structure information is reread from IA and JA if
14997 !             MOSS = 0, 3, or 4 and from IC and JC if MOSS = 0).
14998 !          Note:  A preliminary call with TOUT = T is not counted
14999 !          as a first call here, as no initialization or checking of
15000 !          input is done.  (Such a call is sometimes useful for the
15001 !          purpose of outputting the initial conditions.)
15002 !          Thus the first call for which TOUT .ne. T requires
15003 !          ISTATE = 0 or 1 on input.
15004 !
15005 !          On output, ISTATE has the following values and meanings.
15006 !           0 or 1  means nothing was done; TOUT = T and
15007 !              ISTATE = 0 or 1 on input.
15008 !           2  means that the integration was performed successfully.
15009 !           3  means that the user-supplied Subroutine RES signalled
15010 !              DLSODIS to halt the integration and return (IRES = 2).
15011 !              Integration as far as T was achieved with no occurrence
15012 !              of IRES = 2, but this flag was set on attempting the
15013 !              next step.
15014 !          -1  means an excessive amount of work (more than MXSTEP
15015 !              steps) was done on this call, before completing the
15016 !              requested task, but the integration was otherwise
15017 !              successful as far as T.  (MXSTEP is an optional input
15018 !              and is normally 500.)  To continue, the user may
15019 !              simply reset ISTATE to a value .gt. 1 and call again
15020 !              (the excess work step counter will be reset to 0).
15021 !              In addition, the user may increase MXSTEP to avoid
15022 !              this error return (see below on optional inputs).
15023 !          -2  means too much accuracy was requested for the precision
15024 !              of the machine being used.  This was detected before
15025 !              completing the requested task, but the integration
15026 !              was successful as far as T.  To continue, the tolerance
15027 !              parameters must be reset, and ISTATE must be set
15028 !              to 3.  The optional output TOLSF may be used for this
15029 !              purpose.  (Note: If this condition is detected before
15030 !              taking any steps, then an illegal input return
15031 !              (ISTATE = -3) occurs instead.)
15032 !          -3  means illegal input was detected, before taking any
15033 !              integration steps.  See written message for details.
15034 !              Note:  If the solver detects an infinite loop of calls
15035 !              to the solver with illegal input, it will cause
15036 !              the run to stop.
15037 !          -4  means there were repeated error test failures on
15038 !              one attempted step, before completing the requested
15039 !              task, but the integration was successful as far as T.
15040 !              The problem may have a singularity, or the input
15041 !              may be inappropriate.
15042 !          -5  means there were repeated convergence test failures on
15043 !              one attempted step, before completing the requested
15044 !              task, but the integration was successful as far as T.
15045 !              This may be caused by an inaccurate Jacobian matrix.
15046 !          -6  means EWT(i) became zero for some i during the
15047 !              integration.  Pure relative error control (ATOL(i) = 0.0)
15048 !              was requested on a variable which has now vanished.
15049 !              the integration was successful as far as T.
15050 !          -7  means that the user-supplied Subroutine RES set
15051 !              its error flag (IRES = 3) despite repeated tries by
15052 !              DLSODIS to avoid that condition.
15053 !          -8  means that ISTATE was 0 on input but DLSODIS was unable
15054 !              to compute the initial value of dy/dt.  See the
15055 !              printed message for details.
15056 !          -9  means a fatal error return flag came from the sparse
15057 !              solver CDRV by way of DPRJIS or DSOLSS (numerical
15058 !              factorization or backsolve).  This should never happen.
15059 !              The integration was successful as far as T.
15060 !
15061 !          Note: An error return with ISTATE = -1, -4, or -5
15062 !          may mean that the sparsity structure of the
15063 !          problem has changed significantly since it was last
15064 !          determined (or input).  In that case, one can attempt to
15065 !          complete the integration by setting ISTATE = 3 on the next
15066 !          call, so that a new structure determination is done.
15067 !
15068 !          Note:  Since the normal output value of ISTATE is 2,
15069 !          it does not need to be reset for normal continuation.
15070 !          similarly, ISTATE (= 3) need not be reset if RES told
15071 !          DLSODIS to return because the calling program must change
15072 !          the parameters of the problem.
15073 !          Also, since a negative input value of ISTATE will be
15074 !          regarded as illegal, a negative output value requires the
15075 !          user to change it, and possibly other inputs, before
15076 !          calling the solver again.
15077 !
15078 ! IOPT   = an integer flag to specify whether or not any optional
15079 !          inputs are being used on this call.  Input only.
15080 !          The optional inputs are listed separately below.
15081 !          IOPT = 0 means no optional inputs are being used.
15082 !                   Default values will be used in all cases.
15083 !          IOPT = 1 means one or more optional inputs are being used.
15084 !
15085 ! RWORK  = a work array used for a mixture of real (double precision)
15086 !          and integer work space.
15087 !          The length of RWORK (in real words) must be at least
15088 !             20 + NYH*(MAXORD + 1) + 3*NEQ + LWM    where
15089 !          NYH    = the initial value of NEQ,
15090 !          MAXORD = 12 (if METH = 1) or 5 (if METH = 2) (unless a
15091 !                   smaller value is given as an optional input),
15092 !          LWM = 2*NNZ + 2*NEQ + (NNZ+9*NEQ)/LENRAT   if MITER = 1,
15093 !          LWM = 2*NNZ + 2*NEQ + (NNZ+10*NEQ)/LENRAT  if MITER = 2.
15094 !          in the above formulas,
15095 !          NNZ    = number of nonzero elements in the iteration matrix
15096 !                   P = A - con*J  (con is a constant and J is the
15097 !                   Jacobian matrix dr/dy).
15098 !          LENRAT = the real to integer wordlength ratio (usually 1 in
15099 !                   single precision and 2 in double precision).
15100 !          (See the MF description for METH and MITER.)
15101 !          Thus if MAXORD has its default value and NEQ is constant,
15102 !          the minimum length of RWORK is:
15103 !             20 + 16*NEQ + LWM  for MF = 11, 111, 311, 12, 212, 412,
15104 !             20 +  9*NEQ + LWM  for MF = 21, 121, 321, 22, 222, 422.
15105 !          The above formula for LWM is only a crude lower bound.
15106 !          The required length of RWORK cannot be readily predicted
15107 !          in general, as it depends on the sparsity structure
15108 !          of the problem.  Some experimentation may be necessary.
15109 !
15110 !          The first 20 words of RWORK are reserved for conditional
15111 !          and optional inputs and optional outputs.
15112 !
15113 !          The following word in RWORK is a conditional input:
15114 !            RWORK(1) = TCRIT = critical value of t which the solver
15115 !                       is not to overshoot.  Required if ITASK is
15116 !                       4 or 5, and ignored otherwise.  (See ITASK.)
15117 !
15118 ! LRW    = the length of the array RWORK, as declared by the user.
15119 !          (This will be checked by the solver.)
15120 !
15121 ! IWORK  = an integer work array.  The length of IWORK must be at least
15122 !            32 + 2*NEQ + NZA + NZC   for MOSS = 0,
15123 !            30                       for MOSS = 1 or 2,
15124 !            31 + NEQ + NZA           for MOSS = 3 or 4.
15125 !          (NZA is the number of nonzero elements in matrix A, and
15126 !          NZC is the number of nonzero elements in dr/dy.)
15127 !
15128 !          In DLSODIS, IWORK is used for conditional and
15129 !          optional inputs and optional outputs.
15130 !
15131 !          The following two blocks of words in IWORK are conditional
15132 !          inputs, required if MOSS = 0, 3, or 4, but not otherwise
15133 !          (see the description of MF for MOSS).
15134 !            IWORK(30+j) = IA(j)     (j=1,...,NEQ+1)
15135 !            IWORK(31+NEQ+k) = JA(k) (k=1,...,NZA)
15136 !          The two arrays IA and JA describe the sparsity structure
15137 !          to be assumed for the matrix A.  JA contains the row
15138 !          indices where nonzero elements occur, reading in columnwise
15139 !          order, and IA contains the starting locations in JA of the
15140 !          descriptions of columns 1,...,NEQ, in that order, with
15141 !          IA(1) = 1.  Thus, for each column index j = 1,...,NEQ, the
15142 !          values of the row index i in column j where a nonzero
15143 !          element may occur are given by
15144 !            i = JA(k),  where   IA(j) .le. k .lt. IA(j+1).
15145 !          If NZA is the total number of nonzero locations assumed,
15146 !          then the length of the JA array is NZA, and IA(NEQ+1) must
15147 !          be NZA + 1.  Duplicate entries are not allowed.
15148 !          The following additional blocks of words are required
15149 !          if MOSS = 0, but not otherwise.  If LC = 31 + NEQ + NZA, then
15150 !            IWORK(LC+j) = IC(j)       (j=1,...,NEQ+1), and
15151 !            IWORK(LC+NEQ+1+k) = JC(k) (k=1,...,NZC)
15152 !          The two arrays IC and JC describe the sparsity
15153 !          structure to be assumed for the Jacobian matrix dr/dy.
15154 !          They are used in the same manner as the above IA and JA
15155 !          arrays.  If NZC is the number of nonzero locations
15156 !          assumed, then the length of the JC array is NZC, and
15157 !          IC(NEQ+1) must be NZC + 1.  Duplicate entries are not
15158 !          allowed.
15159 !
15160 ! LIW    = the length of the array IWORK, as declared by the user.
15161 !          (This will be checked by the solver.)
15162 !
15163 ! Note:  The work arrays must not be altered between calls to DLSODIS
15164 ! for the same problem, except possibly for the conditional and
15165 ! optional inputs, and except for the last 3*NEQ words of RWORK.
15166 ! The latter space is used for internal scratch space, and so is
15167 ! available for use by the user outside DLSODIS between calls, if
15168 ! desired (but not for use by RES, ADDA, or JAC).
15169 !
15170 ! MF     = the method flag.  Used only for input.
15171 !          MF has three decimal digits-- MOSS, METH, and MITER.
15172 !          For standard options:
15173 !             MF = 100*MOSS + 10*METH + MITER.
15174 !          MOSS indicates the method to be used to obtain the sparsity
15175 !          structure of the Jacobian matrix:
15176 !            MOSS = 0 means the user has supplied IA, JA, IC, and JC
15177 !                     (see descriptions under IWORK above).
15178 !            MOSS = 1 means the user has supplied JAC (see below) and
15179 !                     the structure will be obtained from NEQ initial
15180 !                     calls to JAC and NEQ initial calls to ADDA.
15181 !            MOSS = 2 means the structure will be obtained from NEQ+1
15182 !                     initial calls to RES and NEQ initial calls to ADDA
15183 !            MOSS = 3 like MOSS = 1, except user has supplied IA and JA.
15184 !            MOSS = 4 like MOSS = 2, except user has supplied IA and JA.
15185 !          METH indicates the basic linear multistep method:
15186 !            METH = 1 means the implicit Adams method.
15187 !            METH = 2 means the method based on Backward
15188 !                     Differentiation Formulas (BDFs).
15189 !              The BDF method is strongly preferred for stiff problems,
15190 !            while the Adams method is preferred when the problem is
15191 !            not stiff.  If the matrix A(t,y) is nonsingular,
15192 !            stiffness here can be taken to mean that of the explicit
15193 !            ODE system dy/dt = A-inverse * g.  If A is singular,
15194 !            the concept of stiffness is not well defined.
15195 !              If you do not know whether the problem is stiff, we
15196 !            recommend using METH = 2.  If it is stiff, the advantage
15197 !            of METH = 2 over METH = 1 will be great, while if it is
15198 !            not stiff, the advantage of METH = 1 will be slight.
15199 !            If maximum efficiency is important, some experimentation
15200 !            with METH may be necessary.
15201 !          MITER indicates the corrector iteration method:
15202 !            MITER = 1 means chord iteration with a user-supplied
15203 !                      sparse Jacobian, given by Subroutine JAC.
15204 !            MITER = 2 means chord iteration with an internally
15205 !                      generated (difference quotient) sparse
15206 !                      Jacobian (using NGP extra calls to RES per
15207 !                      dr/dy value, where NGP is an optional
15208 !                      output described below.)
15209 !            If MITER = 1 or MOSS = 1 or 3 the user must supply a
15210 !            Subroutine JAC (the name is arbitrary) as described above
15211 !            under JAC.  Otherwise, a dummy argument can be used.
15212 !
15213 !          The standard choices for MF are:
15214 !            MF = 21 or 22 for a stiff problem with IA/JA and IC/JC
15215 !                 supplied,
15216 !            MF = 121 for a stiff problem with JAC supplied, but not
15217 !                 IA/JA or IC/JC,
15218 !            MF = 222 for a stiff problem with neither IA/JA, IC/JC/,
15219 !                 nor JAC supplied,
15220 !            MF = 321 for a stiff problem with IA/JA and JAC supplied,
15221 !                 but not IC/JC,
15222 !            MF = 422 for a stiff problem with IA/JA supplied, but not
15223 !                 IC/JC or JAC.
15224 !
15225 !          The sparseness structure can be changed during the problem
15226 !          by making a call to DLSODIS with ISTATE = 3.
15227 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
15228 ! Optional Inputs.
15229 !
15230 ! The following is a list of the optional inputs provided for in the
15231 ! call sequence.  (See also Part 2.)  For each such input variable,
15232 ! this table lists its name as used in this documentation, its
15233 ! location in the call sequence, its meaning, and the default value.
15234 ! The use of any of these inputs requires IOPT = 1, and in that
15235 ! case all of these inputs are examined.  A value of zero for any
15236 ! of these optional inputs will cause the default value to be used.
15237 ! Thus to use a subset of the optional inputs, simply preload
15238 ! locations 5 to 10 in RWORK and IWORK to 0.0 and 0 respectively, and
15239 ! then set those of interest to nonzero values.
15240 !
15241 ! Name    Location      Meaning and Default Value
15242 !
15243 ! H0      RWORK(5)  the step size to be attempted on the first step.
15244 !                   The default value is determined by the solver.
15245 !
15246 ! HMAX    RWORK(6)  the maximum absolute step size allowed.
15247 !                   The default value is infinite.
15248 !
15249 ! HMIN    RWORK(7)  the minimum absolute step size allowed.
15250 !                   The default value is 0.  (This lower bound is not
15251 !                   enforced on the final step before reaching TCRIT
15252 !                   when ITASK = 4 or 5.)
15253 !
15254 ! MAXORD  IWORK(5)  the maximum order to be allowed.  The default
15255 !                   value is 12 if METH = 1, and 5 if METH = 2.
15256 !                   If MAXORD exceeds the default value, it will
15257 !                   be reduced to the default value.
15258 !                   If MAXORD is changed during the problem, it may
15259 !                   cause the current order to be reduced.
15260 !
15261 ! MXSTEP  IWORK(6)  maximum number of (internally defined) steps
15262 !                   allowed during one call to the solver.
15263 !                   The default value is 500.
15264 !
15265 ! MXHNIL  IWORK(7)  maximum number of messages printed (per problem)
15266 !                   warning that T + H = T on a step (H = step size).
15267 !                   This must be positive to result in a non-default
15268 !                   value.  The default value is 10.
15269 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
15270 ! Optional Outputs.
15271 !
15272 ! As optional additional output from DLSODIS, the variables listed
15273 ! below are quantities related to the performance of DLSODIS
15274 ! which are available to the user.  These are communicated by way of
15275 ! the work arrays, but also have internal mnemonic names as shown.
15276 ! Except where stated otherwise, all of these outputs are defined
15277 ! on any successful return from DLSODIS, and on any return with
15278 ! ISTATE = -1, -2, -4, -5, -6, or -7.  On a return with -3 (illegal
15279 ! input) or -8, they will be unchanged from their existing values
15280 ! (if any), except possibly for TOLSF, LENRW, and LENIW.
15281 ! On any error return, outputs relevant to the error will be defined,
15282 ! as noted below.
15283 !
15284 ! Name    Location      Meaning
15285 !
15286 ! HU      RWORK(11) the step size in t last used (successfully).
15287 !
15288 ! HCUR    RWORK(12) the step size to be attempted on the next step.
15289 !
15290 ! TCUR    RWORK(13) the current value of the independent variable
15291 !                   which the solver has actually reached, i.e. the
15292 !                   current internal mesh point in t.  On output, TCUR
15293 !                   will always be at least as far as the argument
15294 !                   T, but may be farther (if interpolation was done).
15295 !
15296 ! TOLSF   RWORK(14) a tolerance scale factor, greater than 1.0,
15297 !                   computed when a request for too much accuracy was
15298 !                   detected (ISTATE = -3 if detected at the start of
15299 !                   the problem, ISTATE = -2 otherwise).  If ITOL is
15300 !                   left unaltered but RTOL and ATOL are uniformly
15301 !                   scaled up by a factor of TOLSF for the next call,
15302 !                   then the solver is deemed likely to succeed.
15303 !                   (The user may also ignore TOLSF and alter the
15304 !                   tolerance parameters in any other way appropriate.)
15305 !
15306 ! NST     IWORK(11) the number of steps taken for the problem so far.
15307 !
15308 ! NRE     IWORK(12) the number of residual evaluations (RES calls)
15309 !                   for the problem so far, excluding those for
15310 !                   structure determination (MOSS = 2 or 4).
15311 !
15312 ! NJE     IWORK(13) the number of Jacobian evaluations (each involving
15313 !                   an evaluation of A and dr/dy) for the problem so
15314 !                   far, excluding those for structure determination
15315 !                   (MOSS = 1 or 3).  This equals the number of calls
15316 !                   to ADDA and (if MITER = 1) JAC.
15317 !
15318 ! NQU     IWORK(14) the method order last used (successfully).
15319 !
15320 ! NQCUR   IWORK(15) the order to be attempted on the next step.
15321 !
15322 ! IMXER   IWORK(16) the index of the component of largest magnitude in
15323 !                   the weighted local error vector ( E(i)/EWT(i) ),
15324 !                   on an error return with ISTATE = -4 or -5.
15325 !
15326 ! LENRW   IWORK(17) the length of RWORK actually required.
15327 !                   This is defined on normal returns and on an illegal
15328 !                   input return for insufficient storage.
15329 !
15330 ! LENIW   IWORK(18) the length of IWORK actually required.
15331 !                   This is defined on normal returns and on an illegal
15332 !                   input return for insufficient storage.
15333 !
15334 ! NNZ     IWORK(19) the number of nonzero elements in the iteration
15335 !                   matrix  P = A - con*J  (con is a constant and
15336 !                   J is the Jacobian matrix dr/dy).
15337 !
15338 ! NGP     IWORK(20) the number of groups of column indices, used in
15339 !                   difference quotient Jacobian aproximations if
15340 !                   MITER = 2.  This is also the number of extra RES
15341 !                   evaluations needed for each Jacobian evaluation.
15342 !
15343 ! NLU     IWORK(21) the number of sparse LU decompositions for the
15344 !                   problem so far. (Excludes the LU decomposition
15345 !                   necessary when ISTATE = 0.)
15346 !
15347 ! LYH     IWORK(22) the base address in RWORK of the history array YH,
15348 !                   described below in this list.
15349 !
15350 ! IPIAN   IWORK(23) the base address of the structure descriptor array
15351 !                   IAN, described below in this list.
15352 !
15353 ! IPJAN   IWORK(24) the base address of the structure descriptor array
15354 !                   JAN, described below in this list.
15355 !
15356 ! NZL     IWORK(25) the number of nonzero elements in the strict lower
15357 !                   triangle of the LU factorization used in the chord
15358 !                   iteration.
15359 !
15360 ! NZU     IWORK(26) the number of nonzero elements in the strict upper
15361 !                   triangle of the LU factorization used in the chord
15362 !                   iteration.  The total number of nonzeros in the
15363 !                   factorization is therefore NZL + NZU + NEQ.
15364 !
15365 ! The following four arrays are segments of the RWORK array which
15366 ! may also be of interest to the user as optional outputs.
15367 ! For each array, the table below gives its internal name,
15368 ! its base address, and its description.
15369 ! For YH and ACOR, the base addresses are in RWORK (a real array).
15370 ! The integer arrays IAN and JAN are to be obtained by declaring an
15371 ! integer array IWK and identifying IWK(1) with RWORK(21), using either
15372 ! an equivalence statement or a subroutine call.  Then the base
15373 ! addresses IPIAN (of IAN) and IPJAN (of JAN) in IWK are to be obtained
15374 ! as optional outputs IWORK(23) and IWORK(24), respectively.
15375 ! Thus IAN(1) is IWK(ipian), etc.
15376 !
15377 ! Name    Base Address      Description
15378 !
15379 ! IAN    IPIAN (in IWK)  structure descriptor array of size NEQ + 1.
15380 ! JAN    IPJAN (in IWK)  structure descriptor array of size NNZ.
15381 !         (see above)    IAN and JAN together describe the sparsity
15382 !                        structure of the iteration matrix
15383 !                          P = A - con*J,  as used by DLSODIS.
15384 !                        JAN contains the row indices of the nonzero
15385 !                        locations, reading in columnwise order, and
15386 !                        IAN contains the starting locations in JAN of
15387 !                        the descriptions of columns 1,...,NEQ, in
15388 !                        that order, with IAN(1) = 1.  Thus for each
15389 !                        j = 1,...,NEQ, the row indices i of the
15390 !                        nonzero locations in column j are
15391 !                        i = JAN(k),  IAN(j) .le. k .lt. IAN(j+1).
15392 !                        Note that IAN(NEQ+1) = NNZ + 1.
15393 ! YH      LYH            the Nordsieck history array, of size NYH by
15394 !          (optional     (NQCUR + 1), where NYH is the initial value
15395 !           output)      of NEQ.  For j = 0,1,...,NQCUR, column j+1
15396 !                        of YH contains HCUR**j/factorial(j) times
15397 !                        the j-th derivative of the interpolating
15398 !                        polynomial currently representing the solution,
15399 !                        evaluated at t = TCUR.  The base address LYH
15400 !                        is another optional output, listed above.
15401 !
15402 ! ACOR     LENRW-NEQ+1   array of size NEQ used for the accumulated
15403 !                        corrections on each step, scaled on output to
15404 !                        represent the estimated local error in y on the
15405 !                        last step.  This is the vector E in the
15406 !                        description of the error control. It is defined
15407 !                        only on a return from DLSODIS with ISTATE = 2.
15408 !
15409 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
15410 ! Part 2.  Other Routines Callable.
15411 !
15412 ! The following are optional calls which the user may make to
15413 ! gain additional capabilities in conjunction with DLSODIS.
15414 ! (The routines XSETUN and XSETF are designed to conform to the
15415 ! SLATEC error handling package.)
15416 !
15417 !     Form of Call                  Function
15418 !   CALL XSETUN(LUN)          Set the logical unit number, LUN, for
15419 !                             output of messages from DLSODIS, if
15420 !                             The default is not desired.
15421 !                             The default value of LUN is 6.
15422 !
15423 !   CALL XSETF(MFLAG)         Set a flag to control the printing of
15424 !                             messages by DLSODIS.
15425 !                             MFLAG = 0 means do not print. (Danger:
15426 !                             This risks losing valuable information.)
15427 !                             MFLAG = 1 means print (the default).
15428 !
15429 !                             Either of the above calls may be made at
15430 !                             any time and will take effect immediately.
15431 !
15432 !   CALL DSRCMS(RSAV,ISAV,JOB) saves and restores the contents of
15433 !                             the internal Common blocks used by
15434 !                             DLSODIS (see Part 3 below).
15435 !                             RSAV must be a real array of length 224
15436 !                             or more, and ISAV must be an integer
15437 !                             array of length 71 or more.
15438 !                             JOB=1 means save Common into RSAV/ISAV.
15439 !                             JOB=2 means restore Common from RSAV/ISAV.
15440 !                                DSRCMS is useful if one is
15441 !                             interrupting a run and restarting
15442 !                             later, or alternating between two or
15443 !                             more problems solved with DLSODIS.
15444 !
15445 !   CALL DINTDY(,,,,,)        Provide derivatives of y, of various
15446 !        (see below)          orders, at a specified point t, if
15447 !                             desired.  It may be called only after
15448 !                             a successful return from DLSODIS.
15449 !
15450 ! The detailed instructions for using DINTDY are as follows.
15451 ! The form of the call is:
15452 !
15453 !   LYH = IWORK(22)
15454 !   CALL DINTDY (T, K, RWORK(LYH), NYH, DKY, IFLAG)
15455 !
15456 ! The input parameters are:
15457 !
15458 ! T         = value of independent variable where answers are desired
15459 !             (normally the same as the T last returned by DLSODIS).
15460 !             For valid results, T must lie between TCUR - HU and TCUR.
15461 !             (See optional outputs for TCUR and HU.)
15462 ! K         = integer order of the derivative desired.  K must satisfy
15463 !             0 .le. K .le. NQCUR, where NQCUR is the current order
15464 !             (see optional outputs).  The capability corresponding
15465 !             to K = 0, i.e. computing y(t), is already provided
15466 !             by DLSODIS directly.  Since NQCUR .ge. 1, the first
15467 !             derivative dy/dt is always available with DINTDY.
15468 ! LYH       = the base address of the history array YH, obtained
15469 !             as an optional output as shown above.
15470 ! NYH       = column length of YH, equal to the initial value of NEQ.
15471 !
15472 ! The output parameters are:
15473 !
15474 ! DKY       = a real array of length NEQ containing the computed value
15475 !             of the K-th derivative of y(t).
15476 ! IFLAG     = integer flag, returned as 0 if K and T were legal,
15477 !             -1 if K was illegal, and -2 if T was illegal.
15478 !             On an error return, a message is also written.
15479 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
15480 ! Part 3.  Common Blocks.
15481 !
15482 ! If DLSODIS is to be used in an overlay situation, the user
15483 ! must declare, in the primary overlay, the variables in:
15484 !   (1) the call sequence to DLSODIS, and
15485 !   (2) the two internal Common blocks
15486 !         /DLS001/  of length  255  (218 double precision words
15487 !                      followed by 37 integer words),
15488 !         /DLSS01/  of length  40  (6 double precision words
15489 !                      followed by 34 integer words).
15490 !
15491 ! If DLSODIS is used on a system in which the contents of internal
15492 ! Common blocks are not preserved between calls, the user should
15493 ! declare the above Common blocks in the calling program to insure
15494 ! that their contents are preserved.
15495 !
15496 ! If the solution of a given problem by DLSODIS is to be interrupted
15497 ! and then later continued, such as when restarting an interrupted run
15498 ! or alternating between two or more problems, the user should save,
15499 ! following the return from the last DLSODIS call prior to the
15500 ! interruption, the contents of the call sequence variables and the
15501 ! internal Common blocks, and later restore these values before the
15502 ! next DLSODIS call for that problem.  To save and restore the Common
15503 ! blocks, use Subroutines DSRCMS (see Part 2 above).
15504 !
15505 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
15506 ! Part 4.  Optionally Replaceable Solver Routines.
15507 !
15508 ! Below are descriptions of two routines in the DLSODIS package which
15509 ! relate to the measurement of errors.  Either routine can be
15510 ! replaced by a user-supplied version, if desired.  However, since such
15511 ! a replacement may have a major impact on performance, it should be
15512 ! done only when absolutely necessary, and only with great caution.
15513 ! (Note: The means by which the package version of a routine is
15514 ! superseded by the user's version may be system-dependent.)
15515 !
15516 ! (a) DEWSET.
15517 ! The following subroutine is called just before each internal
15518 ! integration step, and sets the array of error weights, EWT, as
15519 ! described under ITOL/RTOL/ATOL above:
15520 !     SUBROUTINE DEWSET (NEQ, ITOL, RTOL, ATOL, YCUR, EWT)
15521 ! where NEQ, ITOL, RTOL, and ATOL are as in the DLSODIS call sequence,
15522 ! YCUR contains the current dependent variable vector, and
15523 ! EWT is the array of weights set by DEWSET.
15524 !
15525 ! If the user supplies this subroutine, it must return in EWT(i)
15526 ! (i = 1,...,NEQ) a positive quantity suitable for comparing errors
15527 ! in y(i) to.  The EWT array returned by DEWSET is passed to the DVNORM
15528 ! routine (see below), and also used by DLSODIS in the computation
15529 ! of the optional output IMXER, and the increments for difference
15530 ! quotient Jacobians.
15531 !
15532 ! In the user-supplied version of DEWSET, it may be desirable to use
15533 ! the current values of derivatives of y.  Derivatives up to order NQ
15534 ! are available from the history array YH, described above under
15535 ! optional outputs.  In DEWSET, YH is identical to the YCUR array,
15536 ! extended to NQ + 1 columns with a column length of NYH and scale
15537 ! factors of H**j/factorial(j).  On the first call for the problem,
15538 ! given by NST = 0, NQ is 1 and H is temporarily set to 1.0.
15539 ! NYH is the initial value of NEQ.  The quantities NQ, H, and NST
15540 ! can be obtained by including in DEWSET the statements:
15541 !     DOUBLE PRECISION RLS
15542 !     COMMON /DLS001/ RLS(218),ILS(37)
15543 !     NQ = ILS(33)
15544 !     NST = ILS(34)
15545 !     H = RLS(212)
15546 ! Thus, for example, the current value of dy/dt can be obtained as
15547 ! YCUR(NYH+i)/H  (i=1,...,NEQ)  (and the division by H is
15548 ! unnecessary when NST = 0).
15549 !
15550 ! (b) DVNORM.
15551 ! The following is a real function routine which computes the weighted
15552 ! root-mean-square norm of a vector v:
15553 !     D = DVNORM (N, V, W)
15554 ! where:
15555 !   N = the length of the vector,
15556 !   V = real array of length N containing the vector,
15557 !   W = real array of length N containing weights,
15558 !   D = SQRT( (1/N) * sum(V(i)*W(i))**2 ).
15559 ! DVNORM is called with N = NEQ and with W(i) = 1.0/EWT(i), where
15560 ! EWT is as set by Subroutine DEWSET.
15561 !
15562 ! If the user supplies this function, it should return a non-negative
15563 ! value of DVNORM suitable for use in the error control in DLSODIS.
15564 ! None of the arguments should be altered by DVNORM.
15565 ! For example, a user-supplied DVNORM routine might:
15566 !   -substitute a max-norm of (V(i)*w(I)) for the RMS-norm, or
15567 !   -ignore some components of V in the norm, with the effect of
15568 !    suppressing the error control on those components of y.
15569 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
15570 !
15571 !***REVISION HISTORY  (YYYYMMDD)
15572 ! 19820714  DATE WRITTEN
15573 ! 19830812  Major update, based on recent LSODI and LSODES revisions:
15574 !           Upgraded MDI in ODRV package: operates on M + M-transpose.
15575 !           Numerous revisions in use of work arrays;
15576 !           use wordlength ratio LENRAT; added IPISP & LRAT to Common;
15577 !           added optional outputs IPIAN/IPJAN;
15578 !           Added routine CNTNZU; added NZL and NZU to /LSS001/;
15579 !           changed ADJLR call logic; added optional outputs NZL & NZU;
15580 !           revised counter initializations; revised PREPI stmt. nos.;
15581 !           revised difference quotient increment;
15582 !           eliminated block /LSI001/, using IERPJ flag;
15583 !           revised STODI logic after PJAC return;
15584 !           revised tuning of H change and step attempts in STODI;
15585 !           corrections to main prologue and comments throughout.
15586 ! 19870320  Corrected jump on test of umax in CDRV routine.
15587 ! 20010125  Numerous revisions: corrected comments throughout;
15588 !           removed TRET from Common; rewrote EWSET with 4 loops;
15589 !           fixed t test in INTDY; added Cray directives in STODI;
15590 !           in STODI, fixed DELP init. and logic around PJAC call;
15591 !           combined routines to save/restore Common;
15592 !           passed LEVEL = 0 in error message calls (except run abort).
15593 ! 20010425  Major update: convert source lines to upper case;
15594 !           added *DECK lines; changed from 1 to * in dummy dimensions;
15595 !           changed names R1MACH/D1MACH to RUMACH/DUMACH;
15596 !           renamed routines for uniqueness across single/double prec.;
15597 !           converted intrinsic names to generic form;
15598 !           removed ILLIN and NTREP (data loaded) from Common;
15599 !           removed all 'own' variables from Common;
15600 !           changed error messages to quoted strings;
15601 !           replaced XERRWV/XERRWD with 1993 revised version;
15602 !           converted prologues, comments, error messages to mixed case;
15603 !           converted arithmetic IF statements to logical IF statements;
15604 !           numerous corrections to prologues and internal comments.
15605 ! 20010507  Converted single precision source to double precision.
15606 ! 20020502  Corrected declarations in descriptions of user routines.
15607 ! 20031021  Fixed address offset bugs in Subroutine DPREPI.
15608 ! 20031027  Changed 0. to 0.0D0 in Subroutine DPREPI.
15609 ! 20031105  Restored 'own' variables to Common blocks, to enable
15610 !           interrupt/restart feature.
15611 ! 20031112  Added SAVE statements for data-loaded constants.
15612 ! 20031117  Changed internal names NRE, LSAVR to NFE, LSAVF resp.
15613 !
15614 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
15615 ! Other routines in the DLSODIS package.
15616 !
15617 ! In addition to Subroutine DLSODIS, the DLSODIS package includes the
15618 ! following subroutines and function routines:
15619 !  DIPREPI  acts as an interface between DLSODIS and DPREPI, and also
15620 !           does adjusting of work space pointers and work arrays.
15621 !  DPREPI   is called by DIPREPI to compute sparsity and do sparse
15622 !           matrix preprocessing.
15623 !  DAINVGS  computes the initial value of the vector
15624 !             dy/dt = A-inverse * g
15625 !  ADJLR    adjusts the length of required sparse matrix work space.
15626 !           It is called by DPREPI.
15627 !  CNTNZU   is called by DPREPI and counts the nonzero elements in the
15628 !           strict upper triangle of P + P-transpose.
15629 !  JGROUP   is called by DPREPI to compute groups of Jacobian column
15630 !           indices for use when MITER = 2.
15631 !  DINTDY   computes an interpolated value of the y vector at t = TOUT.
15632 !  DSTODI   is the core integrator, which does one step of the
15633 !           integration and the associated error control.
15634 !  DCFODE   sets all method coefficients and test constants.
15635 !  DPRJIS   computes and preprocesses the Jacobian matrix J = dr/dy
15636 !           and the Newton iteration matrix P = A - h*l0*J.
15637 !  DSOLSS   manages solution of linear system in chord iteration.
15638 !  DEWSET   sets the error weight vector EWT before each step.
15639 !  DVNORM   computes the weighted RMS-norm of a vector.
15640 !  DSRCMS   is a user-callable routine to save and restore
15641 !           the contents of the internal Common blocks.
15642 !  ODRV     constructs a reordering of the rows and columns of
15643 !           a matrix by the minimum degree algorithm.  ODRV is a
15644 !           driver routine which calls Subroutines MD, MDI, MDM,
15645 !           MDP, MDU, and SRO.  See Ref. 2 for details.  (The ODRV
15646 !           module has been modified since Ref. 2, however.)
15647 !  CDRV     performs reordering, symbolic factorization, numerical
15648 !           factorization, or linear system solution operations,
15649 !           depending on a path argument IPATH.  CDRV is a
15650 !           driver routine which calls Subroutines NROC, NSFC,
15651 !           NNFC, NNSC, and NNTC.  See Ref. 3 for details.
15652 !           DLSODIS uses CDRV to solve linear systems in which the
15653 !           coefficient matrix is  P = A - con*J, where A is the
15654 !           matrix for the linear system A(t,y)*dy/dt = g(t,y),
15655 !           con is a scalar, and J is an approximation to
15656 !           the Jacobian dr/dy.  Because CDRV deals with rowwise
15657 !           sparsity descriptions, CDRV works with P-transpose, not P.
15658 !           DLSODIS also uses CDRV to solve the linear system
15659 !             A(t,y)*dy/dt = g(t,y)  for dy/dt when ISTATE = 0.
15660 !           (For this, CDRV works with A-transpose, not A.)
15661 !  DUMACH   computes the unit roundoff in a machine-independent manner.
15662 !  XERRWD, XSETUN, XSETF, IXSAV, and IUMACH  handle the printing of all
15663 !           error messages and warnings.  XERRWD is machine-dependent.
15664 ! Note:  DVNORM, DUMACH, IXSAV, and IUMACH are function routines.
15665 ! All the others are subroutines.
15666 !
15667 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
15668 EXTERNAL DPRJIS, DSOLSS
15669 DOUBLE PRECISION DUMACH, DVNORM
15670 INTEGER INIT, MXSTEP, MXHNIL, NHNIL, NSLAST, NYH, IOWNS, ICF, IERPJ, IERSL, JCUR, JSTART, KFLAG, L, LYH, LEWT
15671 INTEGER LACOR, LSAVF, LWM, LIWM, METH, MITER, MAXORD, MAXCOR, MSBP, MXNCF, N, NQ, NST, NFE, NJE, NQU
15672 INTEGER IPLOST, IESP, ISTATC, IYS, IBA, IBIAN, IBJAN, IBJGP, IPIAN, IPJAN, IPJGP, IPIGP, IPR, IPC, IPIC, IPISP
15673 INTEGER IPRSP, IPA, LENYH, LENYHM, LENWK, LREQ, LRAT, LREST, LWMIN, MOSS, MSBJ, NSLJ, NGP, NLU, NNZ, NSP, NZL, NZU
15674 INTEGER I, I1, I2, IER, IGO, IFLAG, IMAX, IMUL, IMXER, IPFLAG, IPGO, IREM, IRES, J, KGO, LENRAT, LENYHT, LENIW
15675 INTEGER LENRW, LIA, LIC, LJA, LJC, LRTEM, LWTEM, LYD0, LYHD, LYHN, MF1, MORD, MXHNL0, MXSTP0, NCOLM
15676 DOUBLE PRECISION ROWNS, CCMAX, EL0, H, HMIN, HMXI, HU, RC, TN, UROUND
15677 DOUBLE PRECISION CON0, CONMIN, CCMXJ, PSMALL, RBIG, SETH
15678 DOUBLE PRECISION ATOLI, AYI, BIG, EWTI, H0, HMAX, HMX, RH, RTOLI, TCRIT, TDIST, TNEXT, TOL, TOLSF, TP, SIZE, SUM, W0
15679 DIMENSION MORD(2)
15680 LOGICAL IHIT
15681 character(len=60) MSG
15682 SAVE LENRAT, MORD, MXSTP0, MXHNL0
15683 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
15684 ! The following two internal Common blocks contain
15685 ! (a) variables which are local to any subroutine but whose values must
15686 !     be preserved between calls to the routine ("own" variables), and
15687 ! (b) variables which are communicated between subroutines.
15688 ! The block DLS001 is declared in subroutines DLSODIS, DIPREPI, DPREPI,
15689 ! DINTDY, DSTODI, DPRJIS, and DSOLSS.  
15690 ! The block DLSS01 is declared in subroutines DLSODIS, DAINVGS,
15691 ! DIPREPI, DPREPI, DPRJIS, and DSOLSS.
15692 ! Groups of variables are replaced by dummy arrays in the Common
15693 ! declarations in routines where those variables are not used.
15694 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
15695 COMMON /DLS001/ ROWNS(209), CCMAX, EL0, H, HMIN, HMXI, HU, RC, TN, UROUND, INIT, MXSTEP, MXHNIL, NHNIL, NSLAST, NYH, &
15696 IOWNS(6), ICF, IERPJ, IERSL, JCUR, JSTART, KFLAG, L, LYH, LEWT, LACOR, LSAVF, LWM, LIWM, METH, MITER, MAXORD, MAXCOR, MSBP, &
15697 MXNCF, N, NQ, NST, NFE, NJE, NQU
15698 !
15699 COMMON /DLSS01/ CON0, CONMIN, CCMXJ, PSMALL, RBIG, SETH, IPLOST, IESP, ISTATC, IYS, IBA, IBIAN, IBJAN, IBJGP, IPIAN, IPJAN,&
15700 IPJGP, IPIGP, IPR, IPC, IPIC, IPISP, IPRSP, IPA, LENYH, LENYHM, LENWK, LREQ, LRAT, LREST, LWMIN, MOSS, MSBJ, NSLJ, NGP, &
15701 NLU, NNZ, NSP, NZL, NZU
15702 !
15703 DATA MORD(1),MORD(2)/12,5/, MXSTP0/500/, MXHNL0/10/
15704 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
15705 ! In the Data statement below, set LENRAT equal to the ratio of
15706 ! the wordlength for a real number to that for an integer.  Usually,
15707 ! LENRAT = 1 for single precision and 2 for double precision.  If the
15708 ! true ratio is not an integer, use the next smaller integer (.ge. 1),
15709 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
15710 DATA LENRAT/2/
15711 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
15712 ! Block A.
15713 ! This code block is executed on every call.
15714 ! It tests ISTATE and ITASK for legality and branches appropirately.
15715 ! If ISTATE .gt. 1 but the flag INIT shows that initialization has
15716 ! not yet been done, an error return occurs.
15717 ! If ISTATE = 0 or 1 and TOUT = T, return immediately.
15718 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
15719 IF (ISTATE .LT. 0 .OR. ISTATE .GT. 3) GOTO 601
15720 IF (ITASK .LT. 1 .OR. ITASK .GT. 5) GOTO 602
15721 IF (ISTATE .LE. 1) GOTO 10
15722 IF (INIT .EQ. 0) GOTO 603
15723 IF (ISTATE .EQ. 2) GOTO 200
15724 GOTO 20
15725 10   INIT = 0
15726 IF (TOUT .EQ. T) RETURN
15727 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
15728 ! Block B.
15729 ! The next code block is executed for the initial call (ISTATE = 0 or 1)
15730 ! or for a continuation call with parameter changes (ISTATE = 3).
15731 ! It contains checking of all inputs and various initializations.
15732 ! If ISTATE = 0 or 1, the final setting of work space pointers, the
15733 ! matrix preprocessing, and other initializations are done in Block C.
15734 !
15735 ! First check legality of the non-optional inputs NEQ, ITOL, IOPT, and
15736 ! MF.
15737 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
15738 20   IF (NEQ(1) .LE. 0) GOTO 604
15739 IF (ISTATE .LE. 1) GOTO 25
15740 IF (NEQ(1) .GT. N) GOTO 605
15741 25   N = NEQ(1)
15742 IF (ITOL .LT. 1 .OR. ITOL .GT. 4) GOTO 606
15743 IF (IOPT .LT. 0 .OR. IOPT .GT. 1) GOTO 607
15744 MOSS = MF/100
15745 MF1 = MF - 100*MOSS
15746 METH = MF1/10
15747 MITER = MF1 - 10*METH
15748 IF (MOSS .LT. 0 .OR. MOSS .GT. 4) GOTO 608
15749 IF (MITER .EQ. 2 .AND. MOSS .EQ. 1) MOSS = MOSS + 1
15750 IF (MITER .EQ. 2 .AND. MOSS .EQ. 3) MOSS = MOSS + 1
15751 IF (MITER .EQ. 1 .AND. MOSS .EQ. 2) MOSS = MOSS - 1
15752 IF (MITER .EQ. 1 .AND. MOSS .EQ. 4) MOSS = MOSS - 1
15753 IF (METH .LT. 1 .OR. METH .GT. 2) GOTO 608
15754 IF (MITER .LT. 1 .OR. MITER .GT. 2) GOTO 608
15755 ! Next process and check the optional inputs. --------------------------
15756 IF (IOPT .EQ. 1) GOTO 40
15757 MAXORD = MORD(METH)
15758 MXSTEP = MXSTP0
15759 MXHNIL = MXHNL0
15760 IF (ISTATE .LE. 1) H0 = 0.0D0
15761 HMXI = 0.0D0
15762 HMIN = 0.0D0
15763 GOTO 60
15764 40   MAXORD = IWORK(5)
15765 IF (MAXORD .LT. 0) GOTO 611
15766 IF (MAXORD .EQ. 0) MAXORD = 100
15767 MAXORD = MIN(MAXORD,MORD(METH))
15768 MXSTEP = IWORK(6)
15769 IF (MXSTEP .LT. 0) GOTO 612
15770 IF (MXSTEP .EQ. 0) MXSTEP = MXSTP0
15771 MXHNIL = IWORK(7)
15772 IF (MXHNIL .LT. 0) GOTO 613
15773 IF (MXHNIL .EQ. 0) MXHNIL = MXHNL0
15774 IF (ISTATE .GT. 1) GOTO 50
15775 H0 = RWORK(5)
15776 IF ((TOUT - T)*H0 .LT. 0.0D0) GOTO 614
15777 50   HMAX = RWORK(6)
15778 IF (HMAX .LT. 0.0D0) GOTO 615
15779 HMXI = 0.0D0
15780 IF (HMAX .GT. 0.0D0) HMXI = 1.0D0/HMAX
15781 HMIN = RWORK(7)
15782 IF (HMIN .LT. 0.0D0) GOTO 616
15783 ! Check RTOL and ATOL for legality. ------------------------------------
15784 60   RTOLI = RTOL(1)
15785 ATOLI = ATOL(1)
15786 DO 65 I = 1,N
15787 IF (ITOL .GE. 3) RTOLI = RTOL(I)
15788 IF (ITOL .EQ. 2 .OR. ITOL .EQ. 4) ATOLI = ATOL(I)
15789 IF (RTOLI .LT. 0.0D0) GOTO 619
15790 IF (ATOLI .LT. 0.0D0) GOTO 620
15791 65     CONTINUE
15792 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
15793 ! Compute required work array lengths, as far as possible, and test
15794 ! these against LRW and LIW.  Then set tentative pointers for work
15795 ! arrays.  Pointers to RWORK/IWORK segments are named by prefixing L to
15796 ! the name of the segment.  E.g., the segment YH starts at RWORK(LYH).
15797 ! Segments of RWORK (in order) are denoted  WM, YH, SAVR, EWT, ACOR.
15798 ! The required length of the matrix work space WM is not yet known,
15799 ! and so a crude minimum value is used for the initial tests of LRW
15800 ! and LIW, and YH is temporarily stored as far to the right in RWORK
15801 ! as possible, to leave the maximum amount of space for WM for matrix
15802 ! preprocessing.  Thus if MOSS .ne. 2 or 4, some of the segments of
15803 ! RWORK are temporarily omitted, as they are not needed in the
15804 ! preprocessing.  These omitted segments are: ACOR if ISTATE = 1,
15805 ! EWT and ACOR if ISTATE = 3 and MOSS = 1, and SAVR, EWT, and ACOR if
15806 ! ISTATE = 3 and MOSS = 0.
15807 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
15808 LRAT = LENRAT
15809 IF (ISTATE .LE. 1) NYH = N
15810 IF (MITER .EQ. 1) LWMIN = 4*N + 10*N/LRAT
15811 IF (MITER .EQ. 2) LWMIN = 4*N + 11*N/LRAT
15812 LENYH = (MAXORD+1)*NYH
15813 LREST = LENYH + 3*N
15814 LENRW = 20 + LWMIN + LREST
15815 IWORK(17) = LENRW
15816 LENIW = 30
15817 IF (MOSS .NE. 1 .AND. MOSS .NE. 2) LENIW = LENIW + N + 1
15818 IWORK(18) = LENIW
15819 IF (LENRW .GT. LRW) GOTO 617
15820 IF (LENIW .GT. LIW) GOTO 618
15821 LIA = 31
15822 IF (MOSS .NE. 1 .AND. MOSS .NE. 2) LENIW = LENIW + IWORK(LIA+N) - 1
15823 IWORK(18) = LENIW
15824 IF (LENIW .GT. LIW) GOTO 618
15825 LJA = LIA + N + 1
15826 LIA = MIN(LIA,LIW)
15827 LJA = MIN(LJA,LIW)
15828 LIC = LENIW + 1
15829 IF (MOSS .EQ. 0) LENIW = LENIW + N + 1
15830 IWORK(18) = LENIW
15831 IF (LENIW .GT. LIW) GOTO 618
15832 IF (MOSS .EQ. 0) LENIW =  LENIW + IWORK(LIC+N) - 1
15833 IWORK(18) = LENIW
15834 IF (LENIW .GT. LIW) GOTO 618
15835 LJC = LIC + N + 1
15836 LIC = MIN(LIC,LIW)
15837 LJC = MIN(LJC,LIW)
15838 LWM = 21
15839 IF (ISTATE .LE. 1) NQ = ISTATE
15840 NCOLM = MIN(NQ+1,MAXORD+2)
15841 LENYHM = NCOLM*NYH
15842 LENYHT = LENYHM
15843 IMUL = 2
15844 IF (ISTATE .EQ. 3) IMUL = MOSS
15845 IF (ISTATE .EQ. 3 .AND. MOSS .EQ. 3) IMUL = 1
15846 IF (MOSS .EQ. 2 .OR. MOSS .EQ. 4) IMUL = 3
15847 LRTEM = LENYHT + IMUL*N
15848 LWTEM = LRW - 20 - LRTEM
15849 LENWK = LWTEM
15850 LYHN = LWM + LWTEM
15851 LSAVF = LYHN + LENYHT
15852 LEWT = LSAVF + N
15853 LACOR = LEWT + N
15854 ISTATC = ISTATE
15855 IF (ISTATE .LE. 1) GOTO 100
15856 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
15857 ! ISTATE = 3.  Move YH to its new location.
15858 ! Note that only the part of YH needed for the next step, namely
15859 ! MIN(NQ+1,MAXORD+2) columns, is actually moved.
15860 ! A temporary error weight array EWT is loaded if MOSS = 2 or 4.
15861 ! Sparse matrix processing is done in DIPREPI/DPREPI.
15862 ! If MAXORD was reduced below NQ, then the pointers are finally set
15863 ! so that SAVR is identical to (YH*,MAXORD+2)
15864 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
15865 LYHD = LYH - LYHN
15866 IMAX = LYHN - 1 + LENYHM
15867 ! Move YH.  Move right if LYHD < 0; move left if LYHD > 0. -------------
15868 IF (LYHD .LT. 0) THEN
15869 DO 72 I = LYHN,IMAX
15870 J = IMAX + LYHN - I
15871 72       RWORK(J) = RWORK(J+LYHD)
15872 ENDIF
15873 IF (LYHD .GT. 0) THEN
15874 DO 76 I = LYHN,IMAX
15875 76       RWORK(I) = RWORK(I+LYHD)
15876 ENDIF
15877 80   LYH = LYHN
15878 IWORK(22) = LYH
15879 IF (MOSS .NE. 2 .AND. MOSS .NE. 4) GOTO 85
15880 ! Temporarily load EWT if MOSS = 2 or 4.
15881 CALL DEWSET (N,ITOL,RTOL,ATOL,RWORK(LYH),RWORK(LEWT))
15882 DO 82 I = 1,N
15883 IF (RWORK(I+LEWT-1) .LE. 0.0D0) GOTO 621
15884 82     RWORK(I+LEWT-1) = 1.0D0/RWORK(I+LEWT-1)
15885 85     CONTINUE
15886 ! DIPREPI and DPREPI do sparse matrix preprocessing. -------------------
15887 LSAVF = MIN(LSAVF,LRW)
15888 LEWT = MIN(LEWT,LRW)
15889 LACOR = MIN(LACOR,LRW)
15890 CALL DIPREPI (NEQ, Y, YDOTI, RWORK, IWORK(LIA), IWORK(LJA), IWORK(LIC), IWORK(LJC), IPFLAG, RES, JAC, ADDA)
15891 LENRW = LWM - 1 + LENWK + LREST
15892 IWORK(17) = LENRW
15893 IF (IPFLAG .NE. -1) IWORK(23) = IPIAN
15894 IF (IPFLAG .NE. -1) IWORK(24) = IPJAN
15895 IPGO = -IPFLAG + 1
15896 GOTO (90, 628, 629, 630, 631, 632, 633, 634, 634), IPGO
15897 90   IWORK(22) = LYH
15898 LYD0 = LYH + N
15899 IF (LENRW .GT. LRW) GOTO 617
15900 ! Set flag to signal changes to DSTODI.---------------------------------
15901 JSTART = -1
15902 IF (NQ .LE. MAXORD) GOTO 94
15903 ! MAXORD was reduced below NQ.  Copy YH(*,MAXORD+2) into YDOTI. --------
15904 DO 92 I = 1,N
15905 92     YDOTI(I) = RWORK(I+LSAVF-1)
15906 94   IF (N .EQ. NYH) GOTO 200
15907 ! NEQ was reduced.  Zero part of YH to avoid undefined references. -----
15908 I1 = LYH + L*NYH
15909 I2 = LYH + (MAXORD + 1)*NYH - 1
15910 IF (I1 .GT. I2) GOTO 200
15911 DO 95 I = I1,I2
15912 95     RWORK(I) = 0.0D0
15913 GOTO 200
15914 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
15915 ! Block C.
15916 ! The next block is for the initial call only (ISTATE = 0 or 1).
15917 ! It contains all remaining initializations, the call to DAINVGS
15918 ! (if ISTATE = 0), the sparse matrix preprocessing, and the
15919 ! calculation if the initial step size.
15920 ! The error weights in EWT are inverted after being loaded.
15921 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
15922 100  CONTINUE
15923 LYH = LYHN
15924 IWORK(22) = LYH
15925 TN = T
15926 NST = 0
15927 NFE = 0
15928 H = 1.0D0
15929 NNZ = 0
15930 NGP = 0
15931 NZL = 0
15932 NZU = 0
15933 ! Load the initial value vector in YH.----------------------------------
15934 DO 105 I = 1,N
15935 105    RWORK(I+LYH-1) = Y(I)
15936 IF (ISTATE .NE. 1) GOTO 108
15937 ! Initial dy/dt was supplied.  Load it into YH (LYD0 points to YH(*,2).)
15938 LYD0 = LYH + NYH
15939 DO 106 I = 1,N
15940 106    RWORK(I+LYD0-1) = YDOTI(I)
15941 108  CONTINUE
15942 ! Load and invert the EWT array.  (H is temporarily set to 1.0.)--------
15943 CALL DEWSET (N,ITOL,RTOL,ATOL,RWORK(LYH),RWORK(LEWT))
15944 DO 110 I = 1,N
15945 IF (RWORK(I+LEWT-1) .LE. 0.0D0) GOTO 621
15946 110    RWORK(I+LEWT-1) = 1.0D0/RWORK(I+LEWT-1)
15947 ! Call DIPREPI and DPREPI to do sparse matrix preprocessing.------------
15948 LACOR = MIN(LACOR,LRW)
15949 CALL DIPREPI (NEQ, Y, YDOTI, RWORK, IWORK(LIA), IWORK(LJA), IWORK(LIC), IWORK(LJC), IPFLAG, RES, JAC, ADDA)
15950 LENRW = LWM - 1 + LENWK + LREST
15951 IWORK(17) = LENRW
15952 IF (IPFLAG .NE. -1) IWORK(23) = IPIAN
15953 IF (IPFLAG .NE. -1) IWORK(24) = IPJAN
15954 IPGO = -IPFLAG + 1
15955 GOTO (115, 628, 629, 630, 631, 632, 633, 634, 634), IPGO
15956 115  IWORK(22) = LYH
15957 IF (LENRW .GT. LRW) GOTO 617
15958 ! Compute initial dy/dt, if necessary, and load it into YH.-------------
15959 LYD0 = LYH + N
15960 IF (ISTATE .NE. 0) GOTO 120
15961 CALL DAINVGS (NEQ, T, Y, RWORK(LWM), RWORK(LWM), RWORK(LACOR), RWORK(LYD0), IER, RES, ADDA)
15962 NFE = NFE + 1
15963 IGO = IER + 1
15964 GOTO (120, 565, 560, 560), IGO
15965 ! Check TCRIT for legality (ITASK = 4 or 5). ---------------------------
15966 120  CONTINUE
15967 IF (ITASK .NE. 4 .AND. ITASK .NE. 5) GOTO 125
15968 TCRIT = RWORK(1)
15969 IF ((TCRIT - TOUT)*(TOUT - T) .LT. 0.0D0) GOTO 625
15970 IF (H0 .NE. 0.0D0 .AND. (T + H0 - TCRIT)*H0 .GT. 0.0D0) H0 = TCRIT - T
15971 ! Initialize all remaining parameters. ---------------------------------
15972 125  UROUND = DUMACH()
15973 JSTART = 0
15974 RWORK(LWM) = SQRT(UROUND)
15975 NHNIL = 0
15976 NJE = 0
15977 NLU = 0
15978 NSLAST = 0
15979 HU = 0.0D0
15980 NQU = 0
15981 CCMAX = 0.3D0
15982 MAXCOR = 3
15983 MSBP = 20
15984 MXNCF = 10
15985 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
15986 ! The coding below computes the step size, H0, to be attempted on the
15987 ! first step, unless the user has supplied a value for this.
15988 ! First check that TOUT - T differs significantly from zero.
15989 ! A scalar tolerance quantity TOL is computed, as MAX(RTOL(i))
15990 ! if this is positive, or MAX(ATOL(i)/ABS(Y(i))) otherwise, adjusted
15991 ! so as to be between 100*UROUND and 1.0E-3.
15992 ! Then the computed value H0 is given by..
15993 !                                      NEQ
15994 !   H0**2 = TOL / ( w0**-2 + (1/NEQ) * Sum ( YDOT(i)/ywt(i) )**2  )
15995 !                                       1
15996 ! where   w0      = MAX ( ABS(T), ABS(TOUT) ),
15997 !         YDOT(i) = i-th component of initial value of dy/dt,
15998 !         ywt(i)  = EWT(i)/TOL  (a weight for y(i)).
15999 ! The sign of H0 is inferred from the initial values of TOUT and T.
16000 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
16001 IF (H0 .NE. 0.0D0) GOTO 180
16002 TDIST = ABS(TOUT - T)
16003 W0 = MAX(ABS(T),ABS(TOUT))
16004 IF (TDIST .LT. 2.0D0*UROUND*W0) GOTO 622
16005 TOL = RTOL(1)
16006 IF (ITOL .LE. 2) GOTO 145
16007 DO 140 I = 1,N
16008 140    TOL = MAX(TOL,RTOL(I))
16009 145  IF (TOL .GT. 0.0D0) GOTO 160
16010 ATOLI = ATOL(1)
16011 DO 150 I = 1,N
16012 IF (ITOL .EQ. 2 .OR. ITOL .EQ. 4) ATOLI = ATOL(I)
16013 AYI = ABS(Y(I))
16014 IF (AYI .NE. 0.0D0) TOL = MAX(TOL,ATOLI/AYI)
16015 150    CONTINUE
16016 160  TOL = MAX(TOL,100.0D0*UROUND)
16017 TOL = MIN(TOL,0.001D0)
16018 SUM = DVNORM (N, RWORK(LYD0), RWORK(LEWT))
16019 SUM = 1.0D0/(TOL*W0*W0) + TOL*SUM**2
16020 H0 = 1.0D0/SQRT(SUM)
16021 H0 = MIN(H0,TDIST)
16022 H0 = SIGN(H0,TOUT-T)
16023 ! Adjust H0 if necessary to meet HMAX bound. ---------------------------
16024 180  RH = ABS(H0)*HMXI
16025 IF (RH .GT. 1.0D0) H0 = H0/RH
16026 ! Load H with H0 and scale YH(*,2) by H0. ------------------------------
16027 H = H0
16028 DO 190 I = 1,N
16029 190    RWORK(I+LYD0-1) = H0*RWORK(I+LYD0-1)
16030 GOTO 270
16031 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
16032 ! Block D.
16033 ! The next code block is for continuation calls only (ISTATE = 2 or 3)
16034 ! and is to check stop conditions before taking a step.
16035 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
16036 200  NSLAST = NST
16037 GOTO (210, 250, 220, 230, 240), ITASK
16038 210  IF ((TN - TOUT)*H .LT. 0.0D0) GOTO 250
16039 CALL DINTDY (TOUT, 0, RWORK(LYH), NYH, Y, IFLAG)
16040 IF (IFLAG .NE. 0) GOTO 627
16041 T = TOUT
16042 GOTO 420
16043 220  TP = TN - HU*(1.0D0 + 100.0D0*UROUND)
16044 IF ((TP - TOUT)*H .GT. 0.0D0) GOTO 623
16045 IF ((TN - TOUT)*H .LT. 0.0D0) GOTO 250
16046 GOTO 400
16047 230  TCRIT = RWORK(1)
16048 IF ((TN - TCRIT)*H .GT. 0.0D0) GOTO 624
16049 IF ((TCRIT - TOUT)*H .LT. 0.0D0) GOTO 625
16050 IF ((TN - TOUT)*H .LT. 0.0D0) GOTO 245
16051 CALL DINTDY (TOUT, 0, RWORK(LYH), NYH, Y, IFLAG)
16052 IF (IFLAG .NE. 0) GOTO 627
16053 T = TOUT
16054 GOTO 420
16055 240  TCRIT = RWORK(1)
16056 IF ((TN - TCRIT)*H .GT. 0.0D0) GOTO 624
16057 245  HMX = ABS(TN) + ABS(H)
16058 IHIT = ABS(TN - TCRIT) .LE. 100.0D0*UROUND*HMX
16059 IF (IHIT) GOTO 400
16060 TNEXT = TN + H*(1.0D0 + 4.0D0*UROUND)
16061 IF ((TNEXT - TCRIT)*H .LE. 0.0D0) GOTO 250
16062 H = (TCRIT - TN)*(1.0D0 - 4.0D0*UROUND)
16063 IF (ISTATE .EQ. 2) JSTART = -2
16064 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
16065 ! Block E.
16066 ! The next block is normally executed for all calls and contains
16067 ! the call to the one-step core integrator DSTODI.
16068 !
16069 ! This is a looping point for the integration steps.
16070 !
16071 ! First check for too many steps being taken, update EWT (if not at
16072 ! start of problem), check for too much accuracy being requested, and
16073 ! check for H below the roundoff level in T.
16074 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
16075 250  CONTINUE
16076 IF ((NST-NSLAST) .GE. MXSTEP) GOTO 500
16077 CALL DEWSET (N, ITOL, RTOL, ATOL, RWORK(LYH), RWORK(LEWT))
16078 DO 260 I = 1,N
16079 IF (RWORK(I+LEWT-1) .LE. 0.0D0) GOTO 510
16080 260    RWORK(I+LEWT-1) = 1.0D0/RWORK(I+LEWT-1)
16081 270  TOLSF = UROUND*DVNORM (N, RWORK(LYH), RWORK(LEWT))
16082 IF (TOLSF .LE. 1.0D0) GOTO 280
16083 TOLSF = TOLSF*2.0D0
16084 IF (NST .EQ. 0) GOTO 626
16085 GOTO 520
16086 280  IF ((TN + H) .NE. TN) GOTO 290
16087 NHNIL = NHNIL + 1
16088 IF (NHNIL .GT. MXHNIL) GOTO 290
16089 MSG = 'DLSODIS- Warning..Internal T (=R1) and H (=R2) are'
16090 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 101, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
16091 MSG='      such that in the machine, T + H = T on the next step  '
16092 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 101, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
16093 MSG = '     (H = step size). Solver will continue anyway.'
16094 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 101, 0, 0, 0, 0, 2, TN, H)
16095 IF (NHNIL .LT. MXHNIL) GOTO 290
16096 MSG = 'DLSODIS- Above warning has been issued I1 times.  '
16097 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 102, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
16098 MSG = '     It will not be issued again for this problem.'
16099 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 102, 0, 1, MXHNIL, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
16100 290  CONTINUE
16101 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
16102 !     CALL DSTODI(NEQ,Y,YH,NYH,YH1,EWT,SAVF,SAVR,ACOR,WM,WM,RES,
16103 !                 ADDA,JAC,DPRJIS,DSOLSS)
16104 ! Note: SAVF in DSTODI occupies the same space as YDOTI in DLSODIS.
16105 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
16106 CALL DSTODI (NEQ, Y, RWORK(LYH), NYH, RWORK(LYH), RWORK(LEWT), YDOTI, RWORK(LSAVF), RWORK(LACOR), RWORK(LWM), RWORK(LWM), &
16107 RES, ADDA, JAC, DPRJIS, DSOLSS )
16108 KGO = 1 - KFLAG
16109 GOTO (300, 530, 540, 400, 550, 555), KGO
16110 !
16111 ! KGO = 1:success; 2:error test failure; 3:convergence failure;
16112 !       4:RES ordered return; 5:RES returned error;
16113 !       6:fatal error from CDRV via DPRJIS or DSOLSS.
16114 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
16115 ! Block F.
16116 ! The following block handles the case of a successful return from the
16117 ! core integrator (KFLAG = 0).  Test for stop conditions.
16118 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
16119 300  INIT = 1
16120 GOTO (310, 400, 330, 340, 350), ITASK
16121 ! ITASK = 1.  If TOUT has been reached, interpolate. -------------------
16122 310  iF ((TN - TOUT)*H .LT. 0.0D0) GOTO 250
16123 CALL DINTDY (TOUT, 0, RWORK(LYH), NYH, Y, IFLAG)
16124 T = TOUT
16125 GOTO 420
16126 ! ITASK = 3.  Jump to exit if TOUT was reached. ------------------------
16127 330  IF ((TN - TOUT)*H .GE. 0.0D0) GOTO 400
16128 GOTO 250
16129 ! ITASK = 4.  See if TOUT or TCRIT was reached.  Adjust H if necessary.
16130 340  IF ((TN - TOUT)*H .LT. 0.0D0) GOTO 345
16131 CALL DINTDY (TOUT, 0, RWORK(LYH), NYH, Y, IFLAG)
16132 T = TOUT
16133 GOTO 420
16134 345  HMX = ABS(TN) + ABS(H)
16135 IHIT = ABS(TN - TCRIT) .LE. 100.0D0*UROUND*HMX
16136 IF (IHIT) GOTO 400
16137 TNEXT = TN + H*(1.0D0 + 4.0D0*UROUND)
16138 IF ((TNEXT - TCRIT)*H .LE. 0.0D0) GOTO 250
16139 H = (TCRIT - TN)*(1.0D0 - 4.0D0*UROUND)
16140 JSTART = -2
16141 GOTO 250
16142 ! ITASK = 5.  See if TCRIT was reached and jump to exit. ---------------
16143 350  HMX = ABS(TN) + ABS(H)
16144 IHIT = ABS(TN - TCRIT) .LE. 100.0D0*UROUND*HMX
16145 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
16146 ! Block G.
16147 ! The following block handles all successful returns from DLSODIS.
16148 ! if ITASK .ne. 1, Y is loaded from YH and T is set accordingly.
16149 ! ISTATE is set to 2, and the optional outputs are loaded into the
16150 ! work arrays before returning.
16151 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
16152 400  DO 410 I = 1,N
16153 410    Y(I) = RWORK(I+LYH-1)
16154 T = TN
16155 IF (ITASK .NE. 4 .AND. ITASK .NE. 5) GOTO 420
16156 IF (IHIT) T = TCRIT
16157 420  ISTATE = 2
16158 IF ( KFLAG .EQ. -3 )  ISTATE = 3
16159 RWORK(11) = HU
16160 RWORK(12) = H
16161 RWORK(13) = TN
16162 IWORK(11) = NST
16163 IWORK(12) = NFE
16164 IWORK(13) = NJE
16165 IWORK(14) = NQU
16166 IWORK(15) = NQ
16167 IWORK(19) = NNZ
16168 IWORK(20) = NGP
16169 IWORK(21) = NLU
16170 IWORK(25) = NZL
16171 IWORK(26) = NZU
16172 RETURN
16173 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
16174 ! Block H.
16175 ! The following block handles all unsuccessful returns other than
16176 ! those for illegal input.  First the error message routine is called.
16177 ! If there was an error test or convergence test failure, IMXER is set.
16178 ! Then Y is loaded from YH and T is set to TN.
16179 ! The optional outputs are loaded into the work arrays before returning.
16180 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
16181 ! The maximum number of steps was taken before reaching TOUT. ----------
16182 500  MSG = 'DLSODIS- At current T (=R1), MXSTEP (=I1) steps   '
16183 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 201, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
16184 MSG = '      taken on this call before reaching TOUT     '
16185 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 201, 0, 1, MXSTEP, 0, 1, TN, 0.0D0)
16186 ISTATE = -1
16187 GOTO 580
16188 ! EWT(i) .le. 0.0 for some i (not at start of problem). ----------------
16189 510  EWTI = RWORK(LEWT+I-1)
16190 MSG = 'DLSODIS- At T (=R1), EWT(I1) has become R2 .le. 0.'
16191 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 202, 0, 1, I, 0, 2, TN, EWTI)
16192 ISTATE = -6
16193 GOTO 590
16194 ! Too much accuracy requested for machine precision. -------------------
16195 520  MSG = 'DLSODIS- At T (=R1), too much accuracy requested  '
16196 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 203, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
16197 MSG = '      for precision of machine..  See TOLSF (=R2) '
16198 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 203, 0, 0, 0, 0, 2, TN, TOLSF)
16199 RWORK(14) = TOLSF
16200 ISTATE = -2
16201 GOTO 590
16202 ! KFLAG = -1.  Error test failed repeatedly or with ABS(H) = HMIN. -----
16203 530  MSG = 'DLSODIS- At T (=R1) and step size H (=R2), the    '
16204 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 204, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
16205 MSG='     error test failed repeatedly or with ABS(H) = HMIN     '
16206 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 204, 0, 0, 0, 0, 2, TN, H)
16207 ISTATE = -4
16208 GOTO 570
16209 ! KFLAG = -2.  Convergence failed repeatedly or with ABS(H) = HMIN. ----
16210 540  MSG = 'DLSODIS- At T (=R1) and step size H (=R2), the    '
16211 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 205, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
16212 MSG = '      corrector convergence failed repeatedly     '
16213 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 205, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
16214 MSG = '      or with ABS(H) = HMIN   '
16215 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 205, 0, 0, 0, 0, 2, TN, H)
16216 ISTATE = -5
16217 GOTO 570
16218 ! IRES = 3 returned by RES, despite retries by DSTODI. -----------------
16219 550  MSG = 'DLSODIS- At T (=R1) residual routine returned     '
16220 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 206, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
16221 MSG = '    error IRES = 3 repeatedly.'
16222 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 206, 1, 0, 0, 0, 0, TN, 0.0D0)
16223 ISTATE = -7
16224 GOTO 590
16225 ! KFLAG = -5.  Fatal error flag returned by DPRJIS or DSOLSS (CDRV). ---
16226 555  MSG = 'DLSODIS- At T (=R1) and step size H (=R2), a fatal'
16227 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 207, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
16228 MSG = '      error flag was returned by CDRV (by way of  '
16229 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 207, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
16230 MSG = '      Subroutine DPRJIS or DSOLSS)      '
16231 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 40, 207, 0, 0, 0, 0, 2, TN, H)
16232 ISTATE = -9
16233 GOTO 580
16234 ! DAINVGS failed because matrix A was singular. ------------------------
16235 560  MSG='DLSODIS- Attempt to initialize dy/dt failed because matrix A'
16236 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 208, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
16237 MSG='     was singular.  CDRV returned zero pivot error flag.    '
16238 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 208, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
16239 MSG = 'DAINVGS set its error flag to IER = (I1)'
16240 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 40, 208, 0, 1, IER, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
16241 ISTATE = -8
16242 RETURN
16243 ! DAINVGS failed because RES set IRES to 2 or 3. -----------------------
16244 565  MSG = 'DLSODIS- Attempt to initialize dy/dt failed       '
16245 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 209, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
16246 MSG = '      because residual routine set its error flag '
16247 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 209, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
16248 MSG = '      to IRES = (I1)'
16249 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 20, 209, 0, 1, IER, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
16250 ISTATE = -8
16251 RETURN
16252 ! Compute IMXER if relevant. -------------------------------------------
16253 570  BIG = 0.0D0
16254 IMXER = 1
16255 DO 575 I = 1,N
16256 SIZE = ABS(RWORK(I+LACOR-1)*RWORK(I+LEWT-1))
16257 IF (BIG .GE. SIZE) GOTO 575
16258 BIG = SIZE
16259 IMXER = I
16260 575    CONTINUE
16261 IWORK(16) = IMXER
16262 ! Compute residual if relevant. ----------------------------------------
16263 580  LYD0 = LYH + NYH
16264 DO 585  I = 1, N
16265 RWORK(I+LSAVF-1) = RWORK(I+LYD0-1) / H
16266 585     Y(I) = RWORK(I+LYH-1)
16267 IRES = 1
16268 CALL RES (NEQ, TN, Y, RWORK(LSAVF), YDOTI, IRES)
16269 NFE = NFE + 1
16270 IF ( IRES .LE. 1 )  GOTO 595
16271 MSG = 'DLSODIS- Residual routine set its flag IRES       '
16272 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 210, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
16273 MSG = '      to (I1) when called for final output.       '
16274 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 210, 0, 1, IRES, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
16275 GOTO 595
16276 ! set y vector, t, and optional outputs. -------------------------------
16277 590  DO 592 I = 1,N
16278 592    Y(I) = RWORK(I+LYH-1)
16279 595  T = TN
16280 RWORK(11) = HU
16281 RWORK(12) = H
16282 RWORK(13) = TN
16283 IWORK(11) = NST
16284 IWORK(12) = NFE
16285 IWORK(13) = NJE
16286 IWORK(14) = NQU
16287 IWORK(15) = NQ
16288 IWORK(19) = NNZ
16289 IWORK(20) = NGP
16290 IWORK(21) = NLU
16291 IWORK(25) = NZL
16292 IWORK(26) = NZU
16293 RETURN
16294 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
16295 ! Block I.
16296 ! The following block handles all error returns due to illegal input
16297 ! (ISTATE = -3), as detected before calling the core integrator.
16298 ! First the error message routine is called.  If the illegal input
16299 ! is a negative ISTATE, the run is aborted (apparent infinite loop).
16300 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
16301 601  MSG = 'DLSODIS- ISTATE (=I1) illegal.'
16302 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 1, 0, 1, ISTATE, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
16303 IF (ISTATE .LT. 0) GOTO 800
16304 GOTO 700
16305 602  MSG = 'DLSODIS- ITASK (=I1) illegal. '
16306 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 2, 0, 1, ITASK, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
16307 GOTO 700
16308 603  MSG = 'DLSODIS-ISTATE .gt. 1 but DLSODIS not initialized.'
16309 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 3, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
16310 GOTO 700
16311 604  MSG = 'DLSODIS- NEQ (=I1) .lt. 1     '
16312 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 4, 0, 1, NEQ(1), 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
16313 GOTO 700
16314 605  MSG = 'DLSODIS- ISTATE = 3 and NEQ increased (I1 to I2). '
16315 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 5, 0, 2, N, NEQ(1), 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
16316 GOTO 700
16317 606  MSG = 'DLSODIS- ITOL (=I1) illegal.  '
16318 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 6, 0, 1, ITOL, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
16319 GOTO 700
16320 607  MSG = 'DLSODIS- IOPT (=I1) illegal.  '
16321 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 7, 0, 1, IOPT, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
16322 GOTO 700
16323 608  MSG = 'DLSODIS- MF (=I1) illegal.    '
16324 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 8, 0, 1, MF, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
16325 GOTO 700
16326 611  MSG = 'DLSODIS- MAXORD (=I1) .lt. 0  '
16327 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 11, 0, 1, MAXORD, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
16328 GOTO 700
16329 612  MSG = 'DLSODIS- MXSTEP (=I1) .lt. 0  '
16330 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 12, 0, 1, MXSTEP, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
16331 GOTO 700
16332 613  MSG = 'DLSODIS- MXHNIL (=I1) .lt. 0  '
16333 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 13, 0, 1, MXHNIL, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
16334 GOTO 700
16335 614  MSG = 'DLSODIS- TOUT (=R1) behind T (=R2)      '
16336 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 40, 14, 0, 0, 0, 0, 2, TOUT, T)
16337 MSG = '      Integration direction is given by H0 (=R1)  '
16338 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 14, 0, 0, 0, 0, 1, H0, 0.0D0)
16339 GOTO 700
16340 615  MSG = 'DLSODIS- HMAX (=R1) .lt. 0.0  '
16341 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 15, 0, 0, 0, 0, 1, HMAX, 0.0D0)
16342 GOTO 700
16343 616  MSG = 'DLSODIS- HMIN (=R1) .lt. 0.0  '
16344 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 16, 0, 0, 0, 0, 1, HMIN, 0.0D0)
16345 GOTO 700
16346 617  MSG = 'DLSODIS- RWORK length is insufficient to proceed. '
16347 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 17, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
16348 MSG='        Length needed is .ge. LENRW (=I1), exceeds LRW (=I2)'
16349 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 17, 0, 2, LENRW, LRW, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
16350 GOTO 700
16351 618  MSG = 'DLSODIS- IWORK length is insufficient to proceed. '
16352 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 18, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
16353 MSG='        Length needed is .ge. LENIW (=I1), exceeds LIW (=I2)'
16354 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 18, 0, 2, LENIW, LIW, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
16355 GOTO 700
16356 619  MSG = 'DLSODIS- RTOL(=I1) is R1 .lt. 0.0       '
16357 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 40, 19, 0, 1, I, 0, 1, RTOLI, 0.0D0)
16358 GOTO 700
16359 620  MSG = 'DLSODIS- ATOL(=I1) is R1 .lt. 0.0       '
16360 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 40, 20, 0, 1, I, 0, 1, ATOLI, 0.0D0)
16361 GOTO 700
16362 621  EWTI = RWORK(LEWT+I-1)
16363 MSG = 'DLSODIS- EWT(I1) is R1 .le. 0.0         '
16364 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 40, 21, 0, 1, I, 0, 1, EWTI, 0.0D0)
16365 GOTO 700
16366 622  MSG='DLSODIS- TOUT(=R1) too close to T(=R2) to start integration.'
16367 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 22, 0, 0, 0, 0, 2, TOUT, T)
16368 GOTO 700
16369 623  MSG='DLSODIS- ITASK = I1 and TOUT (=R1) behind TCUR - HU (= R2)  '
16370 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 23, 0, 1, ITASK, 0, 2, TOUT, TP)
16371 GOTO 700
16372 624  MSG='DLSODIS- ITASK = 4 or 5 and TCRIT (=R1) behind TCUR (=R2)   '
16373 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 24, 0, 0, 0, 0, 2, TCRIT, TN)
16374 GOTO 700
16375 625  MSG='DLSODIS- ITASK = 4 or 5 and TCRIT (=R1) behind TOUT (=R2)   '
16376 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 25, 0, 0, 0, 0, 2, TCRIT, TOUT)
16377 GOTO 700
16378 626  MSG = 'DLSODIS- At start of problem, too much accuracy   '
16379 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 26, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
16380 MSG='      requested for precision of machine..  See TOLSF (=R1) '
16381 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 26, 0, 0, 0, 0, 1, TOLSF, 0.0D0)
16382 RWORK(14) = TOLSF
16383 GOTO 700
16384 627  MSG = 'DLSODIS- Trouble in DINTDY.  ITASK = I1, TOUT = R1'
16385 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 27, 0, 1, ITASK, 0, 1, TOUT, 0.0D0)
16386 GOTO 700
16387 628  MSG='DLSODIS- RWORK length insufficient (for Subroutine DPREPI). '
16388 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 28, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
16389 MSG='        Length needed is .ge. LENRW (=I1), exceeds LRW (=I2)'
16390 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 28, 0, 2, LENRW, LRW, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
16391 GOTO 700
16392 629  MSG='DLSODIS- RWORK length insufficient (for Subroutine JGROUP). '
16393 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 29, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
16394 MSG='        Length needed is .ge. LENRW (=I1), exceeds LRW (=I2)'
16395 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 29, 0, 2, LENRW, LRW, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
16396 GOTO 700
16397 630  MSG='DLSODIS- RWORK length insufficient (for Subroutine ODRV).   '
16398 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 30, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
16399 MSG='        Length needed is .ge. LENRW (=I1), exceeds LRW (=I2)'
16400 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 30, 0, 2, LENRW, LRW, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
16401 GOTO 700
16402 631  MSG='DLSODIS- Error from ODRV in Yale Sparse Matrix Package.     '
16403 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 31, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
16404 IMUL = (IYS - 1)/N
16405 IREM = IYS - IMUL*N
16406 MSG='      At T (=R1), ODRV returned error flag = I1*NEQ + I2.   '
16407 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 31, 0, 2, IMUL, IREM, 1, TN, 0.0D0)
16408 GOTO 700
16409 632  MSG='DLSODIS- RWORK length insufficient (for Subroutine CDRV).   '
16410 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 32, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
16411 MSG='        Length needed is .ge. LENRW (=I1), exceeds LRW (=I2)'
16412 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 32, 0, 2, LENRW, LRW, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
16413 GOTO 700
16414 633  MSG='DLSODIS- Error from CDRV in Yale Sparse Matrix Package.     '
16415 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 33, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
16416 IMUL = (IYS - 1)/N
16417 IREM = IYS - IMUL*N
16418 MSG='      At T (=R1), CDRV returned error flag = I1*NEQ + I2.   '
16419 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 33, 0, 2, IMUL, IREM, 1, TN, 0.0D0)
16420 IF (IMUL .EQ. 2) THEN
16421 MSG='        Duplicate entry in sparsity structure descriptors.  '
16422 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 33, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
16423 ENDIF
16424 IF (IMUL .EQ. 3 .OR. IMUL .EQ. 6) THEN
16425 MSG='        Insufficient storage for NSFC (called by CDRV).     '
16426 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 33, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
16427 ENDIF
16428 GOTO 700
16429 634  MSG='DLSODIS- At T (=R1) residual routine (called by DPREPI)     '
16430 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 60, 34, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
16431 IER = -IPFLAG - 5
16432 MSG = '     returned error IRES (=I1)'
16433 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 30, 34, 0, 1, IER, 0, 1, TN, 0.0D0)
16434 !
16435 700  ISTATE = -3
16436 RETURN
16437 !
16438 800  MSG = 'DLSODIS- Run aborted.. apparent infinite loop.    '
16439 CALL XERRWD (MSG, 50, 303, 2, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.0D0, 0.0D0)
16440 RETURN
16441 !----------------------- End of Subroutine DLSODIS ---------------------
16442 END
16443 
16444

Generated on Thu Apr 24 2014 for Nautilus by  1.7.4
